Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: ellie188
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here over the weekend, the hotel was very busy & there was a good atmosphere. The room we were in on the 6th floor was very quiet & comfy beds (pillows were not great for me) The lobby fish tank is actually par of the sea life centre next door so you have to pay to get on the lift that takes you up the middle but it looks very impressive when you are in the lift. The hotel is is a great location for all the sights & close to the Alexander Platz area where there is a train to the airport. Breakfast was lovely, the chef was always around topping up the food which I though was really good to see. Lovely pool & spa that's open till 10pm which is great after a long day sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BW2_2_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a 3 night Berlin city break and the location was perfect. Most sights were within walking distance of the hotel plus it was also in walking distant for the airport express S station. It is a lovely modern hotel with good size rooms and house keeping was excellent. Free wifi was appreciated but one disappointment as ours was a standard room, no coffee/tea making equipment. Would certainly stay again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Cool lobby, great views, ideal for tourist sites”
Reviews.Author: cycman
Reviews.Content: The best things about this hotel are the location (right in the historic section), the amazing round aquarium that shoots up through the center of the lobby, the comfortable beds and the front desk staff and manager. If you can, spend a little extra and opt for a room (such as a business class one) with a view of the river and the Berlin Cathedral. I took one of these, not super spacious, but comfortable enough and a wonderful view. The only things could have been better during my stay were the tiny fitness center and their management, the overflow breakfast seating (in a conference room) over the busy Easter weekend, and not being able to check into the room until after 2pm. I was dead tired and really just wanted a bed. I also found the connoisseur a bit hidden off to one side... perhaps it would be better to move him/her to a more noticeable place? At any rate, a great stay and would easily book again.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay”
Reviews.Author: Natd14
Reviews.Content: If you want to see Berlin the Radisson Blue Is a fantastic location. In the heart of Berlin's center of sights you can walk everywhere. Our Stay in April is one we will never forget

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in every way.”
Reviews.Author: Johnew
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with my wife for three nights. Friendly, efficient staff. Immaculate wellness area with a really cool counter-current in the pool. Rooms very clean and modern. Location is excellent - lots of Berlin is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “PAMPER YOURSELF !”
Reviews.Author: renzoGenova
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Radisson blu in Aprile 2012, great experience in a wonderful hotel.When we arrived in the afternoon the process of checking in was quick and efficient.Fully furnished rooms, even a Nespresso coffee machine .Location: you could not require a better one, right in the heart of Berlin , close to tram and buses; short walk to Museum Island.Opposite the hotel there is a park and beyond it an area packed with restaurants of all sort . The area is called Nikolaiviertel.Sumptuous breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HOLIDAYBUG1970
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel - can't say more than that . Would stay there again. I also stayed in the Meila while in Berlin - very nice and for my trip a better location

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay- would both recommend and return.”
Reviews.Author: Alexander K
Reviews.Content: Took my wife for 4 days in Feb for our anniversary. I mentioned this to them after calling to confirm the booking and they first upgraded us to a slightly larger room but it was the view which was nicer. left a bottle of sparkling wine in an ice-bucket with a card. Sweet. Very nice quiet modern room, nice view, good sized bathroom/ wc. The terrace, on which you could have your breakfast on depending on the weather, had a lovely view over the river towards the Museum Insel where the bust of Nefertiti is housed. Unique with its' centrally-located 1 million litre aquarium which encloses a lift. Be warned, however, the aquarium/ lift belongs to the Seaworld chain which is located on the opposite side of the block and requires a separate ticket and actually has nothing per se to do with the hotel. The lobby bar is comfortable enough with a great selection of snacks and drinks. Unfortunately, we weren't there when the piano bar was going. Great staff particularly the bar staff and room service. The club sandwiches at 3am after a night out at the Cabaret were a Godsend!!! The spa/ pool rooms aren't massive but large enough and again, the attentive and diligent staff made all the difference. Concierge, reception, chamberstaff, etc - were all fantastic! The restaurant Heat is a great fusion of Western, German and Asian dishes which have, in my opinion, blended quite a unique selection of kitchens. Only criticisms: the pillows were too soft and the pool closes at 10pm instead of open 24hrs!!! All in all a lovely stay, nice 5-star standard experience, perhaps return with the kids next time! Thank you for helping make our stay in Berlin a comfortable, interesting and restful one!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence with a unique attraction in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Lee M
Reviews.Content: To not mention the aquarium would be a crime - the cylindrical fish tank forms the main attraction of the hotel and is to be seen from every corridor, atrium and many of the rooms that look into the inside lobby. It is astounding too, even though it does appear smaller in real life than in the pictures, it is still immensely large with hundreds of fish swarming around it at most hours. It really does form the centerpiece of the hotel and possible the Radisson Blu chain too. The hotel itself though is excellent. Ultra-modern, clean, intuitively-designed rooms with great functional bathrooms, AC (not loud) and opening windows, some of which have a beautiful view on the impressive Berlin cathedral just over the Spree. If you're lucky enough to get a room facing the aquarium (which I didn't want due to my preference of only natural light by day) you'll be able to gaze at the fish for hours. The small pool in the basement is clean-cut, simple and usually fairly empty and there are good changing facilities, free towel use (ones that get hot on contact!) and much more. Reception staff were very friendly, as were all of the other members of staff we spoke to including a particularly friendly doorman who provided us with his inside knowledge of the city he lives in to quickly locate the things we wanted to see. Although we didn't eat at the restaurant, the environment was very attractive. A glass facade facing the River Spree, the Berliner Dom and the UNESCO world-heritage site of the Museum Island. The offer of food was very good with as many salami, ham, cheese, egg, cereal, bread, yoghurt, fruit and more varieties than I've seen elsewhere for more money and just as many stars. Particularly notable about the hotel is its location. Although the complex seems set back into an old building with very little visible facade on the main street, it is located next door to the Berliner Dom, just a few minutes walk to Alexanderplatz and literally two minutes from all of the Museumsinsel attractions. The Hackische Höfe are very close and serve as one of the nearest U-Bahn stations. Friedrichshain, Kreuzberg and the other Western-Berlin attractions are a fair way off but easily reachable by S and U-Bahns alike. Shopping is closeby with a wide array of retailers within 15 minutes walk including drugstores, supermarkets, fashion and department stores. Restaurants are a plenty and so are pubs, bars and restaurants. A definite, comfortable, modern but humble retreat in the otherwise hectic, alternative and lively city of Berlin. A firm recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FirstLast34
Reviews.Content: Very impressive hotel, including the aquarium in the centre. Stopped in a club room, which had a small balcony over looking the river. Great for a morning nespresso. Hotel central with bus and tram services on the door step. Great spa services (although did not use pool), and amazing breakfast. Although one morning i was put outside the main room which was not the same.

Reviews.Title: “Now that's a great view!”
Reviews.Author: daldelmar
Reviews.Content: If you've gone online to look at the Radisson Blu's website, you'll know I'm writing about the aquarium. This is a huge cylinder in the center of the lobby that has 1500 fish. And some of them are big (the blue-lipped humphead wrasse for instance). Our room had a view of this and it's exactly what you want to go to sleep with and what you want to wake up to. It is incredibly beautiful. I have traveled to water places all my life, tropical islands, tropical beaches, etc. But this is in central Berlin. Wonderful to see. And the hotel is in central Berlin--did I say that? You can get a room with a view of the big Dom (really, not as good as the fish). The rooms are very comfortable, a good size and thoughtfully done. I would have marked this down a notch for the 25 euro breakfast which is a clear rip-off. But go down the street to the Kaiser (really?) market and get your breakfast stuff and you'll have a great life.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for our weekend museum trip.”
Reviews.Author: dehetoxic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for our weekend museum trip to Berlin. We arrived early at 10.30am to be greeted by very friendly and helpful staff and a huge aquarium in the lobby, were impressive! Our room were upgraded to the business class floor due to our elite status with club carlson. The was very really nice with the view of the cathedral and Berlin tower, it as well had all the facilities you would expect. Shower water pressure was amazing and the linen and towels were great. The location is ideal for anywhere if you are visiting the museums. We walked to the museums island and back from our hotel, and it would be an ideal walk further up towards the Alexanderplantz, where you can catch any trains to anywhere in Berlin. Incredible buffet breakfast I must add. We really couldn't fault the hotel in any way. We were most pleasantly surprised at the high standard of the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, very good service”
Reviews.Author: UziTelAviv
Reviews.Content: Location could not be better, between Alexanderplatz and Hackscher Markt. Arrived before 11 am, and got an early checkin as requested. Very nice and clean room, reasonable price (starting at 160 euro/night). The giant 6-storey fish tank in the lobby is quite an eye catcher. Stayed there last year too, and will probably do so next time I visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “First Impressions Last”
Reviews.Author: Nicole A
Reviews.Content: We had no reservations when arriving Berlin, but had done a little homework at least. Upon arrival we were impressed by not only the giant fish tank, but the friendly and helpful staff as well. They were able to give us a "staff" (airline) rate which was very affordable, and we upgraded our room which also included breakfast, and wi-fi. Our room was clean, modern, and had a lovely view! Oh, and we had a nespresso machine! Love! The only downside was the two twin beds pushed together to make a king bed, however, that is not uncommon, and I do not think it is necessary to lower the rating because of that. You should just be aware, and also be aware of amenities that are different in other countries. The breakfast buffet in the morning was INCREDIBLE!! Nothing like what you find in the states, but we loved it! It was also a life saver considering we woke up at the crack of dawn starving. On my way out I would take a little package of nutella, crakers, and an apple to put in my bag for the day. Over all the hotel was clean, centrally located, had great breakfast, and the staff was friendly and more than helpful! They even helped me find an urgent care center on a Saturday! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A very good and decent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Sindhwani
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel during ITB Berlin fair, the rooms are decent and good view. The breakfast at restaurant heat was good and the service was excellent. The reception staff was average sometimes. The bell desk and concierge was very helpful all the time. The business rooms are good also a complimentary coffee machine and iron board, the internet was free in all the rooms and its very good in speed. Overall a very decent hotel to stay with good ambience and service

Reviews.Title: “Great location, contemporary, great staff”
Reviews.Author: shermanndennis
Reviews.Content: I had nothing to complain about this hotel! Real dramatic awe inspiring entrance with the Aquarium in the reception/bar area...WOW This creates a real chilled, calm atmosphere. The room had a fabulous view of the Dom and we even had a celeb next door to us to add to the excitement. Breakfast was amazing-the best I've had. Also, the best Mojitos made by Dian in the Bar (and we''ve been to Cuba!!) All the staff are helpful and friendly and assist you with a map and happy to point you in the right direction. This had young people, couples and families, so great for anyone. Great room service, food in restaurant is amazing, they have a clay oven so wonderful curry dishes. I wouls recommend anyone and visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Blu Berlin. Nice place”
Reviews.Author: DENNISSG
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to arrive to, especially after a long plane ride with flight changes... Easy access via the Airport bus almost right to the front door. Helpful doormen (hey.. it gets tips, right?), efficient Front Desk, easy check in process. Our room for five nights was very comfortable. Breakfast buffet was very rich, but... for the rich. Extremely expensive, but there are quite a few coffee shops with sandwiches and baked goods literally next door to the Hotel or within a two minute walk. Location was excellent: you can walk to most of the Berlin Historical sites. Potsdammer Platz and K'dam are but a tram ride away , but still walkable. Location is right on the Spree, next to the Berliner Dom. We were fortunate to be there during the October light festival, and the area was turned magical with the lovely colorful lights. In short: a good place to stay, with all the Western conveniences. I believe that the rooms had free wi-fi, to boot! There was a multi-story Aquarium in the atrium. Great to watch and relax to...

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: JNA2011
Reviews.Content: I wanted someplace convenient for touring (the former) East Berlin and this worked well. Reasonable walking distance to most of the "must do's" and two locations for weekend markets. The room is pretty standard size/layout for European hotels, clean, modern, and well-kept. The huge aquarium and lobby bar are nice features. Did not use the spa, but saw a number of couples in bathrobes heading down for treatments, so I'll guess it's pretty good. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: capecoraljay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for the Berlin traveller. Its central location makes it easy to get around the city. The rooms are well appointed and maintained. We had a junior suite with a nice view of the cathedral. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom impeccable. We enjoyed a nice meal at the restaurant and a night cap at the bar. All was of good quality and service. We had our breakfast delivered to our room and it was delicious. Of course, the atrium with the aquarium is spectacular. A great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: erny74
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a perfect positioning for the tourist. Museum Island, Alexander Platz, Unter den Linden are all 5 minutes walk from hotel. The astonishing aquarium in the hall is really nice and gives a special touch to the place. Unfortunately the above are the only positive things of this hotel. The rooms have a good size but the bathrooms are small and simple. The style of the furniture (design type) tries to mask what is in reality a cheap way to furnish a room. The heating did not work properly and in 3 days it has not been repaired. There were no slippers nor bathrobes in the room, and nobody showed for the night remake of the beds/room all things that should be included in a 5 star offer. Our room was facing the opposite building, not a nice place to look at. The staff did not do anything to make us feel "at home" always "cold" and never really well mannered. At the end not a stay I would raccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stefaan1966
Reviews.Content: Great location. Clean rooms. Impressive lobby. Friendly staff. Good food. Splendid breakfast buffet. No complaints. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “good location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mike P
Reviews.Content: Good location in one of the more civilised parts of town. Avoid public transport in Berlin unless you like to meet drunks in tracksuits (in the early afternoon!) taxis are cheap here. The lobby area is nice - the enormous fish tank is quite an eye catcher. I stayed here two times - the second time I had an atrium room; avoid those if you can as they no outside windows which means no natural light and no fresh air, only air con. Both rooms were quite small, but then again the rate was very low for a Radission in a capital city. Breakfast is nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: BigPicture53
Reviews.Content: To stroll down the Unter den Linden to the Tiergarten is to walk through history - it's overwhelming. The hotel is perfectly located for all things Berlin and it's location is complimented by its modern, comfortable and stylish infrastructure , facilities and service. Berlin starts here.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need and more...”
Reviews.Author: sarah_duffield
Reviews.Content: Hi, i recently stayed at the hotel and loved every moment from the beautiful fish tank in the lobby to the delicious breakfast! The rooms are quiet and comfy and the staff are friendly and attentive....special thanks to Alex for looking after me! I will be back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable business hotel, with great service”
Reviews.Author: Jim90068
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here after a several year absence from Berlin. it is superbly located, across the river from the Berliner Dom, the restored Cathedral, built by Hollenzollerns. The crypt has the tombs of many of the Royalty that ruled Prussia and Germany. The hotel is close by the Alexanderplatz, the Hackesher Market, in the heart of Mitte, formerly East Berlin. In nice weather it is a great walk past Museum Island, Humboldt University and down Unter Der Linden to the Brandenburg Gate. about the hotel - it is large but efficient. It hosts groups, but it doesn't affect the front desk, dining and bar areas, etc. A striking feature is the large cylindrical aquarium that stretches to the top of the atrium. my room was nicely outfitted, with a great bed, down duvets and many pillows. There was decent closet space with built in hangars and shelves. The negative is the lack of any night light in the very blacked out room, and a number of doorways with sharp edges. I hit my head in the dark, with a minor gash to my forehead. Despite that, my stay was serene and comfortable, with reasonable rates during a period that many hotels had upped their rates significantly and were too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: Location is pretty good -- I had a view of the Berlin cathedral from my small balcony -- but not totally central. With the exception of Alexanderplatz, you'll probably spend all your time west of the hotel. Coming on the S-train, get off at Hackescher Markt‎ (not Alexanderplatz) for a shorter walk

Reviews.Title: “Sleek & modern.....”
Reviews.Author: dancingisfun
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 3 nights in Jan in a business class room overlooking the River Spreee & Cathedral. As most people have mentioned, the lobby is quite spectacular with the aquarium & it's fish providing a big wow on arrival & many more contented moments sat watching whilst sipping a nice cold beer !! Aside from that, this hotel is well located for many of the Berlin sights- it was a pleasant stroll to Alexanderplatz and the TV tower & right next door to some of the art museums. We also used the hop on/off tour bus & there is a stop right outside the hotel, which was fab. We had breakfast included in our room rate, which was well worth it ;the whole cheeseboard selection & smoked salmon was enough to keep me happy, but there was plenty more to choose from & even my hubby (who is normally a little disappointed when we breakfast outside the UK as he favours the cooked items) was well happy with the hot goods, which included eggs cooked any way you liked thanks to the egg station, bacon, sausages (2 kinds) meatballs, mushrooms & herby potatoes- yum! We really liked our room. I would not say it was the height of luxury, but was modern, contemporary, well laid out and more than ample in size.The only downside you may wish to consider is that a double room is in fact 2 twin beds pushed together. I already knew this before we went so wasn't bothered & the beds were at least very comfy. We liked the Nespresso coffee machine but did miss being able to make a cup of tea (but think this is pretting standard in European hotels). We used the swimming pool which was nicely done. It may have been a little small but was excellent for a dip and refresh before heading out for the evening. There was also a sauna & steam room, but we didn't use these. All the members of staff we spoke to were more then polite, helpful & efficient & I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone visting Berlin !

Reviews.Title: “There are better in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: bgtny
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 days at this hotel..it was average and there are better options in Berlin. Everyone comments about the aquarium in the lobby the reality is if you don't have an inside room to look at the aquarium the view from the lobby/bar area is not very good and can only be viewed if you want to keep looking upwards as you sit at the bar which is not really practical. Room - clean but small, the storage closet is not very functional, there are no clocks in room, tv channels are limited,room lighting poor and desk area work space very small internet access was good. My room was on the first floor with street view only patio type doors, no windows, so if you want fresh air you have to keep one of the doors open. Room was quite with doors closed there was no noticeable outside road noise. No irons in room. Bathroom on the other hand is very small, the tub/shower combo is very tight. Sink counter top is very small it is difficult to have your toiletries on counter top due to lack of space. Terrible sulfur type smell at times. Bar- lobby area just ok nothing spectacular. In the morning to handle the breakfast spill over from the restaurant they set up another buffet around the bar area. Breakfast - good selection, but if it is not included you have to pay 25 euro per person at this price it is way over rated. Staff overall friendly and very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ElleJayDubya
Reviews.Content: My mother and I had a wonderful stay here. We checked in on the 17th of December for the Christmas markets and stayed for three nights. The staff were all so friendly and very helpful. We'd booked a Business Class room, for a spot of luxury, but on arrival they advised us that there were no Business Class rooms available, but hoped we would be satisfied with a Junior Suite instead. Erm... yes please! On the second morning they were decorating the HEAT restaurant, so there was a minor delay in seating us for breakfast. We weren't too bothered about this, but during our meal a member of staff came around with a tray containing glasses of champagne, by way of an apology. Such a lovely touch, which was appreciated! We also used the hotel spa, which was lovely! There's a bar in the spa too, so I had a drink there while my mother had her treatment. Perfectly located for Mitte and if you go for the Christmas markets it's just over the road from my favourite Christmas market. Will definitely be staying her again at some point in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel with amazing aquarium!”
Reviews.Author: KayCeeUk
Reviews.Content: I've never spent so much time fixated on the interior of a hotel. I made sure I got a room facing the aquarium. This was a real treat. Such a fantastic and surreal view from the room! Hotel staff were very professional and courteous, probably some of the best services I've received in a hotel. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Surfer R
Reviews.Content: Very interesting hotel - the huge Aquarium in the lobby is an eye cacher! Stylish location, inspired modern design, friendly staff with an helpful and well informed concierge. Didn't try the breakfast. We stayed three times in Mitte last year but Radisson Blu is still top of the list. And the view from the room - watching the fishes .... is something!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Feigum
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel are really nice with a very comfortable bed. They have a really cool aquarium which adds an edge to the hotel. The standard on the room service food is really good, and service level pretty good (for germany at least). I have a Carlson Club gold card, and they do not seem to give you anything extra. I have stayed here 4 times now, and never got anything (no upgrade, no breakfast included etc etc). However, it is a very nice hotel, and I will continue to stay here as it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tatia065
Reviews.Content: It's clean, cool, there is an interesting thing to see AQUARIUM. Very good location, friendly staff, nice spa.....gooooooooood!

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind!”
Reviews.Author: Clodaghhbellina
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel in a convenient location with pleasant staff that gave us great recommendations. Loved the fish tank, really thought that was such a unique touch. Would love to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “There is a heaven, it's in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Whydoineedtodothis
Reviews.Content: Wow!! start with the staff, every one of them, from reception through to chambermaids were attentive, polite and charming. Food and beverage was of an extremely high calibre and not unduly expensive for a five star hotel. Our room didn't have much of a view really, but it didn't much matter, the room itself was beautifully clean and well appointed and we weren't in Berlin to sit in our room! It goes without saying the mega fishtank in the middle is stunning and it's a great bar for people watching. If I had one minor gripe it would be the seating for breakfast which is a bit chaotic, but with (I would guess) over a hundred different food and drink items to choose from, hey, who cares!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Flavia M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Radission for 8 nights. Hotel has a great location, some rooms have a view to the cathedral and its a very short walk to several restaurants, shops, subway stations and is superclose to the museum island. Brekfast is superb and hotel staff increadibly helpful, friendly and welcoming. Request rooms with a street view to avoid getting ones with iternal views to the hotel. Lobby bar serves great drinks and restaurant serves an unforgeatable pizza. The spa is not exacly memorable, but its a good thing to have a massage option just downstairs. Great deal in Berlin, you will not regret staying here. The aquarium on the lobby is gigantic and creates such a soothin atmosphere, you almost want to linger in the lobby. :) Rooms are very good sized and are super clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MayaDamascus
Reviews.Content: As arriving, the fish Dome greats you. The staff very welcoming, the concierge very helpful. Very well situated, walking distance from all Museums. Good bedrooms, clean. The gym is helpful for some exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susannah M
Reviews.Content: Great fish tank in the centre of the hotel - real focul point. Good food. Good bedrooms and cheap for a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Peter L
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time in the Radisson, which is in the heart of Berlin. The fishtank that dominates the lobby and bar area (from the adjacent aquarium) is an amazing feature. The rooms are not big but good and very reasonably priced. It is opposite Nikolaiviertel which houses many pubs and restaurant and all the main sites are within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “My Home in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Ciopman
Reviews.Content: This is a very good Hotel in a wonderful location. As you enter, the huge acquarium greets you. We had a business room rather large, with coffee machine, with view on the Dom, and a little terrace. We couldn't use it that much due to the January climate :) The staff is very friendly and helpful: reception, concierge, bar, breakfast and room service. I know the staff has Guests' name on the computer, but be called by name when brought room service order is always very nice. The sauna area is very good, even if the majority of the Guests do not read the rules and have the sauna with swimsuit. Be aware: this is a naked area!!! I can suggest to make a reservation with breakfast included, as per previous reviews: it's really outstanding!!! Will be back for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Lynz_1981
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent trip with my partner for my 30th Birthday. We spend a long time searching for a hotel and this one was a great choice. The location is wonderful, in walking distance of most of the historic sites. The hotel itself and the rooms are clean and modern and the staff are very friendly. The Aquarium is amazing! We ended a couple of our nights in the hotel bar, just watching all the fish (with a glass or two of wine!). The only thing I would say, is that the room was very hot (we were in an aquarium facing room), and this was at the end of November with the air con on full, so I can't imagine what it would be like in summer! But a lovely place, we will definately think about staying here again on our next trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: amk2f
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the best part of the city - in close proximity to the Museums Island, Berliner Dom, Nikolaiviertel, Alexanderplatz & Brandenburg Tor, and is standing right on the bank of Spree. The most glamorous shops of Friedrichstrasse are also not far away by foot. The neighborhood around the hotel is the nicest in Berlin - plenty of really good restaurants, shops & cafes around. The most interesting & the oldest buildings of the city such as Berliner Dom, Marienkirche & Nikolaikirche are also within walking distance. The hotel itself of course is interesting with the Aqua Dome, which is basically located in the lobby of the building. Very impressive indeed! The design of the building is heavily, but successfully focused on the aquatic theme. I really loved our business class room, which had a lovely balcony with an amazing view at the river Spree & Berliner Dom. The bed was extremely comfortable - hadn't slept so well for months! Another pleasant surprise was a very good assortment of drinks at the mini bar for the very reasonable price. Also I have to note the breakfasts, which were totally mind-blowing. Never ever had I such exquisite breakfasts in my entire life: the choice of local dishes, the assortment of cheeses and juices, wonderful bread and pastry, fresh yogurts and many more... Yummy! A+ for the breakfast indeed! To sum up, I really doubt if it is possible to get a better stay in Berlin, especially taking location to the account! The only disappointment about the place was the so-called wellness center - it is way too small for comfort & looks nothing like the pictures at the hotel's website. In my opinion a place with a locker room, where 2 people is already a crowd, cannot be called anything containing the word wellness.

Reviews.Title: “As good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: danw71
Reviews.Content: I’ve always been very impressed with Radisson hotels so I was pleased to find they had rooms available when I booked our New Year trip to Berlin and I was not disappointed with our stay. The location is very central, on Alexanderplatz directly across the river from the Berliner Dom, some of the main tourist sites are in walking distance, there are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby and you can catch trams, trains and the underground from Alexanderplatz if you’re going further afield. Our room was a decent size, nicely decorated and properly clean. We were on the first floor on the right hand side of the hotel which opens onto a covered shopping street with a few bars and restaurants in it so I was a bit concerned about noise but the sound proofing was excellent, the bed was also extremely comfortable so we slept very well. The hotel’s USP is the vast tropical fish tank in the atrium and it is well worth spending some time in the bar to take it in properly, additionally the bar staff are extremely obliging and efficient so while it is not the cheapest place to drink in Berlin I thought it was money well spent. The reception staff were also very good and there is a dedicated PC and printer in the lobby for flight check ins which was really handy. Minor niggles would be the lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the room but they’re a rarity in Continental hotels anyway, and a tendency to pump the heating up to Equatorial levels but that seems to be a fairly common tendency in Berlin. Basically excellent all round.

Reviews.Title: “The right Location”
Reviews.Author: pinksqb
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location was fantastic, just a 15 min walk from Brandenburg Gate and tons of shops and restaurants. I stayed here with my partner for 3 nights over New Year's Eve. Ignore all the advice to stay in Tiergarten. This is the place you want to be. Good quality restaurants are all around, with no rubbish 'tourist trap' type steak houses and bistros. Good variety of amenities nearby. Stay away from Potsdamer Platz, Charlottenburg and Alexander Platz, these are grotty areas designed for tourists ie- bad quality hotels and reastaurants. The Radission Blu is in the right area. The hotel itself was excellent. Rooms were prestine and bathrooms were spacious with separate WC which I thought was fab. Decor was nice and modern with clean lines and lots of storage. The hotel's restaurant 'Heat' served good quality food and the service was excellent. Well worth the money. The lobby is beautiful with a massive aquarium running up the middle. If you want peace at night, request a room which faces away from the lobby as the hotel is built in the round with the lobby and aquarium in the middle.; Front desk service was very quick and efficient, and concierge was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ak_traveling
Reviews.Content: We have just gotten back from spending new years eve in Berlin and at the Radisson Blu Hotel Berlin. Firstly may I just point out a key feature about this property, it is in the best location you could want! Ignore the - "stay near checkpoint Charlie" or "stay near Tiergarten commnets! The other areas are no way near as nice (I saw them all), Radisson overlooks the amazing Berlin Cathedral (you can even request a room overlooking it) and is also right next to the telephone tower. So thats already two points of interest covered in one, but wait, the hotel is also on the same round as 4-5 of the best museums that Berlin as to offer (so full house again). We are keen walkers so we covered much on foot but a near metro station is at hand if you need it. One other key factor is that the hotel is situated right next to a parade of restaurants and coffee shops, ideal of dinner and breakfast - fresh bread and coffer every morning! On the subject of food, the hotels own HEAT restaurant is super, the staff friendly and keen to please and the food really good, there are some reviews on here stating the price is a bit much but hey, I do live in London and £40 -£50 per person for a (GOOD) meal is worth it! Rooms are very modern, clean, and extra design (concept ish) think Ikea and class and your not far off. Bathroom is of a very good size, beds nice (two singles as always pushed together) no bother though, loads of storage and TV + AC - FREE Wi-Fi runs through all rooms! All in all I loved this hotel so if you can stay here, do so, you will not regret it! Thanks to all at the RB for an amazing start to 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of pros”
Reviews.Author: dyszki
Reviews.Content: The reason we booked this hotel was a good price for it's quality.And the location is also very convinient. We had a standard room with a small balcony and a nice city view. The room was modern and nicely designed.The thing that was missing in my opinion was a coffee maker in the room.We did not have breakfest in our option. The parking is very close to the hotel ( approx.17 euro per day) Wifi is avalaible in the room and is free of charge. The staff was very hepfull.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TimDeGroot
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great staff, great location, we had an awesome time celebrating my dads 68th birthday @ Radisson Blu hotel in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place - very unique”
Reviews.Author: AlexHalls
Reviews.Content: Unique to have a cylindrical aquarium running up the centre of the hotel - and certainly adds to the experience, particularly when treating a partner to a night away. Service was excellent - friendly check-in, porter was all smiles, bar and cleaning staff pleasant too. Rooms were comfortable, with a lovely, functional bathroom, with complimentary toiletries. Location was great too - near Alexanderplatz (5-minute walk), 15-minute walk from "Unter den Linden" and also 2 minutes away from one of the Christmas markets. Plenty of taxis waiting outside if necessary. The drinks at the bar were fairly pricey - with a litre of Vittel costing €11. The beers were better value at €5.50 for a 500ml serving of the wheat beer, which was similar to Erdinger and just as tasty. A couple of small disappointments were: no kettle in the room to make a hot drink; no complimentary water in the room, which I get at every Radisson Blu I stay at in the UK. However, only a few small gripes given the overall quality of the experience, location and novelty of seeing the bright blue tank above your head.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedStar91
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of pluses but also a few very grating minuses: Positives: Great location, nice sized and clean rooms, beautiful aquarium/common areas Negatives: No alarm clocks in the rooms (at least not in couple my co-workers and I stayed in), slow/slow elevators, smushy/soft/barely sleepable on pillows (you better be really jetlagged and tired if you are going to sleep on those) Overall, this is a very nice hotel and I woudl not mind returning here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: PederOsloNorway
Reviews.Content: Just perfect. Location, service, rooms, food, public areas are all well above average. Need to speed up elevator system as well caring for all guest that arrive at the same time for breakfast. Too long a line to get into dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Steve Y
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice in this hotel and it is nice and in a great central location. Ideal if you plan to visit Berlin's museums which are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: jorneriksson
Reviews.Content: The huge Aquarium in lobby is reason good enough to visit this hotel. However there is more reasons. Coffee machine in your room, balcony view over The Berliner Doom and the River boats floating by, wonderful mojitos in the lounge, friendly staff and reasonable prices. There is no reason to stay anywhere else. If i should say something negative, it must be that Berlin is a city where nothing seems to by close by. Prepar your self for a lot of taxi rides. See the view from the room in this blog: http://www.phlog.biz/2011/11/berlin-on-bike-and-in-trabi.html

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Atticus187
Reviews.Content: This 5* hotel is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. On arrival we were asked if we would prefer a street view, or a view of the indoor aquarium. We chose the inward facing room and we weren't disappointed. Every night I sat out on the little balcony watching the fish. I didn't want to go home! The location was great, very central, and the staff were lovely and very helpful. Oh and the cocktails were so delicious! The drinks were a bit pricey, but that's to be expected for a capital city hotel. It was very easy to sit in the bar for hours and hours...very relaxing and not at all formal considering it is 5 star. Would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Borridge
Reviews.Content: Perfect central location for our visit. We went mainly for the Christmas markets but also to do some sightseeing. The hotel location was perfect for both - within walking distance of the Brandenburg Gate and Reichstag - and near to 2 S and U bahn stations for travelling further afield. The hotel was everything we expected it to be - and get a room with a balcony overlooking the AquaDom !

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Alqan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a comparison site and were amazed at the price considering the standard. The lobby is spectacular with its five story-high fish tank with an internal lift. The rooms are well furnished and comfortable and the service is very good. I suspect that it used by visitors on business in equal quantities to tourists. Its location is east of the Brandenburg gate at the end of "Unter Den Linden" and was ideal for exploring the city and its Christmas markets. We stayed on a room-only basis and found the bar to be particularly expensive, so we ate and drank in local bars and restaurants. Taxis are expensive but the tourist city tour busses are good. Try and get one with the recorded commentary as the live ones can be difficult to hear and understand. All in all; a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service.”
Reviews.Author: Marek_PL
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, nice place, the best experience was during check-in. The staff was realy nice. The lady offered help an support. Good connection to the airport (direct bus), close to the center. Big room, maybe view could be better, but ...Next time I will choose the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a great location with great views inside and out”
Reviews.Author: yandinazetland
Reviews.Content: Radisson Blu regularly means sleek minimalist rooms, with a little extra - particularly if you go for a business room - Berlin's Blu does not disappoint. The location puts you within walking distance of many of the key sites of the city centre - Museum Island is within five minutes and the Brandenburg Gate thirty. Reception is very efficient , the fish tank mind boggling , our room over looking the river and Berlin Cathedral with views to the west had a small balcony. The room was well founded although i found the two single beds, made up as singles, forming a double unusual. A nespresso , a flat screen TV , everything from slippers to shoe horns and gowns plus a mini bar at hand. The bathroom had a full size bath plus a powerful shower and enough shampoo and soaps to satisfy the most bubbly of people. Breakfast is excellent , all you could ever wish for - although I am not a great fan of the tea. We had lunch and again this was full on - portions are large - the bar is fine - good service and that view of the fish .... I would stay again -

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff stole my LV purse and laptop?”
Reviews.Author: Maria B
Reviews.Content: I came down to the hotel restaurant for breakfast (which is only for hotel guests and you need to be checked in at the door by the staff.) I had just put my Louis Vutton purse and my laptop down by the table to get my breakfast; within 3 mins. they were gone! The guests that were sitting nearby told me that they had not seen anyone around except the waitress that came to set my table. I was running around asking for help to the person in charge and the waitress who was in the area. Neither showed interest in helping. Moreover, there was no security personel at the hotel to report the theft. When I requested to speak to the managers in charge, instead of talking to me they went first to speak with their staff and were more intersted in keeping the situation as quiet as possible. I was told to go to my room and wait for the police. I had to wait 3 hrs for the police to come so I could file a report. When finally a police officer came, he had apparently been already informed by the manager of the hotel, but was told a different story. Adding insult to injury, the management at the hotel showed more interest in deflecting resposibility away from their staff than showing concern about what had happened to me. They told me that these sort of things are not uncommon at the hotel, that theft has happened before and that it was my fault I'd brought valuables with me to the restaurant. If that was the case, they should have place warning signs around the hotel. I travel often and to many places. I know theft can happen anywhere in the street and in public places, but this is a 5 star hotel and you would expect it'd offer a safer and more secure environment for guests. Obviounsly, not Radisson Blu Hotel. Becareful if you decide to stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: BenLeigh250
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight on a business trip loved the hotel was comfortable and modern would stay here again if the rate is good the breakfast buffet had plenty of choice

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Pressgirl
Reviews.Content: Everything said in previous reviews of this hotel are spot on. Clean, quiet and an amazing fish tank in the foyer. Book a room on the top floors so you get a good view of the fish tank in the lift every time you visit your room. There were three divers in there one morning cleaning the glass. If you don't get a top floor room, your 'lift' access card wont let you visit the higher floors of the hotel and you miss out on the view. Free wi-fi, your laptop will fit in the safe. Try and get a deal with breakfast included in your holiday package otherwise it can be a considerable extra cost. There was a lovely Christmas market opposite the hotel when I was there. This hotel is in a brillilant location, if you arrive at Tiegel Airport, the TXL bus which leaves the airport every ten minutes or so, stops almost outside the hotel. We arrived at night and spotted the front of the building lit up as we passed it and then stopped at the next bus stop. The 100 bus also stops outside the hotel and this route takes you to many of the sights and you can also pick up other useful routes, such as the 109. We bought a Berlin Wellcome Card for 22 Euros for 72 hours from the BVG desk at the airport. Follow the signs to the information desk at the airport, and just to the left of this desk is another office where you can buy the card. You get a map, a book and a ticket, which you must stick in the little yellow box when you get on the bus the first time. It stamps the ticket to validate it and then you just show it when you get on and off transport during your stay. You can use it unlimited on buses, trams and the underground and cut price entry to most of the key sights. The ticket includes the TXL bus to and from the airport which takes about 20 minutes. There is a river boat just down the steps outside of the hotel restaurant which takes you on a nice tour for a few Euros with your Berlin card and the card can also be used to get a discount into the DDR Museum which is just down the steps and well worth a trip as it's interactive and very interesting if you like social history about the Eastern Bloc and communism, you can climb into a 1980s Volvo and sit in a prison cell and sit on the sofa in a 1980s Eastern European living room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxing unusual hotel where you can sleep with the fishes”
Reviews.Author: davidmlowe
Reviews.Content: The impressive fish tank greets you as you check in. It's a shame that you cannot gain further access to the tank apart from paying an additional charge to visit what is basically a poor version of a blue planet aquarium. Business class room has nice touches such as proper coffee machine,iron board trouser press and lovely bath robes that actually fit. There is a lot of minimalist furniture that is a bit useless. Had a nice river view and breakfast is excellent! Raspberry mojitos are to die for in the bar but they are pricey at nearly £14 each! Location great near to all transport would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Furansujin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really near by the museums. The staff is very helpful . It is an excellent hotel. No fancy decoration ,but what you expect from this hotel. The breakfast is excellent . The view on the office building is not the best. Better to ask for the one on the fish tank which is amazing. Do recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Classy, relaxing, and well-located”
Reviews.Author: BenTheophanous
Reviews.Content: Great ambiance, very professional staff, and a fantastic centre-piece with the biggest indoor acquarium in the world! Play it right and you can have a room facing the huge tropical cylinder to relax you after a couple of beers at the bar. You can also take a life inside the acquarium which is really special! I was here for a conference, but found the staff really helpful, the breakfast was good - chef making fresh ommelettes went down well ;-) and it was located right by the river in Mitte - a short walk or taxi ride to all you need. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing tropical reef in atrium - quite a surprise”
Reviews.Author: RolloMcFluff
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant hotel. Excellent check in staff. The tropical reef complete with many of the fish you'd see in the Maldives (including a nice mid-sized Napoleon Wrasse and shoal of sweet lips) was a delightful surprise. View of Cathedral that fills the bedroom window is wonderful too. Hotel is wonderfully efficient and comfortable in a functional manner.

Reviews.Title: “weird, quirky, different, random”
Reviews.Author: thunderdownunder
Reviews.Content: Ok, Berlin is one of my favourite cities in the world, I love everything about it, it's oddness, it's randomness and of course the currywurst. We usually stay at the Kempinski Bristol (tired and old) and this year I said no, a newer hotel, and off to the Alexander Platz we went. On entrance, the hotel is visually stunning with it's awesome aquarium in the middle, which may very well be the most striking I've ever seen. Reception had a lot of attitude when it came to adapters. They really weren't helpful and I was forced to go and buy one for EU25 - which really left a bitter taste in my mouth. Breakfast was simple, not over the top, one day I waited so long for my eggs, I had to leave them. I really didn't understand where the lack in service came from with such a stunning hotel. If you book on a corporate package, which includes I think Internet and Breakfast you get two single beds in the room, whether or not you are one person. I called down and they said all the rooms were like that on that package? I then got them zipped together however I found the whole thing really weird. It's location was the saving grace, so many restaurants, so many shops, it was stunning. I loved the location. Gym was tiny. Really tiny. the view from my room was stunning, over a river type thing next door. all in all, i'd stay there again, however service needs to improve.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: JURO82
Reviews.Content: This establishment was superb in service, position and all that one could require. We visited this city during our honeymoon and enjoyed our stay very much at the Radison. Thank you to all the Staff that made it possible.

Reviews.Title: “Functional but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: gliv81
Reviews.Content: Marketed as 5 star but difficult to see how. The main draw is the large aquarium in the lobby which is visible from the inside rooms however the novelty soon wears off as in order to see the aquarium all other rooms get to see you in your pj's. Rooms are clean and functional but not comfortable with hard single beds (pushed together) and supportless pillows. The shower in a weird position in the bath took a bit of getting used to. HEat restaraunt is good for breakfast with pretty decent Continental and hot food. Tried it for dinner but probably a bit over priced for what you get. Situated in excellent location for walking to sites in Mitte and Hakescher Markt S-bahn is 2 minutes away. Overall Radisson Blu echoes Berliners - no fluff, direct and functional. Recommend Insider walking tours - leaflet in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: Blessed06
Reviews.Content: We stayed their nov 2010 in a nice room on the 5th floor with an amazing view across the canal fro the Berlin Cathedral. We enjoyed the hotel room coffee machine on our balcony with the unique large multiple-directional glass doors. The huge 6 story high aquarium was wonderful to enjoy while waiting for or riding the glass elevators. Twin beds rather than double, can't have everything I guess. Breakfast was very good. Room clean, nice bath with tub and shower. Excellent city location a few meters from museum island. Staff friendly and pleasant. Wifi internet in room was hit and miss, mostly miss. I had to sit by the door to get reception. Train 4 blocks away, busses right outside. Great shopping nearby including fun department store with great treats and eats. I had a much better experience than I expected. Thanks Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Blu, Berlin - Small Rooms & Impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: First things first, hotel standard is excellent good, rooms are clean and hygiene obvioulsy is a priority. Food also good but not outstanding. Location is good but Berlin is such an easy City to navigate around that this is really quite secondary. The gimmicky aquarium/ fish tank is also quite a nice novelty touch. But in summary the whole experience falls flat somehow. The fact that the rooms are tiny and claustrophobic gets things off to a bad start. You just feel that the building has been engineered to squeeze in the maximum number of rooms. Staff are efficient but impersonal. They do what is required but it all feels a bit like a production line. Let me put it this way, the hotel lacks soul, lacks ambience. It just feels like a very busy place where people pass through and when I stay in hotels at this price point I'm looking for that something extra, the personal touch, the differential - and it's more than just getting a chocolate on my pillow! There are much better places for the money, where you will be made to feel more special.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ClareLaois
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here this week and all in all it was a great experience. The staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. Hotel was spotless. Room very comfortable, chocolate on your pillow every evening a nice touch. We asked for a river view as recommended by another reviewer and it was great. The aquadome was unreal. Breakfast was included in the price we paid and it really was excellent, only had to wait for a table one morning and only for a very short while. Choice of food excellent and regularly replenished. Only had a coffee at the bar one night but quite expensive especially for other drinks. The hotel is in a great location, very convenient for the city tour hop on hop off bus and less than 10 mins to Alexanderplatz station. We arrived at Schonefeld airport, the train station is a few mins walk away. Only one staff member at the station and as we did not know what train to get had to join the queue. Trains leave for Alexanderplatz approx every 30 mins from platform 4, you need a ticket for zones ABC - 3E, in the direction of Nauen. Lots to see and do in Berlin, such an interesting city. Some nice restaurants nearby - the Block House, a steak restaurant was very good as was a little italian called Salina in a cute little area across the park from the hotel. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good quality hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to feel at home”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeCouple23 Posted by a Viaggiare traveler
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for a 2 day trip to see the sights of the city. We arrived late at night by car and used the underground parking lot for the Radisson which ended up being 34 euros for 40 hours of parking. The front desk staff gave us a warm greeting, and check in was quick and easy. The aquarium in the lobby is a pretty nice addition but overall not a main part of the experience. They use key card only access to the hotel floors. The room itself was very nice but nothing really set it apart from any other major hotel chain. Breakfast is not included in the standard room booking but can be added on at a somewhat high price. The biggest thing that won me over for booking it was the location which is a 15 minute walk from the Bradenburg Gate and a 10 minute walk to Alexanderplatz giving you lots of choices for food and activites. Overall a good experience but if it were in the states would only make a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kathy27
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay here. It was so easy to get the bus from Tegel airport, as it stopped just past the hotel, only Euro2.30pp. Loved the aquarium, and we asked for a room overlooking the fish. It made the room slightly darker, but was fascinating to watch. The hotel was in a perfect location to get around, right on the City bus tour route, and just near the boat trips (we were recommended to go on the one across the road). The concierge was very helpful, especially in choosing a restaurant for my birthday, in a lovely Italian restaurant we'd never have discovered on our own. We didn't have the breakfast as we couldn't do the Euro25pp justice, but there was a great coffee place a few doors away that served muffins, croissants etc - much cheaper! We found all the staff helpful, and they gave us a later check out when we asked, so would definitely use this hotel again if we return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: baroma
Reviews.Content: An impersonal hotel. Polite staff, interesting fish tank, but nothing more. Terrible queue at breakfast, no bathrobe or slippers in the room. Nice location, but a bit not so central as I expected. Cosy cafes next to the hotel. Anyway, my break in Berlin was excellent as always.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice....excellent location for top sights”
Reviews.Author: jtssea
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to The Berliner Dom and Museum Island. Additionally the hop on hop off buses stop 20 feet from front door as do river tours. The team and train stations were close and taxis were always waiting. The hotel was quiet and very clean. The front desk was always helpful and extremely polite! We emailed Bjorn the concierge prior to our trip and he made several restaurant reservations for us at places we requested thus saving us having to call ourselves. He also got us tickets and gave us tips to several sights. Buy Berlin pass at hotel and use discount for multi day public transportation passes. If going Potsdam u need special ticket package that costs only few euros more and gives you free use all their buses and transport to and from Potsdam which is do worth the trip. The breakfast was very good and was included in our rate. Ask for lattes or espresso as they are included in buffeet cost. We are espresso addicts so that made buffet reasonable with espresso drinks at no cost. The staff was very pleasant. Everyone spoke English if you do not know German. The rooms do vary in size and configuration and view. Ask for one with balcony overlooking park or Dom. Fish tank cool ...but bar prices bit absurd for what you got....$14 euro.for Gin&tonic. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: kingcobra60
Reviews.Content: Functional hotel perfectly placed to explore Mitte. Very good breakfast buffet, clean rooms, helpful staff and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: garyjayne7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Radisson Blu Berlin. We had a business class room with a small balcony overlooking the Spree and the Cathederal. The Room was modern but comfortable with all the amenties you would expect. The thing that stood out for me was that all of the staff we encountered were so friendly and helpful. We spent 3 long days sightseeing and usually we would then go out for the evening but as the hotel bar area was so pleasant we spent each evening there with a few drinks and a meal. Again the staff were so friendly and efficient. The breakfast was also very good with a vast choice although sometimes the food could have been hotter but that is always the same with buffets.The aquarium was quite spectacular as was the rest of the hotel. I would not hesitate to recomend this hotel to any of my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with character, an attraction in itself”
Reviews.Author: sea2skyaus
Reviews.Content: Positives: -Many fantastic traditional German restaurants just 3 minute walk ACROSS the park -Next to Berlin Dom and many attractions -TXL airport bus passes by the hotel (bus stop 5 minute walk away). It costs under 3 euros to the airport, cheapest in the Western World -5 minute walk to S-bahn (Hackeschermarkt), also has many restaurants -Free WIFI that worked perfectly -AMAZING fish tank view from the hotel rooms -6 euros coffee and cake special Negatives: -The "double bed" consists of 2 twins bed pushed together. This is common in Europe but I don't think they were attached in anyway. They were just placed next to each other, so it was frustrating. The hotel itself is an attraction. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Hellie50
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay ar this hotel. It was expensive but the standard second to none. The cleanliness was 100%, the breakfast was incredible and the staff were genuinely lovely amd efficient. There was a good atmosphere and the location was perfect. It was .great to be able to eat brbeakfast outside in the sunshine right on the river overlooking the cathedral. Worth paying that bit more. Thank you everyone at the Radisson Blu Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Dave J
Reviews.Content: Bought 2 nights accom off e bay excellent value, very good location for all the sights. Berlin is very interesting place with loads of recent history.

Reviews.Title: “The best Radisson I've been into”
Reviews.Author: maksis
Reviews.Content: I counted that over a period of time I have slept into 12 different Radisson hotels through 8 European countries. None of them stands close the one in Berlin. Business class room might be smaller than in other hotels, for instance in Marseille, thou it has certain character underlined by details. Such as, smart use of bathroom doors, mini-bar panel features, etc. Furniture has clear lines, but it is not boring cheap 'minimalistic' style. Atrium with fish tank is described in every review here. I just may add that even if you are on business trip and sleep over one night, you may enjoy lazily swimming fish which makes your day (or night) less grim. Staff very responsive (helped with directions, restaurants, shopping and sending a postcard old fashioned way), food choice at breakfast more generous than at typical chain hotel (certainly recommend to have it, if included in room price). I have very good memories and will consider this hotel when travelling next time to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated but no character”
Reviews.Author: LikeToTravel01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated near Alexanderplatz. The rooms are comfortable but boring and without any useful extras, e;g., no kettle to make tea/coffee, and few UK/US TV channels - those that were available had very poor quality images. The breakfast buffet is very well stocked with a wide range of hot and cold options. The staff (apart from one very pleasant trainee) were not particularly friendly - generally gave the impression that guests were a bit of a pain - and had surprisingly little knowledge about the many historical/tourist buildings nearby. The huge aquarium in the lobby is a bit of fun but as it does not belong to the hotel, guests are unable to visit it unless they pay for a full ticket at the main aquarium nextdoor. Overall a reasonable place to stay but rather impersonal. It could be so much better if they just added a few individual touches and improved staff training.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Cymro29
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference which was well run with excellent catering. Helpful and welcoming staff, spacious clean rooms, nice bathrooms and free wi-fi. Impressive atrium with big fish tank. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, unique setting”
Reviews.Author: indipendente
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is hard to beat. Just meters from the museum island and many other sights. Also less than five minutes from Alexanderplatz and subway. The lobby features what they claim is the largest aquarium in Europe, not sure about that but it is impressive and stunningly beautiful. You can even see divers cleaning inside while the fish swim around. Too bad the entrance to the viewing gallery of the aquarium is not accessible from the hotel, you must buy a ticket from a neighboring office. Rooms are fine, though I asked for a double bed and got two mattresses pushed together, disappointing. Breakfast is expensive, let it be and just walk outside for a wide range of different options. We liked the sauna/spa, clean and well serviced.

Reviews.Title: “Good, modern hotel - with a spectacular fish tank”
Reviews.Author: Completetosh
Reviews.Content: You've got to see the fish tank to believe it, and it makes a great distinguishing feature for an already good hotel. I found the place clean, comfortable and with all the facilities I needed. If you dont want to venture far there are some nice-looking cafes and bars nearby, and plenty of major tourist sights. It's also well-placed for train stations to get further afield - if you can figure out the Berlin u-bahn. On my stay, the pricing made it very good value indeed, at under 100 euros a night. For a hotel of this standard, that's good, if not completely unusual in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice but you could do better..”
Reviews.Author: Pourvous
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to a large metro station but far enough from eveything else; enough to be annoyed by it. The food in Its restaurant is very good. But once you have tried it, you want to try something else and eveything else is at least 20 minutes walk. I reserved a business class room. It was not oversize but I reserved the room with a balcony overlooking the cathedral; that was nice. Altough spiders and mosquitos are enough a problem to warn you to keep the patio door close, the room was clean but service was not equal. One night, we got sweets when they turned down the bed, the other we did not. One night, we were charged for milk ordered at the bar ( to put in our coffee) the other it was offered by the waiter in service. We were supposed to have wifi in the room, it was not available. We were on the business floor, there was'nt any lounge as you usually do on business/ club level floors. We were supposed to get daily newspaper..we never did. And yes, the mega aquarium is something to see.... I would recommend it but if I had to choose, I would recommend to be closer to Friedrichstrasse and U...that, for me, would have been the perfect spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tama C
Reviews.Content: This is a very well-located hotel that provides easy access to all of the main attractions, particularly Museum Island and the tour starting points at the nearby TV Tower. Have to say though that it is definitely a business hotel - all the facilities are good and the room is nice, but lacks the luxe finish that would elevate it into top-class. The provision of free internet was a real plus for me, although I was never able to detect the wireless signal that was supposedly available and had to connect via LAN cable and set up my own network. Breakfast buffet is quite good and also notable for having a gluten-free and lactose free option. Of course the highlight of the hotel is the gigantic aquarium in the central foyer - always interesting to look at from the lifts. My room had a nice view of the back of the Berliner Dom across the river. If I came to Berlin by myself again for business I would probably stay here again, simply for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic city hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BristolSunshine
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have stayed in on a city break. It is perfectly situated for all the sights of Berlin. It is located right next to the River Spree and Berlin Cathedral as well as the television tower. As you enter you cannot miss the amazing AquaDom. We had a standard room facing the Dom. We initially chose a room facing outside but this does not give you a view of the Cathedral etc, rather restaurants! So definitely ask for an AquaDom facing room. Only the business class rooms give views of Berlin! Reception were more than happy to switch us though! The room comes with a flat-screen television, Juliette balcony and large bathroom with powerful shower and lovely toiletries. Each night they place a chocolate by your bed which is a nice gesture! I found the staff excellent and really accommodating. I was ill for one day so put the do not disturb on the door. Housekeeping rang later to check if I wanted the room servicing and offered to help in anyway they could - impressed! We also requested late checkout free of charge. Oh the soundproofing is excellent-could not hear a thing from the lobby! I loved the spa facilities. There are 2 saunas and 1 steam room. Also included are foot-baths and amazing showers that spray you in all directions-very relaxing! The pool is small but as I was the only one in there it didn't feel small. It's a little cold so you have to swim! It also has powerful jets which you can switch on to swim against or just float away from! The hotel is spotlessly clean and beautifully designed. I could have watched the fish all day in the Aquarium! Berlin is a wonderful City to visit. We took a boat tour right outside the hotel to get our bearings. If you want to visit the Reichstag you must register by email at least 3 days beforehand. Check their website for details to avoid disappointment! I definitely recommend the Radisson, especially at the reasonable prices for staying in Germany's capital!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tortycat3
Reviews.Content: Nice place, business class room has a great view of the cathedral, staff very polite and efficient, aquarium is fun to look at. Breakfast very good value, food excellent. Very nice stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: laurita2119
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Blu for 4 nights at the very end of our 16 day European vacation. It was a great place to end the trip, as there were times where we we burned out from sight-seeing, and just relaxed comfortably in the hotel. We got room service when we were too done to even choose a restaurant, and it was surprisingly cheap and very delicious. The location was amazingly convenient to everything we wanted to see in Berlin, use the 100 bus! It stops basically in front of the hotel and goes up and down Unter den Linden, to the Brandenburg Gate, through Tiergarten, and down to Ku'Damm. It is situated next to the Berliner Dom, the DDR Museum, Museum Island and a good selection of restaurants. A tram stop and S-Bahn stop are a quick 5 min walk away. Free internet, which worked perfectly. We had a choice of aquarium view room or city view, and we took city view with no hesitation, and it was great. The aquarium was fun to look at when going up and down in the elevator, and I can imagine young children would just love it. The only reason it loses a star is that some of the furniture could use an upgrade, it had some visible wear and tear, but nothing too bad. All in all, a great home base for exploring Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: hojosher
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located, close to Museum Island, the TV tower, all the attractions at Unter den Linden, bars and restaurants at the Hackescher Markt, and practical shopping at the Kaufhof Galleria or the Alexa shopping mall as well as S-Bahn and U-Bahn connections at the Hackescher Markt or Alexanderplatz. I had the misfortune of getting a standard room with no balcony, despite the fact I was staying for 7 nights and a Carlsson Club member, perhaps because I arrived in the early a.m. from an international flight, though they did receive me at that hour. The room was very clean and comfortable, but somewhat Spartan. At over $300/nt. I had hoped for more. There was no coffee maker, no ice (you can call room service for it), no refrigerator, etc., but yet there was a phone in the water closet. Also the A/C would cool the room only to about 75, and after showering, it just did not keep up, so I purchased a small fan to keep cool. The in-house Wi-Fi worked perfectly and was great to have. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the lobby bar was casual enough that I felt comfortable stopping by for drinks even after being out all day or evening. All in all, the location and the Aqua Dome are what make this hotel, but next time I stay in Berlin, I will definitely shop around the area (i.e., the Adina, the Hotel am Alexander Plaza, both of which are one block away) for a better room and deal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: marymar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights last year. It is located near Alexanderplatz and Oranienburgstr., just next to the river, a 15-min. walk to Friederichstrasse and Brandenburg Gate. The hotel hosts a huge aquarium inside (which is part of a next door museum/aquarium place), there's a lift inside the acquarium so guests can view it from the inside (great thing for kids). The rooms are spacious and comfortable, some with views to the aquarium. There's free wi-fi on some areas and the buffet breakfast is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: mcmiku
Reviews.Content: Business rooms had all the comfort you could wish. Breakfast was very good with a very large choice. The Aquarium keeps you busy in the glass elevators as you might even forget to get out. You will find restaurants near the Hackerscher Markt stop.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasitc Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamiexx
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Cannot fault this at all. Bar staff pleasant. Head barman and the irish lady very fiendly. Lukas on reception always smiling. Breakfast in 'heat' is magnificent. Will always stay here in future. Did however notice that the other restaurant/bar which was 'underground' appears to have vanished so not as much choice with regards to evening eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Aquarium in front of my window”
Reviews.Author: travelingchrissie
Reviews.Content: Staying in hotels quite a bit - it is great to have something really unique: now, the Radisson Blu Hotel really offers something unique! A massive aquarium in the middle of the lobby. I had a room looking into the lobby so I had the view on this massive aqaurium! it was funny when divers were there to clean it, and you suddently had them almost infront of your window! The location is excellent - in the heart of the city - the rooms are really nice. I had a 2-day meeting there and conference facilities are good as well. We had dinner in a roof-top room with beautiful views, dinner and wines were excellent. A really good choice in Berlin - can very much recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Some of the most helpful staff, toilet/ shower a little exposed.”
Reviews.Author: themizzvee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, with a close friend. Room was a little cramped but suited us, as we planned to spend very little time in the room. The toilet and shower were only separated from the sleeping area by a shower curtain, offering no privicy. Fine if your staying with a spouse, but I was staying with a close friend of the opposite sex, which meant that one of us felt obligated to leave the room while the other used the toilet/shower facilities. However I must say the staff were outstanding. My friend left his passport in the back of a cab. The staff contacted the taxi companies, and within an hour the passport was waiting for him in reception. I would definitely stay here again, but would pay extra to have my own room if going with a friend because of the shower / toilet facilities. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MickeyinParis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The location is brilliant as it is so easy to walk to the major attractions in Berlin. We had a room with the view of the Dom and the river - absolutely beautiful. We sat by the window and enjoyed the views after a day of sightseeing. The bed is really comfy and the room is very clean and tidy. Of course there is the famous fish tank! It is such an attraction that you can't help looking at it everytime you are in the lobby . There are a wide range of choices of food at breakfast and the staff are very attentive. We stayed at the hotel for my birthday. It was so nice of the hotel that they gave us complimentary chocolate/ cakes/ fruit. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and can't wait to go back to Berlin to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A definate must”
Reviews.Author: jules_3003
