Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend for two Nights on our first trip to berlin! You couldn't ask for a better location! The hotel Itself is a tourist attraction with many coming to view it's amazing aquarium! Staff here are so polite, quick and service is great! Rooms are large (we had a balcony with a view - standard room) and the room was modern and spotless! The hotel is 5 mins walk from the infamous tv tower (worth a trip up - views are amazing) and 7 mins walk to alexandreplatz train station! Do your homework on the trains from Airport etc as they are all in german and hard to figure out which train goes where! Overall best city break I've been on! I will definately be coming back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Lobby, great service and location.”
Reviews.Author: eden966
Reviews.Content: I certainly think this is one of the better hotels in Berlin!! Unfortunately there is no airport shuttle to the hotel but the regulares city buses from the airport are easy. The building is impressive in a neighbourhoud with lot of shops, very close to Sealife Center and eateries, in fact a very good vietnamese/thai restaurant around the corner, Shytake, where we ate all 3 nights. Upon arrival the lobby is so impressive with the massive fish tank!! We got a room with view facing the lobby (I got to choose), they unfortunately only had the first floor available but I got to see a little bit of the fish tank from the room, so I was happy! About the room: what I loved is that housekeeping puts a little sacket of Jelly Beans onto our bed every day, not much english channels on the tv, good bathroom and tub, there is also a nice fitness, sauna, steam room and little swimming pool. The breakfast buffet has a lot of choice!!! Overall, would stay again if ever in Berlin again!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply brilliant, already planning to return”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Milnes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location, on one side, the cathedral and Museum Island, on the other, the Fersehturm and Alexanderplatz. The tram stop on Spandauer Strasse can take you to the S-Bahn at Hackescher Markt, or the S and U-Bahn at Alexanderplatz. The first thing you notice when you enter the lobby is the giant fish tank, or as they call it, the AquaDom. We upgraded to business class which was well worth it, firstly we had excellent views of the cathedral, second, breakfast was included and what a breakfast. Nearly everything conceivable to eat for breakfast was available, cooked meats, continental breads and cheeses, yoghurt, fruit, pastries and more! The waiter bring you hot drinks and thats it, you feast on as much or as little as yo want. We all had good hearty portions, which meant that we only needed a snack at lunch, leaving more time for sightseeing, and you'll need a lot of time for that. The rooms are impeccably clean and the business class rooms are a descent size too. Every time the room is cleaned you get a packet of jelly beans, which is a nice touch. The staff are very friendly and all speak excellent english. A must for any visitor to berlin is a travel card, these can be purchased from the concierge and then you must validate them by stamping them either on the platforms of the S and U-Bahn stations, or inside the buses and trams. I really can't find a bad word to say about this hotel, we will definitely be going back. To sum up, this hotel is 'self-service luxury', the staff don't get in the way, but if you need them, they are never far away.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Stuntsopran
Reviews.Content: Great room, friendly staff, easy access, HUGE breakfast. Go there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and facilities!”
Reviews.Author: LeMonte
Reviews.Content: My stay was 3 days, 2 nights on buiness a few weeks before Christmas. The location was selected by our team because of cost, but we agreed it was good value for money. Not to mention the spectacle of the indoor aquarium! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and will be back.”
Reviews.Author: Farpolo
Reviews.Content: friendly staff ( Although they were all German).Spa was clean and well equiped. Location,Heat restuarant which we had breakfast in everyday was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: stephg1
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and professional welcome- in fact this was displayed throughout. The staff were really pleasant and all our queries were answered promptly and dealt with efficiently. Nice room overlooking the aquarium but it did get a bit stuffy and we never did get to grips with the air-con.. .. comfortable beds, decent toiletries (it's a girly thing) and loved the shower. We ate out so cannot comment on the food. Did have some drinks- quite expensive, beautifully presented and with a smile. Would definitely consider for my return visit to this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: London_Badajoz
Reviews.Content: Apart from the original aquarium in the large lobby / bar area the rooms with a river view are great. Ther DDR musuem is right at the front below the hotel and museum Insel is lterally a stones throw from the hotel as well. Room overlooking the river are double glazed so no problem with noise (we were on 5th floor). The restarant was good for breakfast (only had bar meals on as evening snack) after spending all day out.. All the staff were polite and helpful. check in/ out was fast and efficient. In short an excellent hotel where we would not hesitate to stay again. TIp - if getting the express train to Schoenfield airport beware! The train on the way into Berlin was cancelled 5 mins after it was due to arrive. On way back (on saturaday) it arrived 2 mins late and then it was cancelled once it arrived at next stattion. Given weeknd engineering works it made for a nerve racking multiple change trip to get to airport with 20 minutes to spare!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: FernandoB
Reviews.Content: Radisson Blu is very well located, by the Spree and at the heart of the museums area. Rooms are good, as is the service, with the Heat Restaurant providing a relaxing atmosphere. And the aquarium is a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “40th birthday trip”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_Newman
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideally situated in central Berlin, close to Museum Island, Berliner Dom, Hackescher Markt and Unter Den Linden which has a Opernpalais cafe serving a large cake buffet. We walked from the hotel to other attractions like Reichstag, Brandenburg gate, Potsdamer Platz and Friedrichstrasse. When we arrived at the hotel we were given a choice of a room with windows facing the large aquarium or one where windows face outwards. After a day exploring Berlin it was great to relax and enjoy the aquarium view from the room, before leaving for the evening entertainment. The staff were friendly, and when I ordered room service one night the prices were comparable with restaurants / bars in the area. I would highly recommend this hotel and Berlin for a city break. We really enjoyed Berlin and I'm looking to plan my return trip to explore areas that we didn't get round to the first time. Germany has spent a lot of time, effort and money on their capital and it shows. As a price guide - In Central Berlin we paid approximately 15 Euros per head in restaurants, and 4 Euros for half litre of local beer (Berliner Pilsner, Erdinger). My wife really enjoyed Schofferhofer in a variety of flavours (Grapefruit, Pear&Ginger, Ice, Cactus). The hotel room service prices were similar, but we didn't eat in the hotel restaurant 'Heat', which did have good reviews in Berlin guides. There is the Airport express train which takes 20 minutes from the airport to Alexanderplatz, and then you have 10 minute walk to the hotel. In August the train ticket cost 3 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, very poor fitness centre”
Reviews.Author: IRBaboonLondon
Reviews.Content: I have not much to add to the other reviews as the ratings on tripadvisor stand for themselves really. (theres only so many times you can wax lyrical about a fish tank after all...) however if you plan on doing any fitness on your trip to berlin you should avoid this hotel. when i was there only one running machine was 'functional' and on this the the belt kept slipping in an alarming way making me nearly fall over, also only one elipse machine 'worked' and on this one of the plastic guards at the back was smashing into the machine meaning it wasnt actually usable without earplugs. poor effort indeed from a so called 5 star

Reviews.Title: “Average 4* city hotel, clean and nice but lacks a little charm”
Reviews.Author: MisterCoconut
Reviews.Content: Were it not for the giant fish tank in the lobby atrium, this would have been a standard 4* hotel, nothing special. But the aquarium is clever and does make the hotel more interesting. The lobby café and bar area could have been at an airport or anywhere in the world, boring and forgettable, but the fish tank actually is a fun feature. Reception staff were efficient and nice. The rooms are pretty standard, but the small balcony with splendid views made the stay more pleasant. A lot of traffic noise from the street, but in the middle of a large city that is to be expected. Had standard room, so there was no luxury like bath robes or coffee maker. The spa in the basement was nice but very small. Tiny pool and tiny wardrobes. Did not try the restaurant, but had a glass of wine on the side of the river, where the hotel has put up tables and umbrellas. Fun place to watch people. Many sights are within walking distance, so location is good. Taxis are reasonably priced, we found. Would stay again only if price is right. But the hotel lacks a bit of charm and details of luxury, which would make it more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish modern Berlin hotel”
Reviews.Author: bristolreviewer
Reviews.Content: We had a long rainy summer weekend here and couldn't fault the hotel. With a giant fish tank in the atrium over the pleasant cocktail bar, the rooms are very stylish and comfortable. Breakfasts good but a pricy 25 Euro - try the excellent coffee shop in the next door arcade for a value alternative. Restaurant is a very high standard: Emma's and the trattoria in the neighbouring arcade also good options. Hotel well situated for museums, Alexanderplatz too. Staff friendly and efficient. Altogether a good Berlin base.

Reviews.Title: “Schoenes Hotel, schoene Stadt (beautiful hotel, beautiful city)”
Reviews.Author: OriginalFrau
Reviews.Content: My brother and I took a trip to Berlin and stayed here. Outstanding location in the heart of city center. We walked EVERYWHERE since this was centrally located. The rooms were very nice and extraordinarily quiet. We opted for a room with a view of the saltwater tank. This was great fun to sit on the balcony and people watch. The room was impeccably kept, very comfortable with all necessary ammneities. I needed some additional items and this was taken care of quickly. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. Classic European with a large array of items. We looked forward to it every morning. Great hotel, good staff - highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 stars, but not bad”
Reviews.Author: 2SunnyBeaches
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in June. We had two rooms. One had a small balcony. The Berliner Dome was right outside the window. The rooms were okay, just average hotel rooms. Clean. Bathrooms were adequate. Bed were very hard. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet, lots of food and fresh squeezed juice. The hotel is in a great location. Just a short stroll to the museums. Berlin was nice and clean. People were friendly. We had perfect weather. The aquarium in the lobby was nice. There was a pool and spa that we did not try out. Overall, the hotel was nice. Nice modern amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Radison - you know what you get”
Reviews.Author: MathildaES
Reviews.Content: Typical Radison hotel, ie always good and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a perfect location for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Eine_blom
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here between 22 - 27 of July. We had a business suit with a small balcony and a view to the Berliner Dom and the river Spree. The room was ordinary but the bed was very comfortably and the room was quiet (if you turned off the air conditioner) so we had no problem to sleep. Good and fast service both at the check in and check out. Very good breakfast buffet with plenty of choices, which means different choices every morning during our stay. There was also a chef who made an omelet from your choice. Plus also to free internet access in the lobby. Relax area in the basement was also clean and had different choise of sauna. Location is great, close to the island "Museum Sinsel" and a nice walk via “Unter den Linden” up to Brandenburger Tor For business or pleasure this is really a wonderful place to stay and we will definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “First class view and great location”
Reviews.Author: PotiguarDenmark
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hitel for two nights as we did our christmas shopping in Berlin. Upon arrivel we were amazed by the water column which literally rises up from the lobby. Luckily, we had booked a room with a view to the column, whih I liked very much, As I understand it there are also rooms with a view to the street instead. The room was great and modern, but we did not spend much time there, Staff was friendly. From the hotel lots of christmas markets and sights were within walking distance, but the Alexanderplatz Station is also really close.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will stay there again if back in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Asseneta
Reviews.Content: Went to Berlin for a long weekend with my best friend and we stayed at the Radisson Blu as it was recommended on Tripadvisor and some friends of ours recommended it as well. The hotel is amazing, very modern, very clean, I have never seen an acquarium in a hotel before and was very impressed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again if in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: AJC22
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Munich before we came to Berlin by train for two nights. When we arrived at the hotel we were amazed by the aquadom in the foyer which we could also see from our room overlooking the foyer. The room is small with two hard and uncomfortable single beds pushed together, the pillows were like cotton wool and give no support whatsoever. We didn't sleep well at this hotel as a consequence.There are no teamaking facilities in the room, room service is $7 per small pot, given that we had just spent 7 hours on a train it would have been lovely to have a teamaking facility in the room, there is a mini bar but its very expensive. There are three English channels, two of which are news channels, one is Sky Cinema but half the time the movies werent in English despite it being listed as a English channel. It is lovely being able to see the aquadom from your room but its quite noisy with the door open, constant pinging of the elevators, general hub bub, also because there is no natural light or air its very dark and stuffy. Better to admire the aquadom from the foyer and have a room overlooking the river instead. Berlin itself is wonderful, when you leave the hotel turn right and keep walking in that direction towards the Brandenburg Gate which is about a 15 to 20 minute walk away. We walked up to the Gate twice, once in the daytime and again in the evening when it was lit up and there was a pianist playing right in front of it, amazing! We turned left on our first night towards Alexanderplatz which we found to be grotty, unfriendly and smelly. We only did this once! There are several lovely cafes right next to the hotel overlooking the lovely river and impressive Berlin Dom. We will return to Berlin because it is awesome but not sure whether it would be to this hotel. Not really sure why it was Trip Advisor hotel of the year in 2010....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Nessienoo22
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a long weekend the Radisson Hotel. This hotel is directly opposite the Berliner Dom and Museum Island, a very short walk to Alexanderplatz and Hackescher Markt and close to the Brandenberg Gate and Checkpoint Charlie. The room was spotless, the bed comfy and the shower and bath easy to use and water pressure was high. Only downside was the pillows, extremely soft and thin. We had a fabulous dinner in the Heat Restaurant downstairs and the staff were very friendly and attentive. The breakfast is expensive at 25 Euros so we walked to the popular Hackescher Markt where they serve large cheaper breakfasts. The large aquarium is amazing but you need to pay to get entry into Sea Life next door to be able to go up the lift inside. The hotel was extremely easy to get to from Schonefeld Airport. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby, nice hotel, but they ended up disappointing us.”
Reviews.Author: AndersRiedel
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we went for the 40 euro business class upgrade (which include breakfast for two people and that would normally cost us €50, the reception claimed). So we got a room on the sixth floor. We checked in at 1 PM, but they had no available rooms at that time, so the staff took our number and then they called us when the room was ready. We also asked for Internet access and we got a special access code. A nice touch and we could then sit in the big lobby while we were surfing and looking at the amazing aquarium. They also guided us to the nearest shopping mall with a smile and mentioned that we could borrow an umbrella from the Concierge, as it would be raining all day... And of course they took care of the luggage until the room was ready. The room (number 6101) was OK and on the top floor. Located right in front of the elevators. I noticed some rooms on the 4th and perhaps 5th floor, had a balcony wide enough for a small table and some chairs, but ours was just big enough for a person to stand there. We had a great view of the Cathedral and the boats passing by below. There was complementary Jelly Beans in a small bag :) and bottled water. You will also find a Nespresso coffee maker, which is standard in a lot of Radisson hotels and that's always nice. Free Wi-Fi and it worked flawlessly for once. Perhaps because we only used the code we got when we arrived. A lot of TV channels including 4-5 in English (mostly sports and news). One channel played a movie which was dubbed in German, but the next channel had the movie in its original language. The breakfast wasn't as impressive as in many other Radisson hotels, especially in Scandinavia. Here you'll find a regular buffet with a couple of hot dishes - Mostly eggs and sausages. They only had 1 bread toaster and it only took 2 slices of bread at a time, so you can imagine the wait you might experience on a busy day. They serve breakfast both in the restaurant and the adjoining lobby where you can enjoy a view to the huge fish tank. The waiters are very service oriented and I'm especially impressed with the service they offered a disabled man and their patience as he had a lot of trouble expressing himself clearly and therefore he got quite frustrated. We got late check-out which is offered in the business class upgrade upon availability. That was nice and we could then enjoy a film and relax in our room after breakfast before we left. As we were leaving we exited the basement parking and it wasn't a pleasant experience, as there are often a lot of traffic when you drive onto Spandauer Strasse from the parking garage. We were hit by a large truck that was stuck in the entrance of the garage and therefore decided to move to the exit lane, he just forgot to see if anybody was there already and the front of our car got totally smashed up. As the driver didn't spoke English, we went back into the hotel to get a translator. They wouldn't/couldn't help us with that in the reception, but they did call the police. Luckily the building inspector drove right behind us and he could lead the police to several surveillance cameras and from those the police could help us out as the truck driver at first didn't recognized it as his fault. We could have used a bit of help from the hotel in that situation, but I guess they didn't want to stand in the rain when we were no longer officially guests at the hotel?! Before the accident the hotel was almost a 5 star hotel (only the buffet breakfast lacked a bit), but when they left us standing alone with the truck driver who didn't understood us or recognized our anxiety while waiting for the police in front of their parking garage, I can't give them more than 3 stars. It's all about the small things, and for once Radisson Blu failed us.

Reviews.Title: “With 1000+ reviews, everything has been said about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aethelred
Reviews.Content: and I agree with much of this - but not all, so I would just like to counterbalance the rave reviews a bit, for whatever it's worth and for as long as this review will be high enough on the list that it will be read. :-) Yes, the aquarium is nice, and to look at the fish is relaxing (although rooms towards the atrium mean air condition during the night, and no view of the outside weather). The location is really nice if one is busy in Mitte - tourism, some shopping and the nice Hackescher Markt neighborhood, the Berlin Madison Ave., with really good restaurants. I also found the staff uniformly friendly and trying; the front desk was always very nice, and all maintenance staff greeted the guests as if after some very good training. And I like the pool that allows lap swimming, which has good opening hours (6 am - 10 pm). Why then just an "average" rating? Because all this may be as it is, but this is just not a ***** hotel by any standards - it is a **** one. Some of the general hotel amenities are ****, but the standard *rooms* (and these are not a cheap class but the main category) are definitely not; partially, they are even ***. And for me, the key to hotel is my room and not the public areas. Beds here are small, mattresses not that great, rooms are small (too small for two I think), the wifi (in a normal 4th floor room) often so weak it switched off (ipad, so the receiver was not the problem), a very inconvenient bathroom desk fromwhich things kept falling; a bad water and crane system that necessarily flooded the area with the stuff there; no reading lamps at the bed; and so on and so on. Sure, this is way better than a Motel One and even for **** I would have found this probably okay. But the fact is that for the price the Radisson Blu demands, and seeing how much other hotels in this category cost - Berlin is not expensive for hotels - there is no correlation; one pays to much for small, inconvenient rooms. If one wants precisely this location and/or the fish tank and isn't fussy about rooms and sleep quality, one should go here, but if one looks for a genuine ***** hotel, one definitely can find a much better one in Berlin, and for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location – Reservation problem”
Reviews.Author: Alexandros D
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel with an exceptional lobby and very good facilities with great staff. The bar is at the lobby from where you can have your drink and view the great fish tank. The room was very well equipped. The location is perfect. Exactly outside the hotel makes stop the Hop On Hop Off bus, across the street and behind the park there is an area full of nice restaurants and almost behind the hotel is the area. The only problem we had was with the reservation. Although we had booked, one month before our arrival, a business room which had view of the Dom and the river (one of the reasons why we booked this hotel from the hotels official site ) at our arrival they told us that they did not have that kind of room and they gave us an “upgrade “ a suite on the first floor with a view of the street. However we would stay again at this hotel ( if they would give us the room we have booked ) and we would recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with amazing lobby”
Reviews.Author: BouH
Reviews.Content: After staying one night at Friedrichshain we decided to stay one night at Radisson. And I think it was great. Aqaurium inside hotel really strikes. Although you can't enter the lift inside it if you're not a visitor of Berlin Aquadome. The staff was very friendly, room was clean and good. There was very-very small balcony. Alexanderplatz is about 7-10 minutes by walk. If you go other side you'll see many palce of interest. Breakfast was very good but at 10 AM staff takes out all food without asking if you want something else. Also if you like to sleep and forgot about breakfast - there are many small cafes near hotel. I think this hotel is nice place to stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel 2nd visit won't be our last.”
Reviews.Author: Shuggyb
Reviews.Content: Great location, great breakfast, lovely helpful staff, brilliant cocktails, good clean rooms - what more do I need to say?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tziambra
Reviews.Content: I have been to Berlin many times and stayed at different hotel. The Radisson Blu Hotel is a great choice for tourists (and businesspeople) because of its location. It is between the Branderburg gare, the museum island and the Hackeshermarkt. Most attractions are walking distance and even buses pass in front of the hotel. The concierge was very helpful and my parents - first time in Berlin and non-german speakers - were able to book tours to the city and even Potsdam. The lobby of the hotel has a very nice aquarium inside, people visit the hotel just for that. The rooms were nicely sized and modern, no complaints there. There are smoking floors too, if anyone is interested. We were in a non-smoking one and it did not smell like smoke. I did not get the breakfast but my parents did so I sat with them, it looked just fine, standard breakfast buffet affair.

Reviews.Title: “Underwater Adequacy But Location Wins Over The Battle”
Reviews.Author: tripdecider
Reviews.Content: The lobby aquariam is an appealing enough reason to choose the Radisson. The perfect location, situated close enough to museums, landmarks and all things touristy. Rooms are basic, lacked basic kitchen provisions such as a kettle and not the most exciting room to sit in. Gym facilities are excellent and concierge was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Meeting Location with Fantastic, Efficient Service”
Reviews.Author: deirdrecrowley
Reviews.Content: I spend my life on the road facilitating meetings - from one conference center and hotel to another. SOOO, when a hotel does a great job of supporting the success of one of my sessions I like to be the first to say so. First, the obvious: the Radisson Blu is in an incredible section of Berlin. The Beliner Dome is right next door and the meeting/reception space offers a stunning view of it. The Brandenburg Gate is within walking distance as is the MItte district with Checkpoint Charlie and loads of shopping. As for the hotel itself, the first thing you'll notice is the stunning million gallon aquarium in the lobby. I never tired of looking at it throughout our weeklong stay and you can sit at the bar and admire it while enjoying the nice wines and foods that they serve. As wonderful as the neighborhood and the lobby are, the meeting facilities are even better and the banquet team which supports them is terrific. Ask for Andre - he was incredibly helpful throughout the week - kind, professional, experienced and efficient - a winning combination. The rooms are nice, bright and incredibly QUIET! The beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional business class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Its_Scandinavian
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blu should be proud of the property in Berlin. The hotel is very nice and of course, the lobby is impressive with the aquarium and design. Location can't be better with Unter den Linden and Museum Island as neighbours and all around you have nice sights. Had a business class room which was very nice, I could expect it to be a little bit more spacious but it was very functional with all amenities that you need. Excellent turn-down service and overall nice decór and design. Nice view over the cathedral and Spree. One of the great gems of this hotel is the breakfast and the restaurant. Service for both breakfast buffet (that is one of the best I have experienced) and the restaurant is excellent. The menu in evening is extensive and the food is good sized portions and comes with great value. I truly recommend you to have dinner al fresco in the outdoor setting. We had dinner here two nights because it was to our fully satisfaction. I would like to put an excellent rating for the hotel, but I think the front desk team could try a little bit harder and working with their friendlyness. Not that they was polite or rude, they was just nothing... Furthermore I was not happy with the concierge service, they forgot to tell us how that we should exchange the tickets for the hop-on-hop-off bus in the counter next to the hotel as well as it was dissapointing that they adviced us a very shabby and not at all excellent restaurant. We wanted to visit the Bocca Di Bacco for italian dinner, but the concierge adviced the Moreno Carusi restaurant that should be much better and fill our taste. This place was a hugh dissapointment, both with food and the service. Not at all worth the taxi ride from the hotel. However - the hotel is five star and got everything that you need with some exceptional good facilities and experiences and I will definitely return when I go to Berlin next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - if you like fish tanks”
Reviews.Author: GenevaBeaver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nicely situated in the middle of Mitte - where most of the interesting things are. The rooms were not especially big - and were not especially cheap by Berlin standards. If you book the business class option - you get the same room - but a Nesspresso machine thrown in for free (with six capsules, I can hardly wait) - and fluffy robes. By far the best bit of the hotel is the fish tank - and reception is full of people looking at the fish. Having said that you can't actually go into the tank area (the lift that goes through it) without going to the acquarium - which you have to pay another 10 euros for. Breakfast was pretty standard for a hotel like this - certainly not worth 25 euros - but OK if its included in your room rate. Reception staff were a little Germanic (ie even when they apologised it sounded like they were telling you off). The spa was good - although I'd hesitate to take the kids - there were gentlemen without towels down there. The pool is big enough for two people - and I'm not sure what the reservation system was, but we were clearly trespassing.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun - I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Moi_Lyon
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel, definitely a very different and enjoyable experience. We got the aquarium view room which was lovely and relaxing (despite the tourists regularly passing your window!), and also had a view onto the charming little bar. The rooms were clean and quite spacious. The location is also brilliant, and really made our whirlwind sightseeing tour a lot easier as it was so central. I recommend taking the breakfast if it's included- it's really tasty and there's so much food that you'll probably save money on lunch as well. We booked this hotel through the eBay deal, which made it a bargain too!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Zelenec
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in the city centre, easy to walk almost everywhere. Impressive building linked to Aquarium, very modern and clean. Amazing lobby area with large tank of water, with lift going through aquarium. Rooms very spacious, modern and clean, views either outside the hotel or inside the lobby. Fantastic breakfast, very fast service with smile all the time. Friendly receptionists, happy to assist anytime. Definitely one of the best hotels in Berlin, will be happy to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great, full service hotel with a few rough edges”
Reviews.Author: EdwardBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: We were generally very happy with this hotel. Great location next to Museum Island, though a bit of a walk to the Alexander Platz train station. However, there were a few design issues with the room. The air conditioner kept turning on and off every minute. There is no temperature control. Instead, you had to adjust a knob between '+' and '-'. The shower stall was a bit cramped. The doorknob on the bathroom door doesn't turn, so when you close the bathroom door the latch crashes against the doorjam making a loud noise. The blackout curtains didn't completely cover the windows so a sliver of light woke us up in the morning. We complained about this and were told it would be fixed but it wasn't. But these were all minor exceptions in an otherwise fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: mike551979
Reviews.Content: I've not stayed in many hotels that take your breath away on entering reception. This one does. There's an awesome multi-storey cylindrical aquarium right in the lobby. Some rooms open on to the aquarium but ours was possibly even better with a balcony opening on to the canal and cathedral. Everything was spot on, even the room service meal came on a trolley come table that we ate off at the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Don't sign a bill until you check it. Ask for all receipts - seriously.”
Reviews.Author: pachin
Reviews.Content: I entertained a number of clients at this hotel during my week-long stay. I don't typically scrutinize the bill in front of clients as I feel this can make things awkward - boy, I wish I had. There were so many irregularities in pricing from night to night, it was crazy. It was only when I sat down and looked through the collection of receipts did I realize this. However, once you sign it - it's set in stone. Upon check-out really had to battle with them to correct this. Also, the mini bar scam is alive and well at this hotel. If you so much as move a drink, you will be charged. That was another battle. Otherwise, I really like this hotel - except for the smell and the tourists and the sporadic internet.

Reviews.Title: “Best out there!!”
Reviews.Author: tripsrme
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Radisson Blu Hotel for 4 nights in March for city break. Speedy and efficient check in and offered choice of room. Could opt for one overlooking atrium and aquarium or park. Safe and secure as you need your key pass to activate lift. Room well appointed and very comfortable. Space saving door which doubled as both bathroom and toilet door depending which way you closed it!. slight problem with room safe which was rectified with speed. Very quiet rooms. No noise from corridor or traffic. Spa facility (which I think was a franchise) was a little disappointing. Staff somewhat dour and curt. Pool very small and not well heated. Ladies might like to note policy of no swimwear in sauna/steam room. Suggest do not go if easily offended as men have tendency to "strut their stuff!!" Buffet breakfast and absolute delight. staff have clearly been trained to extremely high standard and attention to detail was clearly obvious. Plentiful array of food, regularly replenished and all of high quality. Specialty coffees available at no extra charge. Hotel well located opposite river from cathedral. Convenient for metro stations and tram stops. Easy walking distance for Brandenburg Gate and other tourist sights. Easy access to sightseeing bus which was great value. Sensational aquarium from next door sea life centre is an integral part of lobby area. Only downside of stay was the hassle from Bosnian beggars who are present at all main tourist areas.....best policy is completely ignore them! All in all a great hotel which enhanced our city break, and is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind”
Reviews.Author: 351pete
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blu Berlin is a one of a kind hotel, as is the only hotel that I’ve been that has a giant aquarium on the lobby, which I found very impressive. Don’t get me wrong, the hotel still provides the usual great standards of comfort, cleanliness, that one expects to find in other Radisson hotels, but it’s got something more, it’s not just another boring hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good rooms, Mainly helpful staff with some annoying exceptions”
Reviews.Author: Carragollan
Reviews.Content: Having read a previous report reagrding "single beds pulled together to make a double" I requested a stand alone "Double". On arrival I was advised it was two singles. When I queried it the the guy looked at me blankly, said nothing and walked off to whisper to a colleague - returned and still said nothing but just produced new papers. I asked had it the same view and was told yes, however it clearly wasn't as it looked out on the side of the adjoing building then unprompted by us the chap with the luggage said this is not a good room and offerred to return to the desk and re-arrange. After about twenty minutes I called reception ( we had been travelling since 4.30am ) to be told "he's in the lift" " in a tone of utter dis-interest. Another example of slightly arch behaviour was on asking the Concierge where the "cloakroom" was which prompted teh response "cloakroom ?" leaving me to say "Toilet". Trivial stuff maybe but this type of pedantic nonsense can be tiresome. Any Concierge of an International hotel chain should be familiar with the numerous labels used for a toilet from Loo through Restroom,Bathroom,Cloakroom etc. In contrast the girl at the breakfast desk was charming and effecient. Leaving all of the above fairly minor stuff aside its a terrific hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “What you need to know”
Reviews.Author: VictorMeldrewAgain
Reviews.Content: Firstly TXL bus stops within 100m of hotel - stop is called Mariam Kirche / Spandauer Strasse. It's really easy from the airport Didn't have breakfast at hotel but there are loads of places to eat right near to hotel and due to central location there is not much walking to be done. Hotel pool more the size of a large bath tub - perhaps no more than six swimmers to reach capacity. Beware of static electricity - got quite a complex when have to touch door handles. No way five stars but good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: panch
Reviews.Content: The location in Mitte is ideal. The hop on hop off bus is in front of the hotel. The U Bahn is a few blocks away, and the hip stores of Mitte are right behind the hotel. Also the TXL to the airport is a blcok away. Rooms are large and the bathroom is modern. The included breakfast has multiple choices. The concierge was very helpful. No problems if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location for a biz/leisure combination”
Reviews.Author: FLIEGER67
Reviews.Content: Well, there are such a huge number of reviews around this accomodation here. Location is perfect beside the Museumsinsel in the middle of former east Berlin. Some 20.00 Euros by Taxi from Tegel airport. Just a five minutes taxi ride from my business location. A nice welcome, as usual I´ve asked for the top floor and while there was no room available at first it shows one up withhin a minute, level six for me. The room was clean and well designed, the bathroom also fitted with a bathtub. Only a shrrt night to sleep, breakfast buffet with everything there what I need. A really recommendable place especially on company´s expenses.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to tour East Berlin, but just on the pricey side”
Reviews.Author: wbullseye
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right next to both the Dome and the DDR Museum. Being there over the Christmas timeframe, there were many Christmas markets within walking distance. The hotel offers all of the comforts one expects such as a restaurant, bar, nice rooms, gym, and as an added bonus an aquarium. The staff were extremely helpful to include printing out documents that I needed and would've delivered them to my room if I hadn't beat them down to the lobby. Certain members on the bar staff were extremely slow, but it looked like it might have been a new crew. The biggest issue I had was with the concierge. Given the increased security measures, the only way to see the Reichstag was to have a reservation for dinner. We made our reservation for four for Christmas dinner through the concierge, however when we showed up the polizei had no records of the reservation being made at all and we couldn't go in. The rooms were nicely appointed and comfortable. We had a view of the Dome which was nice in the winter with the snow and blue sky. Wireless in the rooms is free, but if you want to use the computers in the lobby you'll need to pay. The speed was fast enough for what I needed it for. In order to use the elevator, you must use your room key which is a nice safety measure. The stairwells were also locked on the floors past the first floor as well, so you could evacuate if necessary but visitors couldn't bypass the elevators. The aquarium is adjacent to the hotel, and has part of it in the hotel lobby itself. It was relaxing to sit at the bar and watch the fish swim by. The aquarium itself is also worth a visit. We ate at the bar a few times, as the restaurant was overpriced for the special meals. The restaurant is reasonable at other times, but still pricey which was probably why not too many people were eating there. Although not as nice as some of the Radissons in Scandinavia, it is definitely of high quality and better than a lot of other hotels in Germany.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, helpful staff, great buffet breakfast,”
Reviews.Author: BerlinMarch2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights. The location is fantastic. If you get a room facing Museum Island you wake up to see the top of the church, the river and the gorgeous museum buildings. The hotel is two blocks from a main subway station, 3 blocks from the heart of the boutique shopping district, very centrally located for many of the great museums. The buffet breakfast is excellent. The rooms are very nice. It is expensive and is not quaint by any means, this is a business hotel. The huge fish tank is really impressive and a lot of fun to gaze at every evening and morning. This was our first trip to Berlin so I can't compare the hotel to other options, but we had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff and Fun Experience”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveler55
Reviews.Content: All the receptionists, concierge, Atrium Bar staff, Breakfast/Restaurant staff were so friendly. Infact, the friendliest of any hotel/city I've been to in Europe. The hotel lobby was very nice. We spent every evening sitting in the lobby enjoying the atmosphere and looking at the fish in the large AquaDome. The only downside was that hotel quests could not go up the AquaDome for free. The price (even with the guest discount) was too high. The rooms were modern. We had a view of the dome which was very nice. I don't think the rooms were quite 5 stars...more like 4 stars based on other hotels I've stayed at. One of the days we were there our room was not cleaned and the trash wasn't emptied. All the maid did was make the bed and give us new towels. This shouldn't happen at any hotel. We didn't complain though. Luckily the next day the maid actually cleaned the room. The elevators were a pain. We go stuck between floors once. It was no big deal because the staff got us out within a few minutes. However, in general, the elevators were taking forever and were doing things like going down instead of up...etc. The hotel breakfast was very very good. We got a room rate with breakfast included and it was well worth it. Also, we ate dinner one night at the hotel restaurant and the food was delicious and the service was really good. The location of this hotel is perfect. It is within walking distance to a lot of the sites and a 2 minute walk to the S-bahn station. Also, there are so many restaurants to chose from within a 5 minute walk. One thing, don't get directions to/from the airport to the hotel from the staff. They have no idea and gave us wrong directions both ways. They kept saying to take the S9 from the closest station directly to the airport. There is no S9 at any of the stations near the hotel. You have to switch trains. When I told them this they were suprised. They also said it only takes 45 min. to get to Schonfeld Airport...but it took us 1.5 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great in many ways”
Reviews.Author: PamR
Reviews.Content: As so many have said, great location, friendly staff, good breakfast, 6th floor business rooms excellent, Nespresso machine great. For me, the negatives were: spotty internet connection; some service slip-ups (no removal of dirty coffee cups or refill of coffee one day; missing newspaper one day; no turn-down service one day). I would stay here again, unless I found a similarly located place a bit less expensive offering similar amenities. I had breakfast included -- otherwise it would be very pricey. Travel tips: Convenient #100 bus traverses the central city and the stop is to the right over the bridge. Easiest S-bahn stop is Hackesher Market -- turn right and then right again along the walk by the river. Follow to S-bahn. An Asian market is on the street across from and parallel to the S-bahn, where you can get inexpensive mineral water, tea and snacks for the room. Museums also accessed by walking along the river walk. It's only 5 or 10 minutes to get there. HEat restaurant very good. Room service also good - excellent "veal escalope", which is schnitzel. Some good restaurants in the Nikolaivertel. Cross the street in front of hotel and cross the Marx-Lenin square and you'll be in the area. I liked Provencal (along the river another block); also Zur Gerichtslaube small German restaurant by the Nikolai church. That whole area interesting to explore. I found Alexanderplatz extremely confusing for transportation and avoided it when possible. I did not take the airport bus, but it also stops by the hotel. Taxis from Tegel were only around 20 euros. There is an ATM machine across from gate 11 at the airport, and you can also get a transit pass (Berlin Welcome Card) at the airport by gate 8.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: anafi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely perfect. Within walking distance from everywhere (Alexanderplatz, Museum island, Brademburg Gate). Close to bus stations (100, 200, TXL lines) and metro station (Hachescher Market). The breakfast has everything you may think of. The fish tank is very impressive, especially for young children. The staff is very helpful. They even brought us some pencils and drawings for my little girl. If you have the option choose a room with a terrace looking at Berlin and not in the acquarium because everybody in the lobby will look through your window while drinking a coffee.The Pinocchio store right next to the hotel entrance was a must for the baby. The nearest market to get some water is in Alexanderplatz in the shopping malls. Try the restaurants near the metro station (we ate at Rocca and it was good). If you stay 5 days buy the Welcome Berlin Card. It definitely worth the money and you can get it at the airport. Except for the museum island (not a discount there) you get discounts in several places such as Zoo, Legoland, trip to Potsdam, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - 200 meters from city hall”
Reviews.Author: NorFinn
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Maybe to large for a weekend with my wife. The most of the attraction within a walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Berlin for young people”
Reviews.Author: fischi19
Reviews.Content: Every year we are at the ITB for a couple days. We always go to the Radisson Blu. It is perfectly located, close to the Museums-Insel, next to Alexanderplatz and Hackescher Markt. There are my small caffees and bars just around the corner. We had a business class room on the 6th floor, overlooking the Dom with breakfast included. All rooms are very bright, clean and designed in a modern, fashionate way. WiFi is complimentary and there is a Nespresso machine with 6 capsules for free per day in the room. Amazing if you like good coffee! Breakfast was excellent as always. Several fresh smoothies, juices, eggs and so on are available. Rich selection of jams, hams, cheeses and various kinds of bread. If you book ahead of time you can get really good deals. We booked in November 2010 already and paid 117 Euros per room inclusive breakfast for two. We also recomment to eat at HEat restaurant, if you like indian/asian fusion kind of food. The only thing i don't like, and it has nothing to do specifically with this very hotel, is that the fridge is full with beverages and it detects automatically if something is removed. If you happen to bring your own bottles you have no place to cool them down. Over all, the best value you get for money in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nasharch
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Radisson Blu during a 5 day business trip. My room was nice and clean with awesome city views, and with some smart design solutions that made the room feel cozy and cool at the same time. The location was great, easy access to public transportation and close to must see sights. The breakfast was delicious with a great variety of items so even if you stay longer you have something new to try each morning. The staff was friendly, professional and helpful whenever approached with requests or questions (but seemingly everyone is, even in small shops in Berlin!) All in all I had a great stay and would highly recommend this hotel for business and leisure travelers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Almost great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Eastsiders17
Reviews.Content: Came here for a short stay of 4 nights. Easy to get to from Schonefeld airport by airport express train to Alexanderplatz then 5 mins walk. Recommend getting the public transport pass at the shop in airport before exiting. Fantastic first impressions of hotel lobby with wow factor from the vertical cylindrical fish tank in centre of the atrium, especially when lit at night. The bar is very attractive but pricey. Room facing out with full height windows overlooking Karl Liebknecht Strasse and the Rathaus (Town Hall) was smart, clean, spacious, good quality bathroom fittings, well sound-insulated, effective air-con. But disappointed not to have tea or coffee making facility or free water machine or ice machine in corridors. Disappointing to have 2 single beds pushed together instead of one double. We breakfasted at Balzac Coffee and the Bakery on the corner (but beware their hygiene standards - the staff seemed untroubled by a sparrow pecking on the breads on the counter!). Within 5 minutes walk are numerous cafes in Hackersher Markt including Kamps@Backstube cafe with choice of set breakfasts. The breakfast buffet in the hotel bar looked very tempting with various breads, cheeses, meats, smoked salmon, a variety of herrings, cereals, fruit, yogurts and you could easily make a packed lunch at the same time but at 25 euros we resisted the temptation. The hotel location is fantastic for visiting Museum Island attractions, and the 100 and 200 buses stop close by just over the river, 50 meters away, heading west towards Zoo on the other side of the Tiergarten, one going north side past the Reichstag, one going south via Potsdamerplatz. Finally, strongly recommend starting a stay in Berlin with a walking tour with Insider tours. Our guide was fantastically authoritative, passionate about Berlin and gave us a real beginning of an understanding of the history of Berlin and how the modern city was shaped.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: RusNewton
Reviews.Content: I visited Berlin with my 13-year-old son. We booked a twin room at this hotel on the advice of a friend who knows Berlin well. The whole trip was pretty much seamless. Ahead of arrival, I found the concierge very helpful when discussing options for transportation from Tegel Airport (they offered to pick us up, but in the end we got a regular taxi costing about EUR 20 for a 25min journey). Check-in was quick, friendly and painless. The reception area is probably one of the biggest 'draws' for the hotel - in the centre there's a huge cylindrical aquarium containing one million litres (more than a quarter of a million US gallons) of water and a vast array of marine tropical fish. Each morning a couple of divers enter the tank to clean the glass and do maintenance. It's pretty cool - especially because the hotel's elevators are also glass so you get a view of various levels of the aquarium as you rise towards your room. There is a bar running around the base of the aquarium and it's a nice place to sit if you're waiting to meet someone or to have a drink. We had booked a Business-class room - it was nicely furnished, showing no signs of wear & tear, and had plenty of wardrobe hanging & shelving, plus a Nespresso-style coffee machine and good-sized desk. The room overall was not particularly large (just big enough for twin beds, two armchairs, desk etc) but it was certainly good enough for our purposes. The beds were comfortable, although the pillows were very soft indeed. All the linen was nice quality - not shabby or threadbare towels, which can be a disappointment in a nice hotel sometimes. Breakfast was in their HEat restaurant which is a kind of fusion place but the breakfast was very traditional Northern European - cold meats, cheeses, fruit & cereal plus a selection of cooked meats & eggs from the buffet. All very tasty and included in our room rate, which I prefer. Also included in the room was internet access - both wired in the room and WiFi elsewhere. Every hotel should do that! The location is extremely good if you're sightseeing - right on the edge of Museum Island, so literally three minutes walk to the Pergamon, Altes & Neues Museums, five or six minutes to the Deutsches Historisches Museum, ten minutes to the Brandeburg Gate. There are a number of U-bahn stations nearby for longer journeys and there was always a plentiful supply of taxis outside for when we were feeling lazy. The spa area was very nice, although the pool was a smidgen too cold for my tastes. Overally, thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous bar!”
Reviews.Author: mandyb64
Reviews.Content: We've just had a long weekend in Berlin and stayed at the Radisson Blu hotel. Good location, handy for all the sights. Sleek, minimalist and exceptionally clean rooms, which were well equipped, though it was a shame there was no iron. The staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly, particularly behind the bar. We loved the bar area and sat there each evening with a coffee and a brandy before going to bed; having been mesmerized by the aquarium!! We also found a great little bar at the back of the hotel called the 'Alt Berliner Wirtshaus' (on Wilhelmstrasse). SImple but great food. We would thoroughly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that never lets you down!”
Reviews.Author: voille
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three amazing nights without one single complaint. When you enter the hotel you get blown away from the giant aquarium and for the rest of your stay the Radisson Blu never lets you down. Spacious rooms with smart solutions, nice bed, quality sheets, big bathroom and modern yet cozy interior. Had a room on the first floor facing the river Spree and the Berlin Cathedral. With the floor to ceiling widows you cannot dream of a better view from your room/bed. It’s worth the hotel rate itself, I have never experienced something like it before. The staff was helpful and witty in all apartments of the hotel (reception, bar, restaurant Heat and in the wellness area). The pool in the wellness area was a delight after a long day taking in the many sights of Berlin. Location wise you cannot be in a better place in Berlin. Easy access to everything! Highly recommend this hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - one of the best places I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: NewickChap
Reviews.Content: This is the ultimate high-qulaity European hotel. Great but unobtrusive service, and large, very comfortable rooms with all the necessary 'kit' for both leisure and business travellers. Have stayed at several Radisson Blu's recently in different European cities - it really is a formula that works.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: dennis37139
Reviews.Content: all perfect but the sheets are too shorts. the fish pool is amazing!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel - Not cheap, but nice and conviently located”
Reviews.Author: sgilless
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very conveniently close to the "Museums Insel", and many touristic highlights of Berlin can be reached walking. The coolest feature of this hotel is the aquarium, a huge glass vessel in the middle of the lobby, stretching from the ground floor nearly up to the roof. Many tourists try to enter the lobby to take a picture of the aquarium. Staying in this place really feels luxurious, given how nice the whole setting is. The prices can vary strongly, and we were lucky with a well negotiated rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a stay in Europe's finest city!”
Reviews.Author: K3KJS
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Berlin in December for a weeks break with my other half. Having not visited the city before I can honestly say I have returned madly in love with Berlin and have already booked my return trip! Having stayed in Radisson hotels before, on numerous occasions I knew what to expect. The rooms were very comfortable with everything we needed. We took a smoking room, though the room had a balcony so we mostly smoked out there. It was nice to have that option however. The bathroom was perfect, tv, wifi, mini-bar, everything we could have wanted or expected. It's not as 'flashy' as some of the Radisson hotels I have stayed in but more than adequate. My only complaint being the double bed was two large singles pushed together with two single duvets which wasn't the ideal situation for a romantic break! The room temperature was spot on, and the staff really couldn't do enough to help. It should be noted that the rooms seem totally soundproof. Not once did we hear our 'neighbours' or people walking in the corridors. The aquarium is also quite something. Room service was quick and efficient, slightly pricey but that is to be expected. Mini bar and hotel bar v. expensive but again, you're paying for the convenience. Breakfast was included in our room rate, and I was very impressed with the choices on offer. I woke up every morning excited about going down to breakfast and I am not a morning person! Something to suit every taste available. The hotel restaurant, whilst limited menu wise, was more than adequate. Again on the expensive side. But after a long day sightseeing and the night bringing freezing temperatures and a snow-storm it was needed! Wiener Schnitzel was delicious. The location was perfect. Being right by the Alexanderplatz tower allows for easy navigation back to the hotel and it's in easy access of both S and U bahn stations. Overall, I would stay here again happily.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location/Hot rooms/Expensive breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Birdmans
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in lots of hotels in Berlin. This one is mediocre for a 5 star hotel. + Location is perfect - The rooms are to hot, and the airco can't cope with it. - Breakfast is wat to expensive. €25 p.p.! / Rates at the bar are in comparrison to the rest of the city absurd - Swimming pool is to small - Rooms are simple and the beds are terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, really soundproof”
Reviews.Author: Amunds
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for four nights with a group of friends. Fish tank was spectacular. The rooms are totally soundproof, which is rally appreciated from a light sleeper like me. Location great. Nice size of rooms. Only problem is that if you like fresh air make sure not to have room facing the fish tank. Breakfast was great, but a bit pricy.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: maroulaki79
Reviews.Content: everything was clean and gave us a sense of home away from home. we were amazed by the breakfast!!!! the aquarioum was amazing and all the staff really polite!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: carolinesCorkIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for New Years Eve 2010. Great location, only 5 mins walk from Alexanderplatz station. If coming from SXF airport take the RE7 or RB14 train to alexanderplatz, €2.80pp. We booked a business room with balcony,nice view of the river and Berlin dome,free wifi. Breakfast was included in our rate,it was good but there are loads of little cafes down the street that you can get breakfast in, for under€ 5.00. Staff were friendly and helpful. The hop on-hop off buses stop right outside the main entrance, we got off at the Zoo,I highly recommend a trip to the Zoo, giant panda was the highlight for me. There are a few restaurants just around the corner from hotel, we ate in Andys Diner, american style dinner, food was good and nicely priced! Brandenburg gate is only about 10-15 mins walk from hotel. We went down there at 8.30 thinking we would have loads of time to get in around the stalls etc set up for New Years eve,We were wrong, they were just starting to cordon off the streets block by block, but that was fine as we went over by the jewish memorial, found a nice little cafe,sat out on the veranda, had a few glasses of gluwhein, owners gave us blankets to wrap around ourselves and at 11.30pm we went over into the crowd and brought in the New Year, fireworks were amazing and I would recommend Berlin for New Years Eve. I will def go back to Berlin, but maybe when its a bit warmer, would also stay in Radisson Blu again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not 5 star, very tourist-y area. Could get better for money”
Reviews.Author: bimbobeautiful
Reviews.Content: I stayed along with around 20 friends in October 2010. The hotel reception is very impressive with the aquarium / posh bar etc. The rooms were standard I would not agree that they represented a 5 star hotel. The area wasn't very handy for shops / juice etc. There was a subway next to hotel and a fast food fish place which was nice but that was about it. The hotel was clean and was cleaned during our stay. I am going back to Berlin in May this year and I will chose to stay in one of the trendy districts instead of this tourist area. I found the taxis were a little expensive too, and I think this had something to do with the area we stayed in. The taxi from the airport was 40 $ which was quite good when we split it 4 ways.

Reviews.Title: “worst bed ever”
Reviews.Author: griswolds09
Reviews.Content: this hotel probably lives from its location, integrated huge aquadom aquarium and reputation. that's about all regarding the pros. if you manage to get a business room you get rewarded by the view of the berliner dom, a true landmark which stands across the river next to the hotel. otherwise you may either get the city- or aquarium view. both may also be experienced as exciting. our standard city view room, which we booked for 2adults and 1child thru the radisson web-site was really small with one back-pain matress on a double bed. we all woke up with severe back pain. this room was definitely too small for an extra bed, which we considered. why do they allow a booking for 2+1? nevertheless, even if you'll have this bed for your own, you're inviting yourself for some troubles. I would never stay here again despite the nice surroundings and staff. indoor pool is a joke. stay in the intercontinental or any nh hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: UKJosie
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location with great access to everything so from a tourist point of view this is a good place to stay. Our room overlooked the Cathedral which was a great sight, whereas our kids stayed in a room overlooking the atrium and the infamous fish tank. Both rooms were ideal. Really interesting to watch the divers clean the inside of the tank in the morning. Easy access from Tegal airport with the TXL bus stopping extremely close. Breakfast was what you would expect in a 5 star hotel and the staff were helpful and polite as we mumbled away in our very poor German. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Location and confort”
Reviews.Author: Luis_Esteves
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I was in Berlin, and I this was best hotel choice i could do! A modern Hotel in Museum Island, with a impressiv fish tank! But the confort, and the simpaty of the staff is also a good reason to go there again in a next trip to this marvellous town! I've been in corner suite with a lovely view to the Cathedral, and It was a great felling of prevelige to be so close of so many jewels of the german history|

Reviews.Title: “relaxing atmosphere, excellent spa, rooms are fantastic”
Reviews.Author: LTinka
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. The amazing aquarium was our view from the room. The rooms was big, and toilet a nd bath was beautiful and modern! SPA facilities were soo good just what you need after a whole day of sightseeing and shopping, except I cannot get used to seeing everybody completely nude.. Breakfast buffet was not impresive at all quite disapointed about the quality and choice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing aquariam in atrium, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: badpups
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a standard room which was fine. Very quiet, couldn't hear any noise from corridor or other rooms. Good bathroom and well equipped room with free wi-fi. Very comfortable bed. Some rooms overlook the atrium with a view of the amazing cylindrical aquarium which is meant to contain 1500 fish! We didn't eat in the hotel other than coffee and cake which was delicious but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A unique and special hotel”
Reviews.Author: sayyit
Reviews.Content: We only have good things to say about this excellent hotel. Our room facing the jaw dropping aquarium was better than we had hoped. Sitting watching the fish with a glass of wine really made my wife's birthday. The staff were superb, very well trained and helpful. Check in and out was quick and hassle free. The hotel position is great because you can walk to everything and the Christmas markets are just over the road. So you can fill up on Bratwurst washed down with Gluhwein and mix with the friendly Berliners.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: tthecht
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin for a conference later in the week, but stayed at the Radisson Blu for the days prior to transferring to another hotel. It was a terrific stay. Everything about it: the room, the amenities, the price, the breakfast, the staff, the location was perfect. I wish the second hotel had measured up to this one. Now if only the weather had been better.........

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with awesome location”
Reviews.Author: norajay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Blu for a weekend in November. Access from Tegel airport is very smoth: just take the TXL buss, it runs every 10 minutes ans stops just outside the hotel. The location is perfect: next to the most important museums, Alexanderplats and in front of the Cathedral. Most of the important sites are within walking distans. The hotel has a very modern design, the acuarium is amazing and hanging out in the lobby is very pleasent. You can ride an elevator inside the fish tank and as a guest of the hotel, they give you a discount. When we arrived, we were asked the chose a view for our room. We got what we asked for: a nice room overlooking the Cathedral and the Spree river. The room was spacious, with free Wi-Fi. The late check out, free of charge, was greatly appreciated. All you have to do is talk to someone at the reception desk the night before. The staff was very polite and helpful, attending all of our needs. We never tried the hotel restaurant nor the bar. Right next to the hotel, there is a new office area with a lot of different restaurants and caffés to choose for. The Berlin City sightseeing bus stops right in front of the hotel. There are always taxis waiting for you at the entrance and they are quite cheap, compared to Swedish standards. Although Alexanderplats seems very close by, the best place to take the subway is Häckeche Markt (it is closer and the route is more pleasant). That area is also full with bars and nice shops.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: juliewoodie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location, about a 5- 10 min walk from Alexanderplatz Station where you can get to Schonefield Airport by train .The room was small but very clean and well decorated.. We were on the first floor facing the covered arcade and our friends were facing the conference centre . One small niggle is that there are no stairs for everyday use so we had to wait for lifts, which was a few minutes in the morning . The only other negative comment is that the toiletries were basic , I would have expected more luxurious ones for a five star hotel . If you can try and get to the Comedy Club Kookaburra, Schönhauser Allee 184. Its a ten minute walk from the hotel . They have some great acts on in both English & German. We saw "Fish & Whips" a saucy cabaret act by a young English performer - highly recommended !! (check out their web site)"

Reviews.Title: “Over priced Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: poopy72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Raddisson Blu for two nights you may think i am being mean but the room was cold and small, asked reception to make sure heating was working and they just said yes(thanks for sharing).2nd night was slightly warmer and so put up with it ,Breakfast was almost fifty pounds a day, for which you could go out to dinner and a bottle of wine ten yards away! .The location was good which is why we went for this hotel and room was clean, Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A genuine five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottieLancashireUK
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here to celebrate a significant birthday, never having visited Berlin before and booked business class mainly to ensure a view out rather than in. The room was clean, modern and well appointed, the bed comfortable and the bathroom perfectly adequate. The breakfast, included in the business class rate was a very pleasant surprise for a European hotel (we normally prefer to take breakfast in nearby cafes) with a choice of just about anything you might want, from extremely healthy to extremely filling. The situation, in the same block as the DDR museum and across the bridge from the Museuminsel is ideal, within walking distance of just about everything in the traditional city centre or close to easy transport to anything that isn't walkable. There is an eclectic choice of restaurants within a ten minute walk or the Heat restaurant in the hotel is also worth eating in. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, interesting multi-storey fishtank in central lobby!”
Reviews.Author: BepeAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel suited our needs as it is very well located, next to the River Spree, close to all the action in Mitte and very comfortable. The buffet breakfasts were excellent and we could walk to most places we wanted to visit including the Bundestag, Holocaust Memorial, Old Jewish quarter, Checkpoint Charlie and great shopping areas. The hotel lobby has an incredible fish tank in the middle where one can go inside and go up and down in an elevator. It is a major tourist attraction but does have to be paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, with super aquarium”
Reviews.Author: HanaPrague
Reviews.Content: Design hotel, right at the Alexander Platz, there are many restaurants and shops. Although the rooms are small but elegantly furnished, bathroom is also small, but comfortable furnishings. Breakfast is served at the lobby bar, were okay, but I would welcome a wider choice of hot food. In the lobby bar is a huge aquarium, really interesting and beautiful .. I can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Buddhakkan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Radission Blu for 5 nights during my stay in Berlin. The hotel is in an amazing location in East Berlin. You can almost walk to most places- the berlin dom, museums, Brandenburg Gate, Alexanderplatz, TV tower. The hotel is on a busy road with nice shops dotting the way, amazing eateries in the neighbourhood and the super market Galleria Kohuf at a less than 5 mins walk. Even the happening night clubs are a few blocks away. The rooms are not very large but well appointed, but make sure you get a room near the elevator or you may have to walk quite a bit to your room. The hotel has a 4 torey aquarium and the rooms are built around it and the elevators are only on one side of the circle. The breakfast was adequate but nothing new on offer. The food in the hotel was good. This hotel is mainly booked for conferences so be prepared to always have a crowed lobby and even more crowded lobby bar with people holding their meetings all around the place. For most part of my stay I was in my office conference hence did not mind but if I was traveling on holiday it may have bugged me. Due to this reason the rooms facing the aquarium is also very crowded. If the hotel is lacking in anything it is the service quality. Though most are polite they are indifferent. The concierge did not know the way to seemingly one of the most happening night club in town which we later found out was just 2 blocks But I must mention the staff in the night shift is downright rude, the internet in my room was not working, he had the audacity to tell me I should then just come to the lobby and access it and not trouble him. He only came to his senses and did something when I pointed out that I am apying for a room with internet. So to the main question: will I stay again? May if I get a very good rate else I will just try another hotel- there are so many nice ones in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “excelent location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: memantillam
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in an excelent location. Service very good and great breakfast. In general, high standard hotel. The only but, the room was a little tight, a few square meters were missing, but it was confortable anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: Echs
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blu is in the best location in town! You can walk to all major museums and easily take the bus to other sites. The hotel staff was pleasant and always ready to help. Our rate included breakfast buffet which we really enjoyed since it was a true breakfast with an omelet bar and everything. We also really enjoyed the views of the aquarium which were spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel, love the huge aquarium in the looby”
Reviews.Author: Tjongo
Reviews.Content: Third time in this hotel, for a two nights' stay for a yearly conference. Only cloud was that I was given a twin bed room, although I hade reservation for a queen bed. I called down to the reception and explained what I wanted, but the first guy I talked to never called back. I called down again after a while and the girl I then talked to sorted it our directly. The bellboy came up with a key to another room. I never had breakfast in the hotel, but the lunch for conference delegates was delicious. There is a spa/gym, not the best, but ok. But beware, the saunas are unisex and you are not supposed to wear swim suits. I appreciate if guests put on a towel in unisex saunas, but maybe that's my hangup. Otherwise I really like the hotel, the rooms are very comfortable and the free wifi worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “The best location ever!”
Reviews.Author: dbasha
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We booked the weekend package for a business room, which came with an amazing breakfast. But the highlight was the room - spacious, well designed and with the most incredible view of the Berlin Dome (literally directly across from us) and the Spree from the balcony. Although the vast majority of guests were business travellers, the hotel ias superbly located for any tourist, close to all the main sights of East Berlin, numerous restaurants and bars, and public transportation. Service levels were consistently high. And of course, there was the unique Aquarium in the lobby, also visible each time we took the lift to our room. I will not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and accessible location along with amazing Tandoor food”
Reviews.Author: Angee_Nish
Reviews.Content: Time: September beginning, 2010 I am a frequest traveller to Germany for business purposes and I am always trying new hotels. I had booked this hotel after staying in many hotels but the experience here was one of the best. This hotel was exceptional in terms of its ambiance. The most beautiful part was the big fish aquarium in the center of the guest area. I just could not stop looking at that. I also appreciated it being very well maintained. The staff was very helpful and nice to talk to. They responded to all the queries even late during the day very congenially. Being an Indian, the thing I appreciated the most was the absolutely tasty food and the options offered by the chef at the hotel. They made a special Indian dish for me and it tasted like home. All in all, I will recommend this hotel to all my friends going to Berlin. I will love to be there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rask46
Reviews.Content: Went for the weekend, and it was excellent. We had a good deal on a businessclass room, with fantastic view to the Berliner Dom and the river, and breakfast included. The room, the service and the location was really good, and you could park the car in the basement. Even the restaurant was quite good, with great staff. If I come back to Berlin I will for sure stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: funsunloverEngland
Reviews.Content: Came for berlin marathon; stayed 2 nights and had a great stay. Rooms: Rooms were nice wih v.comfortable bed. Had an internal room and experienced a little noise at night from bar area below, but only very slight and silent by 1100. Good standard bathroom but could of done with some comp conditioner. They also ran out of plug adaptors. Wifi available in rooms. Great view of the aquriam my kind would of loved it. Restaurant: Very over priced, but don't fear good selection of restaurants in a plaza right next door and lots of coffee shops around to grab breakfast. Had breakfast one morning but poor selection for the price. Location: Excellent location within walking distance of tube and local sights. Spa: Great spa, the pool was 'fresh' and was not to keen on the rule re no clothing in sauna and steam room, but did not seem to enforce it.

Reviews.Title: “I don't know what to think!”
Reviews.Author: AliceAustralia
