Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in an excellent location. The room was on the small side but that did not matter as we were hardly ever in it. Most staff were friendly but the Concierge was indifferent and that was a shame because I needed to speak to him the most. The restaurant was great. Imagine my surprise when we got the bill and found out that we had paid 8.50 Euros for a bottle of water. It was extortion!!!! I'm not sure if I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, unique decor with 6 story aquarium in lobby”
Reviews.Author: daffofils
Reviews.Content: Besides a great location with great views onto aquarium lobby or river, the rooms are very nice, but it is the service that sets this place apart from any of the other hotels we have stayed at in Berlin. The service is very warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent location! The...”
Reviews.Author: melissa7378
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with excellent location! The breakfast buffet is terrific. Service is wonderful. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fernandagiro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, with a good location. The rooms are clean and nice. The concierge must be more "Happy "

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gosforth_Ultra
Reviews.Content: Pretty much what everyone else has said really - a very good hotel in an excellent location! The main plus points (other than the location of course) were the spa, which was lovely and nice and relaxing, the breakfast which was superb and enjoyed in the restaurant with a lovely view of the Cathedral/Spree and the staff who were efficient and helpful. The rooms are roomy, if a little identikit corporate and the view we had was basically an indoor shopping centre! That's nit picking a bit though because for around 100 Euros a night, it was an absolute bargain. Well reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, scenographic hotel near Alexander Platz”
Reviews.Author: apvac
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel, with large scenographic lobby: cilindrical Sealife tank in the centre of the lobby, with Sealife visitors that take an elevator at the centre of the tank (this path is separated from the hotel). Glass lifts with view on the lobby and fish tank. The room with large double bed is large enough, modern in style, with all usual amenities, including automatic minibar and electronic laptop-size safe. The TV is a 22" Philips LCD with international channels, pay TV. Internet is free. The bed (large double with unique mattress) is very comfortable, with Simmons mattress. The bathroom has tub with shower. The WC is in a separate space, that can be closed with the same bathroom door. This door is very peculiar since it can rotate 180 degrees with three "positions": closed door between room and bathroom (WC room open), closed door between WC and the rest of the bathroom (no door between bathroom and bedroom), open in the WC room (all spaces open). There is a small make up mirror; the hair dryer is in the room (unusual for "continental" (non UK) hotels), but the non-WC bathroom appears small (most space taken by tub), with really no spare space (the WC room is somewhat larger). Room service has been good, with a sufficiently varied but not extensive menu. Breakfast in the lobby bar was sufficiently varied but there were no packaged yoghurts, choice of fruit and pastries somewhat limited. Breakfast in the Heat restaurant (view over Berliner Dom) had a more extensive buffet, especially for hot food. My room was very quiet, with view on the walkway with restaurants and shops between the two buildings of the dom aquaree complex (one of which is the hotel). If you arrive by car, there is underground parking, with direct access to the hotel lobby (and rooms, with a key) via lift from the U3 level. The location, near Alexander Platz and Unter der Linden is excellent for walking around in the Eastern monumental part of Berlin; in a few minutes on foot you can reach the Brandeburg gate and (longer walk) Potsdamer platz with Sony center, the Arkaden shopping center, theatres etc.

Reviews.Title: “super location, very good service”
Reviews.Author: sarpl
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is excellent. You can walk to most attractions: museum island, old city, Linden st., Hackeshe Market. As for public transportation - nearby bus 100 & 200, several Tram's, S-bun at Hackeshe market. I recommend you to buy the Berlin Welcome Card - for free ride on all public transportation, and also discount at several attractions. ask. (note that there are cards for AB zones and ABC zones. plan your trip). Near the hotel several restaurants. The breakfast buffet in the hotel is very rich. I gave the rooms 4/5 since there was very litle privet storage. Most shelves and both hanging were without doors. The bed was very comfortable, but there wasn't a DBL bed. Our's was a twin (2 single) that moved easy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and great service”
Reviews.Author: S2288
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Berlin in early August for a friend's birthday party. When just staying for two nights over the weekend we know we're not going to be spending a lot of time in the room - but that being said, we still want to feel comfortable! It needs to be clean, have a good location and friendly staff. We received all of this at the Radisson Blu - and more! The tank in the lobby is amazing - very impressive. All of the furnishings in the room appear new and have a modern feel. Everything felt clean and relaxing. We had a drink in the lobby bar which was nice & we found the service at the front desk to be warm and friendly. My only negative comment is that since we had a room facing the acquarium, we didn't feel like we had a lot of privacy. Keep in mind that this is a tourist attraction for kids (they sell tickets for tourists to visit the aquarium face-to-face) - so when we got back to our room in the afternoon we had a whole crowd of strangers staring into our room when we pulled the curtains back. If we come back we'll book a city-view room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location - Attractive Spa area”
Reviews.Author: David-Ela
Reviews.Content: The Location of the hotels makes the Radisson SAS a very convenient place to stay in Berlin for few days. For relaxing, the Spa area offers nice facilities. Very relaxing after an exhausting sighseeing days. As the hotel is sharing the building with the SeaLife aquarium, the Lobby has a huge cylindrical aquarium in the center. You can also have your room with the view on the aquarium, which is quite funny to look at the fish when you're brushing your teeth...

Reviews.Title: “it's worth the price”
Reviews.Author: framarche74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very comfortable and it's definetely worth the price. CONS: -before staying in hotel, ask for a room with a view to the river or the street; the rooms with view to the big hall are rather claustrofobic. -the hotel is very big, with a lot of visitors everyday: finding a table for breakfast can be quite hard sometimes. If it's nice weather, you have to get breakfast outside, beside the river, but again you may queue for a table. -the breakfast is very expensive: it's worth only if you eat a lot and skip the lunch; there are two places where to get breakfast: the one in the hall of hotel has got less food than the one in the restaurant area. There are many cafes close to the hotel. -the swimming pool is very small and the water is rather cold, it's meant to be used only after the sauna, I guess, not just to hang around in the swimming pool. -the all wellness area is fine, but small: the gym is brand new but small, in the afternoon you may find all the tools busy. PROS: -I never liked aquarium, but this one is wonderful, I must admit. -breakfast in restaurant area is very good and rich -sauna, steam bath and gym are very clean. -All the employees are very kind and nice; the hotel is beautiful, clean and verything works perfectly. Wire-less internet is for free and it works very well too. -The hotel is just in the centre of Berlin. -From Tegel Airport, take the bus TXL: it will stop 150 metres from Hotel and it costs € 2,10 per person; a taxi from that airport should not exceed 20 euros

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel!! But make sure your room doesn't overlook the aquarium!”
Reviews.Author: LadyDiana1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, super location, very clean and modern. Staff were very friendly and the breakfast was AMAZING!! Divers Scuba dive into the aquarium to clean it- great to see. Our only issue was that we booked a double room- we were given a twin room and beware rooms that overlook the aquarium! There is an open bar that stays open till the early hours- the noise was so bad that we asked to move rooms. The staff were amazing and couldn’t apologise enough- they moved us to a double room with an amazing view of the city- very peaceful (at no extra charge). Apart of the first night, our stay was excellent. Swimming and gym lovers…….pool and gym very modern but small!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location,”
Reviews.Author: docfamily164
Reviews.Content: Stayed with husband for weekend. lovely hotel, great location. We got a good deal with expedia and upgraded to a business class room which was facing onto the river and had a small balcony. They include breakfast in this deal so it was really worth it as breakfast costs 25 euros normally. We ate it on terrace as weather was good and the selection was wonderful, from breads,pasties, meats,fish,cheese and also cooked choices including made to order omelettes. The hotel is well located and within walking distance of loads restaurants and bars, also walked from Train station at Alexander platz( 5 mins). Boat trips stop outside hotel and can also get on hop on/off tours nearby. very centrally located for everything in the east. Would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: travelingduoNJ
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel. I was there with my husband who was there for work. The hotel is modern style. Our room overlooked the hotel's giant aquarium in the lobby which was awesome! The hotel is located right next to the Berliner Dom Cathedral which is beautiful and it's also a few feet from museum island which is very convenient. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: mjlove
Reviews.Content: Just back from a great weekend in Berlin. This was my wife and I's first visit to the city and really enjoyed it. We picked the hotel based on a friends recommendation, and weren't disappointed. The hotel is located in an area which is very close to the Brandenburg Gate, Check Point Charlie, both about a easy 30 min walk away, and opposite the Cathedral and TV tower. The hotel is very modern, and the rooms reflect this, with white walls, and almost sparten furniture, but they are spotlessly clean (as you'd expect in Germany) and have large well appointed bathrooms. Our room had a mini bar, hair dryer, TV and all the mod cons you'd expect of a 5 star chain hotel. To be honest, its not the kind of 5 star hotel we've stayed in on previous holidays, but for the money, its fantastic. We were offered a room overlooking the aquarium on the atrium or a outside view. We choose the later, and had a room on the top floor with a side view of the river and the cathedral. The room had a very small balcony, but I noticed that rooms on lower floors, 2 - 5 had larger balconys with tables and a chairs. We had dinner in "Heat" which is part of the hotel on the first night, food was good, but expensive when compared to the other meal we had in berlin, including Saturday night dinner at "Bocca di Bacco" the michelin starred restaurant on friedriche Strassa. One top tip is to take a open top tour bus. This is something I never usually do, but on arrival we had a few ours to kill until our hotel room was ready, and it was great. 2 Hour tour from the Brandenburg Gate was only 10 euro each, and it gave us a really opportunity to see a large amount of the city, we'd never have discovered on foot, also it gives you a real perspective on the size of the city. In summing up, good hotel to be based from, great city, friendly people and fantastic food and beer!! Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ldnlad25
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this hotel! Super easy to reach either by taxi (costs about €20) and by bus (you want the TXL bus) from Tigel airport and takes no longer than 30 minutes by either. Arrived at the hotel and they upgraded us from a Business Class room to a Suite due to the fact it was my birthday! It was a fantastic suprise! My parter had ordered a birthday cake which was delivered to the room as soon as we arrived (and was gone within a matter of minutes! :) ). The room was great! Two walls of floor to celing windows with amazing views of the TV tower and the square opposite. Breakfast was included and consisted of everything you could want. Noone would leave hungry! We ate dinner in the restaurant one night. Food was of a very good standard and I was suprised how reasonable the prices were (that goes for the whole of Berlin!). The hotel is in a great location, right by so many of Berlins great attractions including Museum Island, TV Tower and the Cathedral; with fantastic shops and restaurants literally a few steps away. One tip, there is a Thai Restaurant on the right hand side of the hotel (under the glass covered side street). The food is fantastic and very reasonable! The main drawing point for most will be the large aquarium! it's spectacular and we spent one night drinking in the bar area watching it for hours. You hardly notice you've made your way through 3 cocktails :). I loved Berlin! This hotel just put the icing on the cake! I have no doubt in my mind that when we go back we will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Radisson blue Berlin is a good hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: tigerpotato
Reviews.Content: Radisson blue Berlin is a great deal, if you get the room for a reduced rate - like I did with Expedia.com. Normally the economy class room with queen sized bed and the breakfast buffet is $275 dollars a night. I got the same room and breakfast buffet for $135. The big fish tank is cool, but not enough in itself to stay at the hotel. The real advantage is that the hotel is a three minute walk to the Alexanderplatz. Out the front door and 100 meters to the left are the 100 Bus which takes you directly to the Reichstag and the Brandenburg Gate, and the TXL bus, which gets you directly to the Berlin Tegel Airport in 35 mintues. The hotel is modern and clean. The staff are very professional and helpful. The breakfast buffet is awesome - especially if you like to chow down. They have seven types or rolls and bread, seven types of honey and jelly, seven types of meat, fish and sausages, Seven types of cheeses. Many types of fresh fruit, yoghurt, cereal, fresh cooked omelettes, etc. As an American, I would give the breakfast buffet a 93. It loses two points because they don't have blueberry pancakes or waffles. Hey, when in Rome....! But if you leave breakfast hungry, it's definately your own fault! Enjoy Berlin! One last secret tip, for dinner, go out the front door, turn right, and then right again. Walk along the Spree river til you come to a raised train bridge. There are several cozy alternative restaurants to your left, but if you walk a little farther to your right, you will find a very romantic courtyard - free from cars, filled with all kinds of pubs and tastey restaurants. Guten Appetit!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TeamMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. Located on the River Spree, the Radisson is a great choice for people who like a sleek, modern hotel with all the nice in-room amenities (e.g., coffee maker, iron/ironing board). Opt for a business class room and ask for a room that overlooks the River and the Berliner Dome (see photos). An interior room with a view of the wonderful atrium & aquarium is also a good choice. You do not want a room that faces the adjacent walkway with its various restaurants and shops. The business class room includes the hotel's fabulous breakfast with its omlette station, fresh fruits, cheeses, fresh breads & pasteries and some amazing smoked salmon. We loved having breakfast at one of the outside tables that overlooks the river. One downside is a weak concierge service; mostly we relied on the front desk staff for directions, recommendations and other advice. The hotel's location puts you within an easy walk of some major museums, the new synagogue and a healthy but doable walk to the Branderburg Gate and other sights in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money in the center of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: AustrianVisitor
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blu offers good quality rooms and service at reasonable price. The location close to the museum island in the eastern part of Berlin is a good start for your shopping or sightseeing trips. The staff are friendly and the rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spectacular lobby feature”
Reviews.Author: gallaron
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blu is in a great location for a sightseeing trip to Berlin, close to Unter der Linden and the museum island. The lobby had a really spectacular feature of a massive fish tank that belongs to the aquarium next door. We had a very pleasant stay here. The bar is very open and isn't really separate to the lobby but the evening we visited it, it had a really good atmosphere and service was very friendly. We didn't eat in the restaurant, instead we would recommend the alley/courtyard next door. We had a great meal in the Vietnamese restaurant which was great value and also very nice pizza in the Italian on the other side of the courtyard. The room was compact and quite similar in design to other Radissons we have stayed in, it had a nice feature of a little balcony overlooking the courtyard and we sat out one late afternoon reading our books. The room rate was without breakfast and wasn't cheap but would recommend the hotel for its location

Reviews.Title: “Great location, VERY quiet rooms, excellent reservation staff & Concierge”
Reviews.Author: pumpcaptain
Reviews.Content: The only reason I gave the service a 4 is because of the housekeeping. Housekeeping opens your door to see if anyone is in the room. They will start at 0730 and continue every 30 min. until you leave. The problem is the door is SO thick (for soundproofing) that it is very hard to hear someone knock. Otherwise, everything else was excellent. The rooms are a nice size with all the amenities. We had 2 rooms on the 5th floor (Executive Level) with a balcony overlooking the Spree (one for my wife and I, and one for the boys). The breakfast is quite extensive with anything you want except waffles and bagels.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: mattkorey
Reviews.Content: The lobby is just like none other with the crazy, mega-aquarium. I just love it. Everything is top notch always. Be sure and get a room that faces the aquarium as it is fun to wake up to and watch the scuba divers clean the tank. This hotel also has the best (and probably most expensive too) breakfasts I've ever had at a hotel anywhere in the world. Sitting in the restaurant with the windows looking onto the Berliner Dom is another fantastic way to start the day in this, my favorite city.

Reviews.Title: “Least helpful concierge on the planet”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaParis
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. The aquarium around the elevator is spectacular and it is clean. For a five star hotel - and the prices we expect more. The concierge couldn't sell me a stamp and couldn't give us directions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and loved Berlin”
Reviews.Author: karljhamilton
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my partner and a friend in the hotel for 3 nights and it was a great experience. The hotel is located between Alexanderplatz (S-Bahn, U-Bahn and Airport Express to SXF) and Museumsinsel on the bank of the Spree and beside numerous trams and buses. Worth noting that a variety of bus and boat tours leave from beside the hotel, which is very handy for tourists. The hotel itself was very impressive. The aquarium in the lobby made for a very novel view every morning. My room was nicely designed and looked out over the Dom and the river. It was comfortable and modern and the service was great. The spa facilities are relaxing and the staff mostly friendly. Definately recommend this hotel and would return here again. Plenty of choices for food and drink in the evening nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Enjoyed Radisson Blu Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Rather-B-travelling
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. My wife and I travelled around Europe staying in many places and we both thought this was one of the best. The huge aquarium was unique and added to the great experience. We opted for the aquarium view room which we thought was great. The breakfast was delicious and the staff worked very hard to make everything perfect. For a drink you can't go past the great bar, an excellent selection of beers and cocktails. The room was very clean, comfortable and reasonably sized. As far as location it is excellent for sightseeing and generally walking around most parts of Berlin, even better the bus stop to/from the airport is practically right outside. This is a great place and well worth booking. Berlin in general is fabulous. Great sights and full of history. Our best tip is to go on a Berlin walking tour. The guide we had was fantasic, the more you learned about Berlin the more you appreciated and enjoyed this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Very average for a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ray Goldberg
Reviews.Content: The Lobby is sensational but thats where it stops. The rooms are tiny for a 5 star hotel as are the bathrooms. Want a shirt ironed? My direction was to go to the ironing room on the lower level and do it. The one saving grace is the bar Chief, Dian. Now theres a guy who knows his drinks, loves his job and is exceptionally good at it. Even if you don't stay here ( and I will not again) go to the bar for a drink. This hotel is simply not good enough to warrant 5 stars

Reviews.Title: “never a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: bird67
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel for a long weekend in may. On entering the hotel i was impressed by the fish tank, nothing else about this hotel is impressive. The location is good for sightseeing, the rooms are clean and the bed is very comfy,breakfast is also nice but 5 star no. I have stayed in better 3 star. No tea or coffee making facilitise in your room which is something i realy missed. One night when i came back from being out i phoned down to try and get a coffee i was told it would take about 1 hour as all the coffee machines were off. this is not 5 star 24 hour room service to me. To sum it up i would say this is a very over priced 3 star hotel. Oh sorry forgot to say they do have a very nice leisure pool and sauna, steam room out of order.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - location, service and facilities all top notch”
Reviews.Author: BerkshireRich
Reviews.Content: Pretty much everything about this place is spot on. Some highlights being... The room - newly decorated, large, spotlessly clean and had a decent coffee machine too. The hotel has free internet too - something I think should be free at every hotel! The leisure facilities were great - pool was small, but the fitness room was well equipped. Decent sauna too. The breakfast - a buffet breakfast hat seemed to have everything you could possibly imagine. Staff - everyone we met at the hotel went out of their way to be helpful and friendly. The location alone makes this hotel an excellent choice for a break in Berlin, but everything else about the hotel makes it an excellent stay - I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: francoisel
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Good location. Amazing atrium with a gigantic aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but no personal chain service!”
Reviews.Author: Tomas N
Reviews.Content: Definitely nice hotel with well designed clean rooms and amenities, however very average service with no personality, no smiles, no hospitality, no warm welcome, no friendliness from any staff member, which is what you normally get in bigger size chain hotel. It seemed as they were too busy to care for the guest, which is sad as the product was definitely there!

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: Radler09
Reviews.Content: I've been to a couple of Radisson Hotel, this is definitively the best I've ever been too. I'll not write much, just sum up: Great location Great, great, great service great rooms beautiful aquarium pricey, but it's worth it. Eat elsewhere. The best thing is: If you like me book cheap rooms over the internet, normally you get a room with a view inwards. But as this hotel has THE greatest aquarium, it's even better than the rooms heading outwards. I would definitively go there again if I get an acceptable price!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel, Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: sian_eddy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights in January and could find no fault with the hotel. The reception/ lobby area with aquarium is hugely impressive and the rooms are of a high standard. We opted for a city view room, which had a small balcony with a fabulous view towards the TV tower. Customer service was excellent as you’d expect – we forgot to take a travel adaptor and within minutes of contacting reception had 2 brought to the room. I can’t comment on the food served at the hotel as we ate out every meal, but can highly recommend the lobby bar for their fantastic selection of cocktails!! The location of the hotel is second to none for seeing the sights of this lovely city, with many top attractions within walking distance and for those slightly further out you can jump on the underground at Alexanderplatz station less than 10 minutes walk from the hotel. Berlin is a fantastic destination for a city break and more reasonably priced than comparable cities in other European countries. Plenty of sights, friendly people and an abundance of top notch restaurants, bars and clubs. Top class hotel in a top class city.

Reviews.Title: “2 for the price of 1.... A GREAT HOTEL and AN AQUARIUM!”
Reviews.Author: ibarbara
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blu is a fantastic hotel with a fascinating attraction... the aqaurium! I give it a straight 5 stars in all categories! Our room was very modern and very spacious with lots of cubbies for our stuff as well as very clean and comfortable. We had an excellent view of the aquarium. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Room service was exceptional. Location was ideal... within walking distance to most tourist sites particularly museumsinsel (Museum Island) right next door as well as the boat rides. It was very romantic being by the river. We thoroughly loved the hotel and will definitely stay there again when we revisit Berlin which we loved. I couldn't give it a more glowing review! P.S. Security was excellent too.... you had to enter your room card into the elevator to gain access to your floor!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ruby1971
Reviews.Content: Generous sized rooms. Nice reception area. Breakfast was just ok. Heat restaurant was expensive. The location of the hotel is great for seeing the sights of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: commanderbyrne
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Radisson for 3 nights in February, and we couldn't really fault anything with it. The rooms were standard size for a European hotel and were finished well. The aquarium in the lobby is amazing, worth a look even if you're not staying in the hotel. We left some souvenirs in the lobby and only realised in the airport. I called reception and they organised the delivery of them back to Ireland. Had them 2 days later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mimic67
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my parents and sister over Easter, we needed a hotel that was centrally located and of a good standard, the Radisson lived up to these requirements and more! It is a really lovely hotel, all staff were really friendly, apart from reception, the rooms were spacious and clean and the breakfast buffet was to die for!! We had an Aquarium view room as requested (my folks had a street view and were happy with theirs too!) and it added a real novelty value to our stay, all sights were within easy walking distance and we only need to take the public bus twice on our long weekend! Well worth a visit if you're in Berlin, we booked last October on the Radisson website and got quite a good rate too!

Reviews.Title: “Jaw-dropping interior feature”
Reviews.Author: benw123
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Radisson Blu in Berlin for a conference, and as always, did a bit of research online ahead of my trip so I know what to expect. To my amazement, the pictures on their website showed a massive indoor aquarium, which is housed within a hollow, open part of the hotel with the rooms on all four sides. You really have to see this tank to appreciate it; after a time at the hotel, it's great just watching other patrons walking in and their surprise at seeing it for the first time. 12 metres wide and 25 metres high, it totally dominates the character of the hotel. It is actually a large tube with a hollow middle to allow a lift to travel inside it, which allows visitors in a tourist section to see the fish up close. To cut to the chase, everything about this hotel was first rate. The rooms were cosy but very contemporary and beautifully presented. My colleague and I were offered rooms facing inside the hotel as we were so awed by the aquarium. Food at the HeAT restaurant was also top quality, and you couldn't wish for more choice at breakfast. For a hotel with so many rooms, there was still plenty of space in the restaurant. As a bonus, it works well for tourists too - at the end of the conference, we were dropped off at the Brandenburg Gate and it's a 15 minute gentle walk east to the hotel - perfect. Finally, in the evening, the bar, which stretches around the base of the concrete columns supporting the tank, is the perfect place to watch the fish swim in darkness. A great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern”
Reviews.Author: Conluceo
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights in this hotel. When we arrived we were greeted by the friendly doorman who ushered us to reception. As soon as you walk into the lobby you notice the giant aquarium towering above, which is a tourist attraction in its own right. This is a really nice hotel, with excellent decor all round – very comfortable. Room: Our room was modern and minimalist with a flat screen TV, mini-bar, comfortable bed and small balcony. The room overlooked the aquarium and bar area. Despite this there were no problems with noise drifting up from down below. I agree with another reviewer who said that the room sometimes had the slight odour of poor drainage. In addition there was no ironing board and iron – which was inconvenient. Location: The hotel is in a great location, adjacent to Museum Island and less than 10 mins walk from Alexanderplatz (train station), Hackescher Markt (where you’ll find bars and restaurants) and Nikolaiviertel (the historical centre of the city). Food: We stayed on a room-only basis and never stretched to the rather exorbitant €25 per head breakfast. This was not a problem as there are plenty of coffee shops and cafes in the surrounding area. We recommend a visit to Alex Café, below the TV Tower, where you can enjoy a buffet breakfast for €7. We ate in the hotel’s restaurant “HEat”, which is described as “modern international”. The tapas starter for two was excellent and included; Thai coconut soup, scallops and the ubiquitous currywurst. The mains were good but my choice didn’t quite meet expectations. However the dessert was excellent with probably the best crème brulee I’ve tasted. Add to this, nice wine, great beer (especially weissbier) and you have a good package. We also visited Reinhardt’s (10 mins walk from the hotel) and enjoyed good food in old-fashioned wood panelled surroundings. Bar: The hotel bar is something of a thoroughfare and not very cozy. There was a decent selection of bar snacks/teas/coffees – all served by attentive staff. The range of beers on offer was somewhat limited but what they had was good. Splash Leisure: The leisure facilities included; gym, treatment rooms, sauna, steam room, pool and great showers. The pool is best described as a “plunge pool” and is barely enough for one swimmer. As with the rest of the hotel the staff were friendly and helpful. Conclusion: This is a good hotel in a great location. The issues with the room lose a star, otherwise this is a solid recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with impressive facilities, but the hotel thinks it is better than it delivers.”
Reviews.Author: Ru558ll
Reviews.Content: The fish tank in the lobby is impressive. The rooms are comfortable, but a little on the small side. The leisure facilities were nice. Location is very good. Being a Goldpoints Gold member, I thought I might get some recognition of this e.g. a bottle of water in the room might have been nice as a small token, but nothing at all here. The staff at checkin and in the bar areas seemed to do the bare minimum they had to in order to meet service levels. No attempt was made to go above and beyond as is often the case at other Radissons. This came across as a little arrogant i.e. we're the best, we know it and you're going to pay us for it . The cleaning / bellhop staff were very friendly and wanted to help - one area that was good. Onto the room ... There was a slight smell of poor drainage in the room at times. Air conditioning unit was extremely annoying as it neither stayed on or turned off - just constantly changed. I turned it off. There was no trouser press as promised and the iron that was brought up to the room was in a very poor state. No tea / coffee facilities in the room. On the plus side, it was light and airy and had a reasonable work area. The breakfast was very good and the staff in the restaurant very friendly, but not as attentive as you would hope for a €25 (yes, €25) breakfast. I had practically finished before I got a hot drink. All in all, I was a bit disappointed with the hotel. Currently too expensive for the product being delivered. It has the potential to be truely excellent but the attention to detail is just not there. I am willing to try it again if the issues described are dealt with.

Reviews.Title: “Room Only - But What a Room!”
Reviews.Author: SimonPaul
Reviews.Content: Arriving in the rain made the lobby a welcome sight. We were given a room suitable for people with disabilities (neither of us are) on the first floor. We overlooked the Spree and the Berliner Dom and had a really generous amount of space. One of the best hotel rooms I've stayed in. Everyone talks about the fish tank which looked good from the lobby, but the security of the room card meant we couldn't go up in the elevator to look at it higher up. The coffee machines in the room are really good. The breakfast prices were definitely aimed at the business market (exorbitant) so we avoided. There is a very nice Thai restaurant in the arcade (turn left out of the lobby and into the aquarium entrance arcade). Perfect place to explore Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel especially love the lobby”
Reviews.Author: SheilahH
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. It has a huge aquarium in the lobby. The hotel is next door to the museum island and canal..

Reviews.Title: “Recommended: very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: federicobroggi
Reviews.Content: The location is simply perfect for tourism: just in front of Berliner Dom and Museum Island, few hundreds meters from Aleksander Plaz underground station. The hall is impressive with this huge acquarium just in the middle. Rooms are very modern and perfectly clean. We had just some problems with the heater but the staff have been very quick to repair it. The spa area and waterpool are clean and modern but a little small. We did not have breakfast in the hotel because quite expensive. It is full of nice bars (starbucks style) just around the corner. The bar and minibar are really expensive. For sure a very nice hotel to stay both for leisure and business.

Reviews.Title: “Escape to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: CarlosQ4
Reviews.Content: Really a place to go, we enjoyed our stay. It's quite impressive the entrance in the hotel with just a big "swimming pool of 1 million litres water full of different sort of fishes" just in the city center (which it is handy when it is snowing). Staff gave us a couple of good places to go to enjoy the saturday night, "Blue Man Group".

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: enelym1978
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean, modern and comfortable hotel, and well situated. A bit pricey though if you pay the full price. Very nice breakfast buffet, which for us, was included in the price so we did enjoy it and could skip lunch that day.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LittleAppleRoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in February with my best friend for a short city-break. As we are both travel agents, we got a fantastic deal on the rate, which swung it for us - as I do think the hotel's rack rates can be very expensive, but this is due to the hotel rating. Flew into Tegel (TXL), and caught the TXL bus to the stop before Alexanderplatz. This is located just across the street from the hotel, and a single-use ticket from the airport to the hotel costs just EUR2.10. The bus takes about 35 minutes, so is the best bet for a cheap transfer. The hotel itself is beautifully done, nice little touches like crudites with your cocktail in the bar, and a hairdryer in the room that can be plugged into various sockets instead of being wired into a drawer. The lobby and indeed the hotel is dominated by the Aquadom, however I won't talk about this as nearly all reviews of this hotel talk about it. The Sealife Centre is not especially big, but is a nice place to visit should you have a couple of hours spare. And obviously, you get to go up the Aquadom as part of your visit, which is quite interesting. We didn't eat (the expensive) breakfast in the hotel, but opted to go to the American Diner which is joined onto the right side of the hotel one morning, near the Aquadom entrance. This is a lot cheaper and you get really big servings. Had a massage in the health spa in the basement area of the hotel - this was a lovely way to relax after walking round the tourist sights of Berlin, and at EUR40.00 for a 30 minute back, shoulder and neck massage I feel this is a very fair price. Especially for a hotel spa, which tend to be more pricey. The sauna and pool facilities were very well kept and quiet, with the pool offering a current-resistor for those wanting some gentle exercise whilst relaxing. The staff are all very welcoming and knowledgable, and you can purchase U-Bahn/S-Bahn and bus tickets from the Concierge Desk. They will gladly help you organise the best way to travel round Berlin, and helped me and my friend plan the best route round the main attractions. With their help, we managed to see the Brandenburg, Checkpoint Charlie, the Reichstag and the Fernsehturm (which is actually just up the road), all in an afternoon with minimum travelling! The rooms are decorated in a fresh, modern way, with bright clean bathrooms and flat-screen TVs. Albeit the only English-speaking channels are Bloomberg and BBC World News, but you don't go on a trip to watch TV all day, do you? The door on our bathroom was a two-way door, which can either shut off the whole bathroom or shut off the toilet part only. Which is useful if you both need to "use" the bathroom. Also, the mirrors in our toilet part were positioned so you could see the whole of your head - not really a major point, but thought I would mention it to all us girls who like to be able to see what hair we are straightening! If you do fancy a nice breakfast, I recommend going to the Fernsehturm (TV Tower) early in the morning, and paying the EUR10.50 to go up it and the additional EUR10-20 for breakfast in the revolving restaurant. It is pretty much the same cost as eating at the hotel, but is a fantastic experience and it was lovely to watch the morning unfurl over Berlin as we ate our scrambled eggs and smoked salmon. When I do go back to Berlin, I would definitely stay at the Radisson Blu.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, stylish hotel in excellent location - and with amazing aquarium!”
Reviews.Author: SHabroad
Reviews.Content: This is really a very nice hotel; good-sized rooms, comfortable bed (despite the German way of providing two single mattresses not one double), light and clean bathroom - oh and that amazing view from your room of the massive aquarium (Aqua Dom). So big that even with four divers in it, they can still disappear out of view! The Radisson is in a great location too - only 10 minutes walk to Alexanderplatz, and right on the corner of Museum Island, so there are plenty of things to do and good shops nearby. In fact the only problem we found with the location was that, on arrival from the airport we took the train to Alexanderplatz and even though it's relatively near we couldn't possibly drag our suitcases thru all the snow, so we got a taxi - and my god did the driver curse and moan all the way to the hotel, such a rude old man! We had so many activities to do in Berlin we didn't get round to eating in the hotel or using the wellness centre - but they both looked good, though it has to be said that the pool is very small. We'd definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Cédric V
Reviews.Content: The rooms, the location, the staff, the food: all perfect!

Reviews.Title: “simply the best for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: momfirstLaois
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for business and pleasure and it is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. It is in a great location straight across the road from the Alexanderplatz. The rooms are spotless, the beds very comfortable and the facilities are first class. But what really makes the stay here an enjoyable one is the staff. they are efficient, friendly and nothing is too much trouble. The only drawback? Breakfast is way too expensive, maybe different options for continental and cooked should be offered. However, there is no shortage of places nearby to get a cheaper breakfast, so I would definitely recommend this hotel for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 26d
Reviews.Content: There are a number of reasons why I would recommend the Radisson Blu in Berlin. First of all, the location was second to none, being in the heart of Mitte with very easy access to all the main sights. Secondly, there's a nice pool/sauna/steam room which was very nice to relax in after a hard day of sightseeing! Thirdly, the rooms are lovely, being very modern and having free wi-fi. Fourthly, there's a really cool aquarium in the middle of the lobby which was quite unique. And finally, the price was great - I paid a lot less for this hotel than an equivalent hotel in any other main European or American city so I feel I really got value for money. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent locatoin”
Reviews.Author: Laimdota
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel to have a lovely pre-Christmas shopping weekend with my teenage niece and to show a little history. The Radisson Blu has a fantastic location in Berlin "Mitte", though for me a little far from the Metro. We were very lucky to have room facing the Canal: highly advisable! It is the perfect hotel for Museums Insel, the opera, etc. Not so easily accessible by public transportation for Postdamer Platz, or shopping around the Ku'damm. There are a few touristy shops around the corner, Hackescher Markt not too far away, but for a livelier Berlin I would choose a different location. The hop-on/hop-off buses stop at the hotel; and there is a reasonable canal tour to hop on right at the hotel, though a little expensive. The location and surroundings must be absolultely splendid when it's warm and you want to sit outside as there are cafes everywhere. The hotel seems to be an excellently refurbished Soviet time building: modern, Radisson-esque, functional and service friendly. It's stunning feature is the aquarium in the middle of the lobby. It seemed to be full of families, small children because of it. The bathroom was a little small, but the technical amenities in the room very up-to-date: iPod receiver, Nespresso, etc. beautifully and practically integrated. The bed is very comfortable, though the lighting is lousy for reading in bed. The small terrace for 2 was exquisite - and must be great in the summer. Breakfast is quite abundant, but expensive. If you're not massively hungry, any cafe or bakery in the area is cheaper, faster, and fine. Room service was OK in quality, but a little overcharged. There is a small swimming pool/spa that we used, but I had imagined it to be larger. Very friendly staff there. A tremendous stay!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: swisslady
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Radisson Blu Berlin. We had 2 great rooms, overlooking the Dom, which even had Nespresso machines. Food delicious. Had breakfast and dinner in HEAT and snacks in the lobby bar. If you're travelling to Berlin, this is the place to stay. It has it all, including location. Top Notch!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: RobbeusBologna_Italy
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my wife and we chose the option room + buffet breakfast for a very fair amount. We did not book directly through the hotel site, but via a travel agent who applied a small discount. Probably this has been the reason why we were assigned a smaller room than the standard ones. However, apart from some few square meters less, the room was almost the same (we had the chance to compare it with another couple's room). Room - cozy and well equipped. The only two things which are missing (if you are use to them) are a 'visible' clock and a coffeepot. All the rest is fine and nicely arranged: flat TV set, frigobar, hairdryer, etc. The bathroom is roomy, featuring both the tub and the shower and a very modern washbasin. A small suite of bath products are daily provided. For a modest extra charge, you can have a "Business" room, which is featuring also some 'add-ons' like slippers, bathrobe, newspapers, etc. Hall - the Radisson Blu is a magnificent building, with a very luxury hall in the middle of which stands a fantastic acquarium which is enjoyable almost for free for the hotel guests. The atmosphere is persuasive and quiet. You can sit on a sofa, have a drink and relax with you travel mates watching the tropical fishes going back and forth and in the blu water behind the glass. Breakfast - sumptuous. No other words can better describe it. Wellness center - most of the facilities, such as swimming pool, exercise room and sauna are for free while for some other services like the solarium or the massage you need to face a quite expensive 'menu'. Location - right beside the Berlin cathedral and few steps away from the museums area, this hotel proved to be very conveniently located for all the itineraries we had in our mind. Within 2-3 minutes walking we could reach: the TV tower, Alexander Platz, the Hackescher mkt area, the S-bahn public transport station; with few more minutes (less then 10) you can reach Friederich Strasse and see the Brandenburg Tor and the Reichstag. Last but not least: a wi-fi connection is available all around the hotel and there is NO charge to surf the web. With no doubts, I would recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for a worth relation between overall value and price.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the few hotels that I am proud to have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Ulrick
Reviews.Content: The facade of the hotel doesn’t really reveal much, however by the time I entered into the lobby I was greeted by a huge cylindrical aquarium with different kinds, sizes and colours of fish. Plus I was lucky the day I checked in because there were two scuba divers cleaning inside the huge aquarium. It was totally an amazing welcome sight. The receptionists were very professional yet warm, accommodating and helpful. The standard check in time is 1500H but I arrived much earlier than that but, the receptionist warmly offered me a room that was ready. Aside from that, they were also very patient waiting for me because I scramble looking for my confirmation number since I lost it through my numerous unsorted files in my iphone and I didn’t have any print out for my reservation. By the time I found my reservation number I was given the standard plastic key which serves as a way to use the elevator and confirmation for entrance to the breakfast in their restaurant. The room that I reserved was a standard, non smoking with 1 queen size bed was pretty decent and clean. It offers a spectacular view outside the main street although; it is also possible to request to have the aquarium or the Berliner Dom as your view. The room also has a safety deposit box, a mini bar, enough storage and closets plus a pressing machine and you can also call their service to give you an ironing board and iron should you need one. The water closet was modern and elegant with shower in a bath tub, a hair dryer and other usual hotel complimentary. There was also a cable TV with enough local and international programs. With regards to the internet connection, the room offers both wireless and wired connection. The connection was very strong although the initial set up for wireless took a bit longer but once I was log in using my room number then everything was good and working properly. For the breakfast buffet, it was located in their restaurant – Heat. I didn’t regretted that I chose the option to include a breakfast on my reservation because the hotel choices of food and morning drinks were excellent. By the time I settled myself to a table, a waiter would happily ask to serve me a coffee and leave the rest of the coffee thermos on my table. The buffet offers a wide array of breakfast food from different kinds of bread, pastries, meat, sausages, cereals, yoghurt, some fruit, marmalade, cheese and there is a waiting chef who would cook your type of egg. As for the drinks, they offer different kinds of freshly squeezed juice, tea, and even different kinds of water. Moreover, the restaurant was decent, filled with energetic staff and the arrangement is well organized. As for their amenities, they have a rather small swimming pool which, as I have tried, can accommodate at least 2 small-sized adults swimming simultaneously. The fitness room was equipped with enough exercise machines. They have enough steam and sauna room which was fantastic. Some foot bathtubs and automatic showers. Their changing rooms had enough lockers and amenities like body shampoo, lotion, a hair dryer and you can also request to the nearest reception for a nail file, ear buds, etc. With regards to their massage service, which I had booked, the feeling of satisfaction after the 30 minutes back massage wasn’t long lasting. The moment I stepped out from the door, I didn’t feel relieved. I think it has something to do with the masseuse who was tired. On the negative side, there are only few that I can mention. One of that was, the climate control ventilation in my room was utterly noisy. It seems like I was sleeping in the engine room of a boat. Aside from that, by the time I checked out, I was wrongly billed from their bar which apparently belongs to someone else as the signature shows. However, the receptionist was very quick to respond and made the necessary correction to my overall bill. Generally, the hotel experience was amazing and highly recommendable not only for couples or business travellers but also for families and to those who want to discover what the City of Berlin can offfer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldclassinspector
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, super central close to Alexander Platz.. Gigantic aquarium in the lobby, nice bar with a great range of whisky. The staff messed up our initial booking, giving us a smoking room the first night, which was rather unpleasant. We changed room the next day, but then our keycards didn't work in the elevator. When adressing this issue, we were offered a free bottle of sparkling :-) The spa is free for hotel guests and we used it daily. Nice steam bath and finish sauna. The pool is nice but rather small. The spa area is unisex, but be aware of men having an urge to walk around naked, although it it rather disrespectful for the female guests. All in all, top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SGG2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blu Radisson with our 3 year old for three nights for a short break in Berlin - it was a lovely experience. When we first arrived before we could shut the taxi door the porter was there to collect our bags and welcome us, the reception is absolutely stunning with the aquarium tank - my little boy was delighted (even had to come down at night to see them after he had his pj's on to see if they were in bed too - their lights go out at night to give them peace). The height of the hotel when you are in reception is amazing - it is really stunning. The staff were so friendly and helpful - I sadly lost my camera on the third day and they did their utmost to help, when we returned on our last day one of the reception staff had even phoned local taxi companies to see if it had been found. We didn't try the restaurant / bar / spar / pool so cannot comment on them. The lifts are glass so a wonderful view as you go up and see the fish. We went business class (got a great deal from Expedia) - the room was of moderate size and was of very modern design. It was spotless. The view from the room was breaktaking of the Berlin Dom (feel's like it is within arms reach it was so close) and had a small balcony with table and two chairs outside, and the river outside with all the christmas lights glistening in the trees. We had a lovely walk along the river (We were lucky enough to have snow as well :0) We also took a boat cruise along the river which was fab (the guy who did the commentary only did it in German though but it might be different in the summer months when busier) - it lasted about an hour and they served hot wine etc on board. The price for this was 9 euro each (not including drinks etc) and free for our son. This was right outside the hotel. There were all sorts of goodies, delicious smelling body lotion, shampoo and bath gel, slippers and fluffy robes in the room (part of business class rate again). We apparently had some sort of ipod access but we didn't use that. The soundproofing was fantastic - you don't hear a single thing outside the hotel room. Lovely little chocolate each by the bed and big bottle of water to welcome you (also more chocolate the day after). A coffee making machine was also in the room which made a lovely cup of coffee and we also had a free newspaper delivered as part of the business class room. The hotel was about a 30 min taxi ride from schonfeld airport which cost around 40 euro. We also took a taxi to the zoo which was about 15 mins away and about 15 euro. This hotel however is apparently very close to the Alexanderplatz station but we chose taxi for ease with little son and buggy etc etc. We also went to the Seaworld which is just around the corner - it was like 47 euros for all three of us and all our son wanted to do was rush through so that wasn't really worth it - but if he had been older I think he would have loved it (I would have too if we could have stayed for more than 3 second in each room :0) - it was really well done. Also as part of the package you could go up the lift in the Blu Raddison Hotel inside the fish tank - we didn't end up doing that. If you do go to Seaworld the way out is when you get to all the mirrors - we couldn't work it out and went back on ourselves!! We went to the zoo the next day and it was only 24 euros nearly half the price. Berlin Zoo is fantastic - if you are young or old, family or just a couple I would recommend it . My favourite bit is the hippos as you can see them under the water when they swim past you - it was brilliant. Also near the Zoo is the kurfurstendam area which is fabulous with the Ka De We shop which is out of this world (especially at Christmas time). The only thing that I found on the downside about the trip was the bed, it was twin beds pushed together and they kept separating in the middle - everything else was just perfect . We had breakfast as part of the business class package and it was exceptional. Also we tended to sit on the far left as you go into the heat restaurant and a certain lady seemed to serve us each day (I guess it was her area) and she was simply fabulous, nothing was too much trouble. My little boy had his own cutlery with him and had finished his yoghurt. Two minutes later she appeared with the spoon all washed and dried on a serviette - I didn't even see her take it - it was a top service. I'd recommend this hotel long or short stay and Berlin was fantastic as always. It was also family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “totally worth it”
Reviews.Author: hippo10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights and it was an outstanding hotel. Wanted to try my German out but didnt get the chance as everyone spoke superb english. The hotel has an amazing aquarium in the lobby that needs to be seen and the views from the rooms were amazing. Try for an outside facing room on the higher floors for a view tof the city to be impressed with. The rooms were clean and comfortable but did have two single beds pushed together instead of a double. That is the only slight down side I can think of. For viewing the city its location is perfect. Oh and the spa is a fantastic way to spend the afternoon and was deserted when we stayed so had it all to our selves.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Dixie35
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem. It is in a great location in the MITTE part of Berlin which is the centre of Berlin. It is easy walking to all the sights of Berlin and as we went for the Christmas markets fantastic location near several. The hotel has the biggest aquadom in the reception and our room looked out onto it which is a great feature. Rooms comfortable and very clean hotel. The hotel is within walking distance of Alexanderplatz which is one of the main stations from Schonfield Airport. Next to the hotel aare some good restaurants one called Emma in the arcade next to the hotel was great value for money and would recommend it. And several coffee shops near for breakfast instead of paying for breakfast in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Nick P
Reviews.Content: First off a complaint... The hotel makes a great deal of the aquarium in the lobby, trouble is to get access to it you have to go around the corner and visit the 'aquarium', all 14 of them apparently, to get into the lift that takes you inside the actual hotel aquarium. The best thing about the hotel is the location, impossible to avoid the many attractions nearby, museum island, DDR Museum, trips on the River Spree, Belinerdom, the TV Tower etc. Also Alexanderplatz and the Brandenberg Gate are just a short walk away. The hotel is 'business comfortable' so no comfy armchairs or carpet in the main foyer/bar/lounge, but good and friendly bar staff. Great breakfast, but we didn't try the restaurant althougth it was recommended. Rooms again are 'business comfortable' and perfectly servicable. The hall porter was extremely helpful with all our silly requests. Nice steam room, sauna & pool. There appears to be a 'rooftop' lounge, but this is only available for meetings and conferences, views are supposed to be great so a shame hoilday punters can't use it. So, not 5 star really but a very good business 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! brilliant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Big_Man_Bristol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend and it was Brilliant! Went with another couple and thanks to a previous review we ended upon the same floor, which was good as your room key only gives you access to your own floor.... and there are no stairs! Within easy walk were three excellent christmas markets, OK so we did not buy much apart from Gluhwien, but the atmosphere was so lovely. Hotel Brill, good Breakfast, lots of assortment, Swiming pool, Spa, Sauna, Styeam room (no cossie!!!) and very friendy staff throughout. Loved every moment! Local Restaurant "12 Apostles" is well worth a visit, five m,inute walk and i promise you willnot finish a pizza or pasta dish!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific weekend in a terrific city”
Reviews.Author: rosemaryfromkent
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Berlin for my birthday and our friends birthday. No trouble getting to the airport via a taxi outside the airport (lots of them!!) We saved a fortune by advise from Trip Advisor as we had booked the hotels taxi at 115e instead of the 40e we paid. Great hotel - great location - wonderful view from our room of the cathedral. Room small but comfortable. Very modern, slippers, gowns and comfortable beds. Great breakfast. Great Spa. Fascinating fish "tank" in the foyer. We went on several tours. Highly recommend the 4 hour walking tour of the Third Reich. Really interesting guide called Jacob who really made the tour and gave us extra time. The small group tour (only us) was also great and took us everywhere. It was 35e each and well worth it. The museums are fascinating and all well worth a visit especially the Technology museum. Be careful state ones are closed on Mondays. We were there just in time for the Christmas markets - wonderful atmosphere with the ice skating and funfair and music. Found finding good restaurants a problem as we had so little time but we had terrific steaks at the Bloc House which is a chain and there are several in Berlin. We found a really good restaurant for our birthdays in Nickolas Plaz near the 2 spired church in the reconstructed oldest part of the city. Wonderful area with winding streets. I thing it was called Gastrosegrube?? or something similar. Food and service great. Very german but not too heavy. (big portions!!) We stayed from Fri to Tue and would have loved to have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “bar staff let it down”
Reviews.Author: 4stack
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 27/11 to 30/11.ideally placed for sightseeing,breakfast buffet was superb,room was very quiet and clean but a bit on the small side,would have liked and expected tea and coffee making facilities. big let down was the service at the lobby bar, very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: sexykitten
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the 17/11 to21/11. Check in was easy and you have to use your room key card to operate the lifts. Room was ok, no tea or coffee making facilities, also no bathrobe or slippers (which I would of thought from a 5*) but the bathroom had under floor heating. Had a double bed with 2 single quilts. Lobby bar very expensive. Unable to comment on the food as we didn't eat in the hotel. The view from our room was of the Berliner Dom, This hotel is great for sightseeing as Alexanderplatz railway and underground stations are about a five minute walk away and the 100/200 bus service stops about 1 minute away and they will take you to West Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “The ideal starting point for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: gvang
Reviews.Content: This is my first review ever and I decided to write it because I liked so much the Hotel. It's ideally situated in Berlin Mitte with access to the nearby Alexander Platz Underground station. If you have a car (like we did), the parking is very practically under the Hotel. Next to the Hotel you will find several souvenir shops, restaurants, coffee shops, bakeries, just everything you need. Furthermore, just around the corner is the DDR Museum, a Museum dedicated to the life in the former East Germany. Overall, the rooms are nice, clean and the staff is very helpful. I would definitely book it again for our next stay in Berlin, which I hope will be soon! George & Ermina, Greece

Reviews.Title: “Amazing -”
Reviews.Author: Missithompson
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. The huge aquarium is an awesome sight. We stayed on 4th floor with view out across lobby. It was stunning and we even had scuba divers inside tank - a crazy sight to see as you look outside your balconies window at 9am. Didn't eat there as it was out of our budget but we had a bargin with the room so very happy with that - can always go and get bratwurst off xmas market. Staff were friendly and hospitable. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ErikFromSweden
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Radisson in Berlin quite a few times now and have never been disappointed! It starts when you come in to the lobby and see the aquarium, huge! And the rooms are in a really nice condition and almost totally sound proof, which is important. I have never heard anyone flush their toilet, taking a shower or anything. And the beds are comfy. The breakfast buffet is really good with a wide variety of hot and cold dishes, freshly squeezed orange juice and great service. During the summer you can sit outside by the canal Spree. The only downside are the prices in the bar in the lobby. Really tasty drinks and good service but way to expensive. But still, after all these superlatives, I wouldn't call it a 5 star hotel. Definitely 4+++, but not 5. Maybe I’ll change my mind when I have stayed in their Business Class room next week and give it a "5". So far, I have only stayed in their standard rooms.

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Liam023
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Blu last weekend. It was my fourth stay at this hotel in the past couple of years. Once again it lived up to expectations. The staff are friendly and helpful and the lobby upon entering from the street is extremely impressive. The rooms are excellent - modern, well furnished any spotlessly clean. This time we had a room with a balcony overlooking Karl-Liebknecht-Strasse. The position is fantastic as well. This is always my first choice when I go to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “The most atmospheric 5 star hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: TravelfanCapri
Reviews.Content: The lobby is absolutely impressive, the bars and restaurants are always full with trendsetters and executives alike. The rooms are stylish and hip with all the comforts of an international luxury hotel; the service is great and the location cannot be be beaten. All in all this is a great trendy luxury hotel strongly favored by people from the music and fashion industry.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: francesca-b
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably-priced hotel, especially with the online deals we obtained from Expedia. We paid a little more to get a business class room in order to get the extras such as Nespresso coffee machine, ipod player, bathrobes, slippers and Cathedral view. Rooms weren't especially large but to be expected in European cities. They were extremely clean and the hotel was well sound-proofed: solid, quiet doors and no noisy corridors. Hotel restaurant was fantastic for breakfast (included in business class room) and very good for evening meals - "asian fusion" style apparently, a bit pricey but excellent quality. Location perfect for visiting Museuminsel, Berliner Dom, Alexanderplatz, river cruises. Easy walk to Reichstag. Teenage son loved the modern funky style of the hotel, gazing at the fishes in the lobby and the tandoori chicken! Only disappointed that free internet access only if you bring your own laptop.

Reviews.Title: “More 4 star than 5”
Reviews.Author: Catherine80
Reviews.Content: Berlin is an amazing city and one of the most interesting places we have ever visited. Unfortunately, this hotel was a disappointment from start to finish. The only good things about it were the location (which was fabulous and extremely convenient) and the maids (who were the friendliest people in the hotel). We booked the Radisson specifically because it was listed as a 5* hotel. We are both London teachers, we don't have money to throw around and we appreciate value for money. We prefer to spend a little more and stay in 5* simply because we like the facilities and service that come with it. This hotel is NOT 5*. Neither the service we received, nor the facilities provided in the room deserve a 5* rating. Check in was very unfriendly and unhelpful. The hotel lobby (apart from the aquarium) was tiny and distinctly average. The room did not provide tea and coffee facilities, robes or slippers, a good range of bathroom products, or any technological facilities other than the basic internet connection. During our stay we asked for extra pillows but were told there weren't any in the entire hotel. We are lucky enough to have in stayed in 5* hotel all over the world - this place simply does not come up to scratch at all. None of these things would have bothered us if we had booked a 4* hotel, expected 4* and paid accordingly. If however, you know what 5* looks like and you are specifically looking for that level of service and facility, then don't stay at the Radisson Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacationqueen1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend in a standard room overlooking the fish tank (the best feature of the hotel after all!). Our hotel was on 4th floor and had a great view of this and the lobby . ROOM: on the small side but really quiet and fantastically clean. breakfast: included as part of our package and was excellent but can't comment on value for money. STAFF: friendly and helpful. SPA: very relaxing and definately worth a visit into LOCATION: excellent - right next to Berliner Dom and within easy walking distance to Alexanderplatz and Museum Island with about a 30 min walk to the Reichstag. OVERALL: Definately would stay here again on my next visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond all expectations”
Reviews.Author: AlonaD
Reviews.Content: a very pleasent hotel, very tasetully decorated. the room was nice and cosy and very quiet, very well kept. the beds were very comfortable. the bath room was clean and modern. the service was great, very helpfull concierge. unfurtunately we didnt try the breakfast because it was a bit expensive but there are lots of restaurants and coffe shops near the hotel so it wasnt a problem. great location - close but not too close to alexander platz (great shopping places), 2 major bus lines near the hotel. i have to say that this was one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in. we had a great time. i am a travel agent and would defenately recommend this hotel to my collegues and customers. go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shan77
Reviews.Content: The breakfast spread was the highlight of our stay. You can also take the outdoor sitting and have a sit beside the river and enjoy your morning breakfast. We had a standard room that comes with a lot of storage space. Wonderful lobby as well. It is a delight to that the lift down to the lobby and watch the fishes swim in the huge indoor aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Great radisson hotel with a few extras”
Reviews.Author: adelenicola
Reviews.Content: As always very similar to standrads radisson hotels but has some great extras. Rooms are as standard in radisson large, very confortable beds, clean and modern. Great restaurant with outdoor seating which is lovely in the summer as has great views of the city. Modern lobby and large bar which is friendly and comfortable to enjoy a wine or two. Fabulous large aquarium which is a show piece in the middle of the hotel, nice relaxing pool area if a little small just watch out for the naked guests in the steam room. Would stay again for work and leisure

Reviews.Title: “I Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vbfan
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. I have traveled extensively throughout Europe and this was one of the best hotels I've stayed in. The room was modern and immaculately clean. The bathroom was large by European standards and the staff were extremely helpful, friendly and efficient. The hotel is right in the middle of all the action and we walked EVERYWHERE. There are cafe's and restaurants very close to the hotel and plenty of bars in the area for late night fun. The shopping was incredible, again, just a stone's throw from the hotel. I loved the breakfast and the bar was pretty cool too. Of course, the huge salt water aquarium in the middle of the hotel was an incredible sight. I will absolutely return to Berlin which is a vibrant and fascinating city and I will certainly stay at the Radisson Blu when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Pure pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Olga62
Reviews.Content: We (mother and grown up son 23 years old) stayed at the Radisson Blu Hotel in Berlin for two nights/3 days in the end of Aug.2009. Beautiful hotel in a very central beautiful setting across the small river from the cathedral Berliner Dom and most significant museums . Excellent designed lobby with the huge aquarium and glass elevators, modern rooms with the free internet and on-site recreational facilities that can be used free of charge - two types of sauna, steam room, massage showers, gym, aqua pool with the artificial current to increase your swimming efforts, all facilities are very clean and of a very good quality. Buffet breakfast had two settings - in the lobby by the aquarium and in the Heat restaurant with the access to the tables on the terrace that faces the cathedral. The selection was good with all types of cold cuts, cheeses, fruits, omelet cooked as you wish, bread, juices, coffee as you want...Check in/out was very efficient. Airport express for Tigel airport stops in about 50 m from the hotel, with the cost 2.40 Euro, no need to take a taxi. Lots of small restaurants in the area with the different price range, some funky places along the river. I knew before we went that the location is so central but could not believe how good it was with everything happening right outside the doors. Our room was 4133 (regular with two single beds that we pushed away to be somehow separated, it was easy). We had partial view of the cathedral, very nice and quiet at night, but very vibrant area at the day time.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist extravagance. Pure self indulgence!”
Reviews.Author: SolCutter267
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights here on the 6th floor, with a great view of the amazing aquarium in the atrium - this hotel definitely has the wow factor! Some of the best features were: the glass lifts, the big bathrooms and the souvenir shop in the lobby. Our room was typical of continental Europe where a double room was 2 single beds pushed together which was a touch disappointing. The bathrom was quite spacious, and the room has quite a lot of storage space. For a 5 star hotel though, no tea/coffee making facilities were provided in the room, and neither were robes or slippers. The location is a definite strength, being within a pleasance walking distance to the Brandenburg Gate, Alexanderplatz railway station and surrounded by all the major museums/galleries in museum. There are also boat trips from the river by the hotel, with buses and trams close by for getting round the rest of the city. The breakfast buffet was excellent with lots of choice of food, plus free daily German papers. The Asian-themed show kitchen restaurant was a lovely experience, though quite pricey. We found it a great base for our stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a real experience!”
Reviews.Author: js0754
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect as it was near lots of bars and restaurants but also incredibly close to the centre of town, and right next to a beautiful cathedral. From the outside the hotel isn't that impressive, but its all about whats inside. As you walk in the doors of the hotel it opens up into a huge tall center space, with a breath taking cylindrical fish tank. Hours can be spent sitting on your hotel room internal balcony attempting to find your favourite fish. Rooms are ultra modern, great bathrooms, and amazing hot chocolate! The only downside was the double bed consisted of two single beds pushed together. Each single bed had its only duvet, some may see this as an advantage but its not too romantic. Service is slick, and there is a great bar in the basement, that has a happy hour with cocktails. Pool is small, but the spa facilities are good. A strange requirement to be naked in the steam room and sauna, but we managed to sneak in with a towel. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, fantastic city.”
Reviews.Author: CityLoverWales
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed staying in the Radisson Blu. Obviously the aquarium in the lobby is a great feature, and makes for a really lovely background to a visit to the bar/cafe in the lobby. Good room too, spacious, clean, comfortable. We had a room with a view of the aquarium. (I think you have to pay business class to be sure of a room looking out). We really enjoyed the view though, and having the sound of all the comings and goings of the lobby when the balcony door was open. (Excellent sound proofing though!). Berlin as a city was great, and the location of the hotel is really good. Would love a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a difference”
Reviews.Author: cloudyal
Reviews.Content: The fish tank in the foyer is amazing but this hotel is excellent in every other aspect, Stayed here for 4 nights in July 2009. Took advantage of offer on Business Class rooms to endulge in a bit of luxury with magificent view form 6th floor. Good location for tourist visit, easy access to underground, river boats and within walking distance of many attractions. Hotel staff very helpful. Can buy tickets for underground and bus from the hotel. Public transport priced very reasonable and very efficient. Felt safe walking about at night. Breakfast was included in the rate and was excellent,

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: JFair
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend for a weekend visit to Berlin and had a wonderful stay. While it's more geared towards business people and not exactly romantic, it was nice for relaxing as well. The lobby and fishtank were nice to look at, and the location was convenient for sightseeing. The hotel is located just across from a park and also has some nice and affordable restaurants with on a terrace on the same block as the hotel. It was convenient to the Alexanderplatz UBahn and SBahn stops as well as within walking distance to many major sites.
