We never had a more silent room. Also in September 2006 the airco in the room was still on, fresh and very quiet. The breakfast was great but too expensive (euro 22/p.p.). From the hotel almost everything in Berlin is in walking-distance. The hotel is in the new center of Berlin (=Mitte). The traffic is rather quiet for a big city. You can easily rent and use a bike. A day-visit to Potsdam (with the S-bahn) is a must. A stay in this beautifull hotel is advisable.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the top hotel in the Radisson SAS line!”
Reviews.Author: xsollyx
Reviews.Content: Berlin is a big city - bigger than you think. So, my only caveat is about location: this hotel is nowhere near the great Ku'Damm shopping area. It's also a decent taxi ride from the main train station, the haubtbahnhof. Location issues aside, this is a wonderful, but VERY Scandinavian, hotel. I love Scandinavia and this type of fairly minimalist design hotel. I have stayed at many Radisson SAS hotels and none are as nice as this. Be warned, though, that this hotel is like very high-end Ikea. If you like older hotels, big heavy furniture and grand ballrooms stay elsewhere. Now all of the great stuff about this hotel: everything, really. Spa and gym are superb. Food is great. Staff is helpful and friendly. Room rates are much cheaper than they really should be. Rooms are clean - very clean. Room has a heated pants press, which is very useful (as I write this, I am wearing impeccably pressed - by me - wool dress pants). The water in the sink and shower is really hot and the water pressure superb. Small but nice plasma TV in the room - very good quality picture. So, from a weary world business traveler, this is a really good - exceptionally good - hotel. Do not hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Innovative & Modern.”
Reviews.Author: Gregi
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with innovative features tastefully decorated.. Good location. Good rooms - if a bit small. Very good breakfast. Underground parking.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - A tick in every box.”
Reviews.Author: Bronte68
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fabulous 4 night stay. The hotel is in an ideal setting for sight seeing, is extremely clean and the hotel staff cannot do enough to help/give you outstanding service. Nothing seems to be too much trouble. And the big plus point for us was how quiet the room was - this is something that is often overlooked in some hotels - not here, you don't hear a peep. They also play lovely relaxing music in the corridors - infact the whole hotel has a calm, tranquil feel to it. We didn't have breakfast included in the price and only stayed for this once - it was very good but we chose to spend our 22 euros each in other ways and just grabbed a cofffee/filled croissant from the cafe next door - fine. The spa/pool area is also very good - again, clean, calming and it smelt wonderful!! We had a meal at Noodle - one of their restaurants - fantastic - proper, authentic chinese/thai cooking. Wished we had tried Heat as well, their other restaurant - this always looked busy. Overall, this would be the place I would stay at again when visiting Berlin - they jusy got it right on everything. Well Done!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moi7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and though we had booked the 99 euro a night deal, we took the upgrade to the business class room which was even still at a great price. The extras included a room facing the Dom with our own balcony(great place to sit in the evening having a coffee or glass of wine while watching the boats drift by on the Spree), full buffet breakfast, espresso machine, free pay-tv, bathrobes and upgraded toiletries. Worth every penny! The hotel is in a great location and close to all major sites - we walked a lot but also got a great value 'day ticket' and used the buses and trains a lot also as Berlin is bigger than expected. The hotel itself is fantastic and the 'fish tank' just caps off the experience - we found the room to be a good size and well maintained and clean - staff were friendly and helpful - the breakfast kept us going until at least 3pm every day. Also the room had to be one of the quietest we've ever stayed in - we didn't realise how good the soundproofing was until I opened the balcony doors one morning early and was greeted by very loud building site noises...not even a whisper when the doors were closed and never once did we hear a sound from the corridor. We flew into Schonefeld airport and got the S9 train to Hackescher Markt for 2.10 each. The station was less than a 5 minute walk from the hotel and easy to find. Overall we found Berlin great value and very cheap to eat out in - you can literally buy food on the street for a euro or 2 and at night can eat out very cheaply even in the better restaurants. We plan on returning to Berlin sometime in the future and will defitnetly be booking the Radisson again.

Reviews.Title: “5* luxury at 2* prices”
Reviews.Author: petermh
Reviews.Content: we stayed 3 nights on the 99 euro per night deal ,this must be the best value deal around, excellent well equipped rooms ,courteous staff and spectacular building. OK, the breakfast is a ridiculous price but you don't have to have it, If you stay there take a walk across the park directly in front of the hotel on the other side is a picturesque area of cobbled streets with restaurants and pubs next to the river.

Reviews.Title: “great place - would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: brandenburg5
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying here. The rate on the Radisson website was very good, though the price of breakfast was high and that did increase the cost substantially. However, the breakfast really is excellent. The room is very attractively decorated, bathroom is nice, lobby is fantastic with the aquarium. We were on the street side but the sound insulation was excellent - didn't hear a thing. One tip: Alexanderplatz, the closest U-Bahn is a longish walk away (10-15 minutes) and is a big construction site. But buses 100 and 200 stop near the hotel, are very frequent, and take you to most of the interesting places in the city centre. Alternatively, walk to Hackescher Markt (around 5 minutes) and take the S-Bahn from there. We ate in the noodle restaurant at the hotel one day for lunch and it was fantastic. Staff here were helpful and everything just seemed perfect. Gym is also good.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Calm and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Spymon
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend here in August 2005 and found the Radisson a nice calm place from which to explore Berlin. The hotel is located very close to one of the bus stops for the airport bus which is handy if you are flying in from Tegel. It was very hot in Berlin during our stay and the cool and calm atmosphere of the hotel really helped. The lobby opens up in to a big aquarium which as has already been said looks a lot more impressive in real life than in the photos and feels only a step away from being a classic James Bond villains HQ. We had a room on the first floor and both my girlfriend and I were worried that it would be noisy as it overlooked the bar/breakfast area, however the room kept out the noise very well and unless you slid open the window you couldn’t hear a thing. The air conditioning in the room and hotel was excellent and helped cool us down after a day out sightseeing, plus the modern styled room had a cooling feel to it as well, this was very much needed after a long day out walking in the sun. The bathroom was nice apart from the mirrored toilet. We didn’t have any issues with the shower/sink. The two single beds had been pushed together into a double and were comfortable. The room also had a free mini guide to Berlin from the hotel which was a nice touch as was the big TV and tea/coffee facilities in the room which were nice first thing in the morning and last thing at night for a little bit of unwinding after a long day of walking. Food wise we didn’t eat at the hotel but there are some small cafes for picking up a cheapish breakfast between the hotel and Alexanderplatz station. There were a few little restaurants tucked in the walkway between the hotel and the adjacent building. We went to the pizza place there which like most of the other places we ate in Berlin cheap and good without being amazing, I don’t think we had any memorable food experiences in Berlin, it was very much like being in the UK (pizza, Thai/Chinese food seemed to be the staples, though plenty of places serving wurst and potatoes as well as large ice creams were quite nice and a welcome change from home!). The hotel is well set up for travelling through Berlin, the places you can’t walk to are easily accessible via the u/s-bahn lines that are very clean and frequent (like the new bits of the London tube). On our last day we asked at the hotel if they had any stamps so we could send our post cards, unfortunately they had run out but they did offer to send our post cards as soon as they got some which was a nice gesture. I would certainly recommend this hotel, especially if you can get some of the discounted rates; the value for money here compared to many other places of similar quality in other cities (just short of £70 per night in the end) it is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An early morning flight from London and consequently arrived several hours before the official check in time, but we were provided with a room immediately. That was very welcome. We were offered an outside facing room or a room overlooking the huge cylindrical aquarium. We opted for an outside facing room, hoping for a great view of Berlin. Unfortunately we were given a room with an unimpressive outlook directly opposite an office building and a shopping arcade below. Nothing scenic at all. Disappointing. Our room was compact, however spotlessly clean and very quiet. We never heard a sound from the corridor or the adjacent rooms, ever. The décor in the room is modern and ‘minimalist’. Very nice. Flatscreen TV was smart, but a bit fuzzy. But we didn’t go to Berlin to watch telly, so it didn’t matter. We had dinner in the Noodle Kitchen. It was delicious and not expensive. We made a reservation and were provided with our own table by the window overlooking the Berliner Dom. The restaurant staff were extremely attentive. The bar staff (especially one) in the bar directly by the Noodle Kitchen were wonderful. The reception staff and concierge are rather snooty, however. We didn’t eat breakfast in the hotel (so overpriced – there are several delicious bakeries very close by where you can have superb traditional breakfasts for far better value). They’re pretty mean on the toiletries for a ‘five star’ hotel – little plastic capsules of fruity flavoured shampoo & shower gels – yummy – but why fill the trendy container up with only 6 or 7 when there’s room for 9? Sounds petty, but it really does come across as stingy. Lower star hotels we’ve stayed in also offer razors, toothpaste, combs, etc… there was nothing like that. Not that we ever really use them, but they’re nice touches and come in handy if needed. The bed was comfy, but our ‘double bed’ was two singles pushed together – not very romantic – my husband found the gap in the middle very annoying. The Radisson is in the former east of the city and is well situated – U-Bahn, Alex & Hackescher Markt walking distance close by. The Berliner Dom is immediately opposite across the dark & still River Spree. The enormous aquarium is interesting. The fish seem well cared for as there were divers in the tank every morning swimming around maintaining the feature. I requested a platter of fruit and chocolates in our room and it was beautifully presented, and for 15 Euro well worth it. The hotel very kindly also provided a (free) birthday cake for my husband, which was lovely. I think what impressed us most about the Radisson Berlin is that, without asking, we were offered at checkout if we would like our luggage stored until we could come back later to collect our bags before our late flight home. Excellent. On Berlin – the transport system is incredibly efficient – and so cheap! Euro 2.10 on the trains – bargain! The streets are generally clean and we found the Berliners so friendly. Twice while we were in the middle of the street with a big map in our hands, locals spontaneously approached us with offers of help with directions. I tried to speak German in shops and cafes, but everyone just spoke back in English, and they were all full of information and eager to help us enjoy our stay. There were occasionally pockets of drunks around and street con artists on corners – but it’s a big city – it’s all part of it. Enjoy! Would we stay at the Radisson again? No. There’s competition from hotels in Berlin offering better value. Can see why this hotel appears to be slipping down the ladder of top hotels in Berlin on Tripadvisor. We visited the Kurfurstendamm and the Swissotel looked really inviting. Would probably stay there.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms but great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rogervidamour
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after staying in hotel concorde for my previous 2 visits and what a contrast! The concorde is modern, minimalist and understated with huge rooms and quiet. This hotel is much more lively and has an incredible reception area with the huge aquarium. Believe me it looks far larger and more impressive in real life than the photos. I booked under a deal at 68 pounds per room per night which is an absolute bargain. The restuarants in the hotel and bars are great and have a good atmoshphere. My only critisism is the rooms. While they are nicely done with flat plasma TV and great ensuite, fittings etc they are a little too small (im certainly glad i did not bring my 6 yr old daughter, there was no space for a bed for her in room). The location of the hotel is great for sightseeing around the old historic berlin. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin's Best Bargain”
Reviews.Author: rojersey
Reviews.Content: We spent last night in the Berlin Radisson after spending the previous 5 nights in the touted Arcotel Velvet. The 5 star Radisson is actually less expensive than the much more modest 3 star Arcotel. I found a deal at the Radisson website for 99 euros per night if booked 5 days in advance. This included all taxes and fees. I couldn't believe it since we had walked in and asked for room rates at the front desk and were told 160 euros/per night. It's an amazing bargain at 99 since the hotel is simply luxurious and wonderfully situated. Our sixth floor room had a broad and stunning view and every amenity that one would possibly want or need including particularly comfortable beds, free 0800 calls (the Arcotel charged 2 euros for the same), free internet with one's own laptop (again the Arcotel added a high fee for internet in the room although their bar did have two free computers for guest use) and to top it off a free continental breakfast (unadvertised but yours for the taking with yummy croissants, pastries, unlimited tea, coffee and orange juice). The Arcotel only offered a full paid buffet breakfast. Suffice to say this is a wonderful hotel and a wonderful price and no, I'm not a Radisson p.r. person, just a guest from New Jersey who had a brief but outstanding stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NigelD
Reviews.Content: After a three night stay I agree with much that has been said in previous reviews. The hotel is ultra modern with every facility and in a superb location. As a tourist and business hotel it rates well. However the design of the fittings in the rooms will inevitably lead to wear and tear and so it may be a matter of luck as to how perfect one's room is or not. Our meal in the HEAT restaurant was very poor but we fared better in the Noodle bar. Breakfast had a huge selection but I felt that the quality was a bit mediocre - but then that's what mass catering is about I suppose. Also the breakfast area was overwhelmed with business conference people when we we there, making it a bit of a scrum Fantastically helpful doorman (the one with the handlebar moustache) We have stayed in nicer hotels but it fitted the bill for a busy visit to Berlin due to the range of facilities and its location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the AquaDome”
Reviews.Author: mikey47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson SAS for 2 nights in March 2006. After reading reviews and looking at the website, we decided to treat ourselves to a Junior Suite. We asked for a high floor with a city view and what a view when we walked into the 5th floor room! The suites are at the corners of the building so we had 2 external walls and both were floor to ceiling glass. We looked across the River Spree at the Berliner Dom cathedral and the start of Unter den Linden. The central atrium of the hotel is sooooo spectacular with the huge aquarium dominating everything. Being only 2 years old everything is new and very stylish in a modernist way. Service is very good but breakfast, at 22 Euros if it is not included in the price, is not worth it. There is Andy's restaurant & bar left out of the hotel. River sightseeing boats leave every hour from justy outside the hotel as do the yellow sightseeing buses, turn left and go about 200 metres to the yellow bear. The Brandenburg gate is 25 minutes walk and the Richstag 15 minutes. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Service not up to expectations, room a little worn”
Reviews.Author: Santina_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Berlin for two nights and found the location perfect for business in the center of Berlin. The design is certainly spectacular in a very modern sense. There were two aspects which I found rather disappointing: The room had a slightly worn look, with chipped edges of the modern interior, marks on the walls and bathroom fittings which just had this worn feel about it, giving it all a somewhat cheap appearance. The design is smart and elegant, but not really practical. It was obvious that, walking with a stick, some help with my luggage would have been useful for me. Neither at arrival, nor at departure, was there anyone present who was able or prepared to help from and to the taxi. The service, and the attitude of the personell I had contact with was rather cool and certainly not forthcoming and helpful - not at all the level of service you expect in the class of hotel the Radisson claims to be. I did not feel particularly welcome, and will not stay at the Radisson again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on business for 3 nights, and I loved everything about this place, except for the restaurant Heat, which had a funny smell, and a really un appetizing menu, although noodles in the basement (lower area) was great. Rooms are comfortable, but surprisingly did not have down pillows, nor robes. Other than this, we loved it, oh, one other drawback is that you are in fact in East Berlin, so if you are planning on any major shopping in the west you are a good 20min. train ride from KaDeWe etc. keep this in mind when booking, but for the rate worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the best of locations”
Reviews.Author: TATraveller
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in Berlin and having stayed in Hackesche Markt last time we already knew the area was excellent in terms of access to transport and all the sights. By booking early we got a good deal at 120 Euros per night - a standard room plus access to the spa. Staff were excellent and the room very modern, spotlessly clean, a good size and very comfortable - even had coffee & tea making facilities which is unusual for a continental hotel. Our room was on the first floor, overlooking a small arcade with gift shops and restaurants (good Italian) which was fine. In the summer it might be worth asking for a floor higher up but given the double glazing and air conditioning all rooms should be quiet. The spa area was spotlessly clean and although the pool is not very big there are 2 large saunas, a steam room, aromatherapy room etc. We didn't bother with breakfast - there are coffee shops close by if you prefer smaller breakfasts. An excellent hotel - can't agree at all with the previous (negative) review.

Reviews.Title: “OK but with some minuses”
Reviews.Author: lektor
Reviews.Content: When we presented our pre-paid reservation through Expedia at the check-in desk, we were told that it wasn't registered. We had to make an expensive call on our cellphone to the booking agency in Norway to get a confirmation that everything should be ok, and that we should point out the booking code on our print-out. The check-in man then rang the hotel's reservation office and it turned out they had apparently forgot to forward our reservation internally. When we pointed out in so many words that this was something he ought to have checked out before turning us away and forcing us to make a 15euro call back home, he gave us free tickets to the Aqua land as a compensation. Never got the chance to use them though, preferring to spend our limited time on Berlin's many fascinating museums. Our room was a standard size business room, with a nice view towards a park and the Nikolaikirche. It was extremely well insulated against noise; a very important point since the street in front of the hotel is heavily trafficked at most times. In addition, just a stonethrow away, The Palast der Republik was in the process of being torn down. This was very noisy indeed, but with the window closed we heard practically nothing. On the other hand, there was a very tiresome muzac constantly being piped in the corridors. Made you practically run to and from the elevator to get away from it as fast as possible. Breakfast was not included in our Expedia booking, and we thought it was inordinately expensive. But no problem; there were plenty of opportunities for a very good and inexpensive breakfast within a couple of minutes on foot from the hotel entrance. The bathroom was very stylish in appereance, but at closer look, several design solutions were just very awkward. For one thing, the wash basin was a porcellain bowl placed on a wooden top. Absolutely a feast for the eye when new. But because of the constant spilling of water from handwashing etc, the wood was now cracking up and appearing very worn. Furthermore, the glass half-wall glued to the bathtub was inadequate when showering, with lots of water on the floor as a result. On the other hand, this inflexible halfwall must be a major obstacle for the room ladies when they're cleaning the upper part of the tub. A full-length shower curtain would've been a much better option. And then there was the awkward design of a single swingdoor functioning alternatively for the separate toilet cubicle and the rest of the bathroom. This door wasn't even full-length, so it must be a real problem for American couples with their hang-ups about bodily sounds when on the toilet. But to end on a more positive note: A plus for the flatscreen TV with many international channels, for the in-room coffee- and teamaking equipment, and, last but certainly not least, for very good beds.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: IRockOut
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, just across from museum island. We had the perfect view from our room of the Berlin cathedral and enjoyed the easy transportation with the bus and train systems nearby. We were even able to join a walking tour that started and ended just a few steps away. Staff was friendly and spoke English. Near several restaurants and even a McDonald's for the not so brave. We loved the modern touches in the room, like flat screen TV's and the shower soap was a welcome treat! We will absolutely recommend this to anyone looking for the best taste of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson SAS Hotel Berlin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked in for 2 nights on 14th & 15th February 2006. Left after the first night. Had a room over looking the “water & bar”. We left because even though we were on the 4th floor the noise from the main lobby bar area of the hotel from 8pm till well past midnight was “in the room” with us. Even with the double glazed windows you could clearly here the groups of people at the bar! Would we stay here again? If and when they stop the noise from bar reaching the rooms where the guest are trying to sleep then may be, till then, I’ll stay some were else when in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lewnatic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in early January. Atrium is something else - watch out for the divers each morning in the aquarium ! Hotel clearly stylish and appealing to a young(ish) crowd. Room was excellent - although not huge - and well serviced. All decorated in a bluish - aquatic - theme. Didn`t eat in the hotel, although the Heat Restaurant looked good - drinks were rather expensive - but that`s to be expected. We got an internet rate of 99 euros per night - well worth it. Location is OK - at the far east end of Unter Den Linden - about a tewenty minute walk to the Brandenburg Gate. Ther are a few restaurants around the hotel - mostly across the park in front. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start the New Year”
Reviews.Author: operaone
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Raddisson between 14th and 17th January. We were not disappointed. This is an ultra modern hotel - just as depicted in the advertisements and pictures elsewhere on trip advisor. The large aquarium in the lobby is the focal point of the hotel and goes some way to warming up the atmosphere of what could be described as an otherwise impersonal but very pleasant and efficient hotel. All staff were friendly, helpful and pleasant, adeptly switching instinctively it seemed, from German to English as required. Our room was not large but commensurate with the room rate and perfectly adequate for our needs during a weekend break. It was comfortable and quiet - we were never aware of outside traffic noise or that of other guests. The room was made up and tea/coffee facilities refreshed very promptly each day. The porter who showed us to our room was particularly helpful providing information about the hotel, location and Berlin's sights and went out of his way to provide us with bathrobes when they weren't included in the room rate. We ate all our meals in the hotel and sampled both 'Heat' and 'Noodle' restaurants - both excellent and not overpriced. Breakfast, although not included in the room rate was very good value and provided something for all tastes and diets (Atkins, GI, Low fat etc....the lot!) including full cooked breakfasts, cereals and nuts/seeds, several types of breads, cheese, smoked fish, yoghurts, fresh fruit and juices and prosecco. Kept us going 'til the evening! The atrium bar was quietly efficient and pleasant for an afternoon pick me up coffee and cake or for an after dinner nightcap. The only reason I haven't given an 'excellent' rating is that the hallways on the floors of the hotel were very bland and impersonal, rather in the style of a UK airport hotel. Other than that, I couldn't fault it. I wouldn't necessarily recommend it to those wanting out and out luxury in every respect, but for everyone else, it's great. Beware though, when the temperature outside is in the minus figures, you are likely to receive electric shocks from everything from the lift button, to the door handle to the cutlery!! It drove us mad! Re Berlin itself, plenty to do and see, all very interesting and I'd definitely return to the City and to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: resto
Reviews.Content: We stay four nigths to 28 dec to 01 january. The rooms was spacious with a nice wview on the city. The breakfast merveillous. The service was very well, everywhere everybody says Guten morgen. We comme again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shakey start, good recovery”
Reviews.Author: jogoderic
Reviews.Content: Initially, we were very disappointed because we arrived ~ 11:30 PM (with guarantee, because we had paid in advance), and the hotel had given our room away. They told us they were totally booked, so we had no room. We were furious! Fortunately, they arranged for a room for us at the Ritz the first night (I believe that's what it was), which was actually a nicer hotel. The subsequent nights, we were given a junior suite. So, all-in-all, the experience was a good one. The hotel is very modern, and in a wonderful location (right next to the Basilica). We enjoyed our stay very much!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again and again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Radisson SAS in Berlin with an "Ocean view" ie of the mind blowing aquarium and really enjoyed our stay. The staff were fantastic, the room was plenty big enough and with Free WiFi made the stay just that much better. I'd absolutely recommend for travellers to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: william1000
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in a very handy location, close to all the best sites. Arrived late on Friday evening 11-30 and wanted a beer from the bar in the lobby, unfortunately it had just closed, but we were offered a free glass of wine and directed to the bar in the basement. room was excellent with a view into the foyer and the fish tank. Strange to see diver in tank cleaning glass. We had a weekend deal that included an excellent brealfast and a 48 hour transport pass. Public transport works very well in Berlin, but you can walk to most sites. An excellent hotel with very good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaC
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel around 11am. Reception staff were very friendly and told us that they could give us a room immediately but advised us to wait until later when a room with a view of the cathedral/river would be available. We agreed and collected our travel tickets (part of our weekend deal) and went off sight-seeing. When we returned the room was ready and was indeed worth waiting for. A bowl of fresh fruit was provided along with tea/coffee making facilities - all very useful. Breakfast was included and was of an excellent standard with lots of choices available and our evening meal, in the Heat restaurant, was great. We had drinks in the night club and found it fairly reasonable (for nightclub prices). We reported a problem with the tap in our bathroom and although there was no-one available to fix it we were offered another room but we decided to stay where we were. We found staff throughout the hotel friendly and helpful and the location is superb. This was our fourth city break this year and without doubt one of the best hotels we have stayed in. I would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Building - Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a very promising reception, our room was disappointingly small for a hotel of this rating without any views. Not did it have any of the normal four-star features like tea-bags, biscuits, pillow chocolate etc. We had to ask for a bath robe. There was no bidet in the bathroom which had an awkward toilet cut-off door arrangement and they seemed to be on a cost-cutting spree here too as they did not replace all the shampoos and soaps daily. On the third day our key would not work and we had to traipse all the way back to reception to be told that our three day booking had mistakenly been entered as two days - for this they did not apologise - and we then were locked out of our room for a further forty minutes while they cleaned the room which they had not bothered to do earlier bacause of the check-in mix-up.The spectalular fish tank in the foyer cannot be entered via the hotel- you have to go around several streets to enter it - at a fee. All in all this hotel should be classified three star and they should send the staff on a training course in customer relations. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend at the start of October. The hotel was really lovely, very modern and extremely central. The food in the Noodle Kitchen restaurant was delicious for dinner. The reception area centres around the huge aquadome which is a definite talking point! We would definately recommedn this hotel for anyone looking for a nice break in the heart of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views overlooking the River Spree”
Reviews.Author: haz2468
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights here in a Junior suite. Wonderful views overlooking the River Spree and the Berlin Dome. We checked in early and had a late checkout, which extended our stay by half a day. Breakfast was superb, excellent weather enabled us to eat outside every day and evening, quite a romantic setting,service was excellent. The iced coffee and cakes were yummy. Quality of the food was excellent and not overpriced.Easy access to all place of interest and you can catch a bus from the Airport to the Hotel. Daily bus tickets available from the conceierge, much cheaper than going on the guided tour bus. You can buy a map that tells you what number bus to catch to all major places of interest. Bus service in Berlin is fantastic and prompt.We normally stay on the other side of Berlin near the Ka De Wa, but the Radisson is something else, the setting on the River Spree makes it more relaxing. The Spa swimming pool is on the small side, but we stayed mid week, so it was empty each time we used it. We will definitely stay here again. Most enjoyable stay and the staff very friendly and helpful, extra pillows etc brought straight away.A very relaxing Hotel, upmarket without being formal.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel”
Reviews.Author: unclejames
Reviews.Content: Now, I wasn't paying for this hotel, and have no idea how much it was. I didn't even check in - that was done for me. Given that, I can't really talk about value for money... but I can talk about the rest of it. 1. Offering wifi for free to hotel guests is a good thing. Nothing is more tedious than paying sometimes over 20 euros for a day's patchy and slow wireless connection: however, this hotel offers it free, and it's at least 1.5 meg, which was very pleasant indeed. Full marks. 2. The room, even though it didn't have an outside view, was stunning. (The view, incidentally, was of the big fish tank). They do the German thing of two duvets, and a nice flatscreen telly was good (for the English speaker, enjoy Sky News, CNN, and CNBC). And the tiled bathroom floor is heated. Niiice. 3. The big fish tank. 4. And it's a quick walk to Alexanderplatz, home of all thing public-transport. Highly splendid, and I'll certainly pay the (undoubted) extra to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Superb standard”
Reviews.Author: Ballydorn
Reviews.Content: We got a deal at this hotel which included breakfast, dinner one night, a boat trip and 48 hour travel passses. The breakfast was amazing. I've never seen a joint of pork on a breakfast buffet before. The overall standard was superb. There was a problem with our shower head, but a mechanic was there to fix it within 10 minutes. The Heat Restaurant was a bit dull and soulless for an evening meal and the service was a bit Teutonic. The bus pass was great because the 100 bus which goes along the Unter den Linden to the Brandenburg Gate stopped 200 yards from the hotel. The only difficulty we had was in trying to claim our boat trip. The concierge had no record of it on "the Computer" and it took a discussion with "management" to acknowledge our computer print-out showing details of our package. Our impression is that they have so many different deals they are unable to keep track of them. Nevertheless we would definitely stay there again. The location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wallyQ
Reviews.Content: Very Comfortable Rooms. Stylish Room interior. LCD TVs. Free Wi-Fi Access in-room. Nice Bathroom. Modern Lobby. Hotel is very new. Good Location. 5 - 20 min walk to Tourist Attractions. 5 min walk to Airport Bus Stop. Hotdog and Ice Cream place just around the corner. Radisson Hotel is Highly Recommended! Enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: MaturemanL
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Radisson SAS Berlin on a business trip to a trade show. Location is great -at the end of the Unter de Linden - both for tourists and for access for Business. Lobby is unique with the Aquarium,elevators are clear so u float up "face to face" with the fish. Service is typically German - no warmth but very efficient - I asked house keeping for extra hangers,concierge kept packages and messages for me etc. Breakfast buffet whilst adequate is certainly not outstanding and they could consider delivering a newspaper to the room. Room is very modern and relatively spacious with a 26" Philips LCD TV adding a touch of class. Bathroom had 6 flavours of soaps and shampoos - again ,a nice extra touch. Access to the floors is only via room key in the elevator which adds security but is awkward if you have visitors as you have to come down to the lobby to pick them up. All in all a very satisfactory hotel which I would not hesitate to use again. I paid 140 Euro per night inc breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in very good location”
Reviews.Author: LB1985
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Radisson SAS Berlin to combine a city break with celebrating a family birthday. The hotel is very modern and stylish, with almost minimalist decor. The most unique feature of the Radisson SAS Berlin is the cylindrical aqaurium (five storeys high) in the lobby, which houses one million litres of water and 2500 fish. It certainly provides something interesting to look at when in the lobby, the bar (located under the aquarium) or in the lifts. The rooms are clean, airy and very comfortable, with two single beds (pushed together to form a double), individually controlled air conditioning, 23" flat screen LCD TV, minibar and three telephones (two in the bedroom, one in the bathroom). The bathroom was bright and clean, with a bathtub and shower. Breakfast (which was included in our rate, but otherwise charged at €21) was in the form of a buffet, and very diverse, featuring amongst other things, champagne, omelettes made to order and a very good selection of breads, bread rolls, hot food, etc. The restaurant HEat also served a range of tasty and reasonably priced dishes later in the day, and a number of delicious cakes. Overall, I cannot fault the hotel. The atmosphere is very pleasant, the hotel very light and airy, and the staff are very helpful. The location is great, opposite the Berliner Dom, a few minutes from the TV tower at the Alexander Platz and a stones throw from Unter den Linden, the Brandenburg Gate a mere 10-15 minute walk away. I would not hesistate to stay here again when next in Berlin. LB, London

Reviews.Title: “Deserves the title of top hotel in Berlin...”
Reviews.Author: AUTravellerSydney
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel located next door to the Museum quarter in the east. What can I say but wow! The room (Business Class), like the hotel, was very modern with a fresh design and had an amazing view to the Berlin Cathedral across the river Spree that runs beside the hotel... spent the first night whiling away the hours on cocktails enjoying the view across the river and the Berlin skyline as day turned to night In terms of location, if you are in Berlin to explore the Pergamon, Unter Den Linden, the Brandenburg Gate and Reichstag by foot - you are perfectly located. A major train station is located just down the road at Alexanderplatz giving you access to both the S and U Bahn trains (so easy access to Tempelehof Airport)... a great club called Berghain is also 5 mins away if you're there over a weekend. Enormous indoor aquarium has instant wow factor right down to the nice room touches of flat screen tv and funky bathroom doors... definitely worth the high votes from other Trip Advisor reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sdn123
Reviews.Content: This is a very large, new hotel in a great location for seeing the sights of Berlin. It is directly across the river Spree from the Berliner Dom (Cathederal) and museum island. There are both u-bahn and s-bahn stops within a couple blocks and the bus to Tegel airport stops a block away. The aquarium in the center of the lobby is a bit of a gimick, but the hotel is done in a very nice minimalist / modern theme. The rooms are nicely decorated with big windows.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location with Radisson SAS”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located for all the sites in East Berlin. We very easily took the TXL bus (which stops 200 meters from the front door) to and from the Tegel Airport. The staff was courteous and friendly, fluent in English, and excellent at providing directions. We had a great view of Museum Island and the Berlin Cathedral out our balcony. Also, I must say the ammenities smelled fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cropwell
Reviews.Content: Would thoroughly recommend this hotel. Arrived at hotel early in the morning after early flight from UK, did not really expect to be able to check in to room, but the check in staff sat us down in the reception and provided us with a cafe latte's. This gave us the opportunity to admire the fish tank in the reception area and take in the wonderful ambience. I am not always a fan of modern design but this is an example of where it really works.20 minutes later we were in the room! We had a wonderful room on the 5th floor with a magnificent view of the river spree and Berliner dome. Hotel is well located for sightseeing. We stayed on a Berlin cruise package which was good value at 398 euros for two nights, river cruise, 2 day rail pass and one night meal in restaurant.Very nice restaurant. The hotel has a lovely pool &leisure facilities and the staff are really helpful and friendly. This hotel puts London hotels to shame for price ,quality and service!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: TRAVGRL
Reviews.Content: I was stayed here from the 27th -the 31st of May. There are many positive things about the hotel. The location is wonderful. You are next to the Berlin Dom, the sea life center and the spree river. All other major attraction is about 15mins away. You can take the 100 & 200 buses which stop a block away from the hotel or just walk. The S-ban & The U-ban are also very close. This is a great starting point to explore the both east & West Berlin. The hotel staff is very fluent in English and very knowledgeable about the city and what’s going on. The rooms are very clean and up to date with there fixtures. I stayed in a business class room on the sixth floor. You have a bed, 2 night tables, a TV (flat screen), well stocked mini bar and a safe. The hot has two restaurants, a bar, and a gym. Breakfast is served till 11 in the heat restaurant. The have a large variety of food which was great but if this is not included in your hotel package stay away. Its 25Euros per person other wise. A few things made my experience here good but not great. The lobby smelled. I think this was because of the spree river but there is a rotten egg smell that takes over at times. The smell never made it pass the lobby though so the room smelled fine. Though clean the rooms are a bit bare, they were a bit cold to me (some may like this). My bed was supposed to be a king but it was two twins put together. If you rolled you would fall through the cracks. There was no universal adapter in the room. They did provide me with one when I ask but in a 5* hotel I expected one to be there. Lastly housekeeping came to the rooms as early as 7:30. To solve this problem I put the Do Not Disturb sign up till I left the room in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Air conditioned splendor on Under den Linden”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While I was participating in a business meeting in Berlin in late May, the weather turned increasingly hot. Since Berlin is usually humid and since few facilities in the city are air-conditioned, I was lucky to be a guest in this very modern, comfortable, and air-conditioned hotel. Its standard rooms are not necessarily large, though they are very well appointed and (at least on the side facing an alley) quiet. The 5-story lobby acquarium is a fascinating touch, which residents of the hotel can gaze at as they ascend to their rooms and descend to morning breakfast: The elevators, elevator doors, and elevator shafts mainly consist of very clean glass. The staff are very pleasant. I have certainly stayed in Berlin hotels offering better breakfasts, but visitors from most countries will find the breakfast buffet to be plentiful and excellent. In a six-night stay I seldom ate any meals except breakfast in the hotel restaurants, but they seemed to be good - - serving a mix of European and Asian-influenced dishes. For visitors mainly interested in seeing the famous sites in the city center (formerly the westen side of East Berlin), the location of the hotel is excellent. The famous #100 bus stops right in front of the hotel, and one seems to stop at the hotel about every 10 minutes during most of the day and early evening.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beautiful Berlin”
Reviews.Author: M1azza
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect. The people are friendly and efficient. We were upgraded to a business class room which was fab, views over the Berliner Dom. The aquadome in the hotel is a real feature. The location is great, easy to get to all Berlins main features and easy access to the station for the S Bahn. The Restaurant Heat in the hotel is really good, though a little pricey compared to elsewhere. A tip for those who enjoy Italian, round the corner from the hotel, to the left, is an italian called Peretti, it is really reasonably priced and the food is fantastic, u can sit in or out. Also you can get to the hotel really easily from the Airport by train, which only costs 2 euro as opposed to 35 in a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome in every way!”
Reviews.Author: eProducer
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. Let's start with the location. It's right next door to the Berliner Dome, Nikolaiviertel, Museum Island and many other top Berlin attractions. Then there's the hotel itself. Have you ever seen an aquariam that's six storeys high? Well then check out the one in this hotel's atrium. Very impressive, but believe me, there's nothing fishy about this place. (Yuk-Yuk) I'm more of an old world hotel kind of guy; nonetheless, I was very comfortable in the modern, minimalist, yet very warm ambiance of this hotel. Of course, the staff is friendly and, more importantly, helpful. It has very comfortable beds, high-speed internet access (for a price), flat panel TVs and for you lightswitch freaks, you can turn off all the lights in your room right from your bed. It's a great place to return after checking out all that Berlin has to offer. I know there are other hotels that may be grander and more established, but when I come back I'm staying here. It's unique.
